description:
Great little pizza shop for by the slice or whole pizza to go. It needs a little more work to be better than Delfina or Marcello's but they are still quite enjoyable. 

The kids drawings everywhere is a nice touch for the ambience.
author: Art W.

description:
This pizza is definitely 5 Stars. Za knows what's up, with a crispy cornmeal crust that's to die for. 

Small place, with an easy-going vibe.
Some beers on tap too. Check it out.
author: Gaya G.

description:
Za Pizza has become our neighborhood spot for giant slices, cheap brews, and fun service with the local sports game on in the background. After moving to the neighborhood recently, this has become a near weekly visited spot for me. They have some pies you can order, and also slices of Cheese, Pep, and then 2 specials of the day, one of which usually has meet, one does not. I have never been disappointed by a slice, or the extremely personal service.

Za is small, with about 6-8 barstools and 4-5 tables, so be aware of that. I should also note that is it not the gourmet, small, brick over pizza, but deliciously greasy giant slices. I will definitely be back.
author: Megan L.

description:
Where the heck have you been all my life?
Cheesy top and crusty bottom. You can take my $6 anytime.
author: Huey N.

description: Great pizza and great "local spot" vibe. Enjoyed sitting at the bar with a glass of vino while we waited for our takeout order. Guys were cool and friendly. Not a five-star review because we tried to call ahead to order take out and the phone would ring and then disconnect us.
author: Joanna J.

description:
I'm obsessed with Za! It's a no frills tiny little pizza establishment nestled on boujee Hyde. I like that they add some no frills flair to this neighborhood filled with hoity toity french, italian, and spanish restaurants. 

Za won't break the bank and for reals they have some of the best pizza in the city. I don't know how many times I've eaten at a fancy pizza place only to be disappointed because they literally just toss salad onto your pizza and charge you an arm and a leg. Za does pizza the right way at least!

My favorite is the potato pesto. Oh my goodness. I didn't know what heaven was until I met you. 

The mash up of potato with pesto and cheese on a crunchy yet soft and perfectly thinned crush is just magnificent. You have to really love potato to enjoy this but the great thing is the spuds aren't overwhelming at they're sliced thin and come out of the oven perfectly soft and chewy and melt in your mouth. I mean c'mon, how can you not love this combination? 

Giving this place 5 stars despite the wait sometimes and lack of seating. It's well worth it though. I would grab a slice to-go and walk eating. I wish they had the potato pesto on the per slice option but it doesn't seem like they do. 

I could eat a whole potesto pie if I was left to my own devices.
author: Connie M.

description:
I don't like thin crust pizza typically that much ..but .but..this place is pretty darn good.

I went with a slize of the:
Olive Oil $6 - Baby Spinach, roma tomatoes and feta cheese

And I have to say that I'm a big fan.  The taste was very good , flavorful and filling. Large slice in terms of quantity as well. 

The service here was top notch as well and you feel a very neighborly "Cheers" like atmosphere where everyone knows your name. Perhaps it's the location in a residential neighborhood. But the employees are very welcoming and even said goodbye when I left in a very friendly tone to a complete stranger which is cool and not typical.
author: Rod M.

description:
ordered a pizza .. never got here .. called 20 times & no answer.. so here i am.. waiting for the frozen taquitos i put in the oven to cook as a desperate measure .. bcs im hungry, and pizza-less 

like wow u guys really ghosted me
author: Vivian B.

description:
Ordered delivery and the person who took our order was pretty rude. Delivery was on time. 

Pizza was great but there are a ton of options in the city with friendly staff.
author: Wendy K.

description:
Visited this place for the first time in SF. Was there late, around 10pm. Service was fast, and food was good. My only complaint is that it took us 20mins to find parking.

The place is small, only about 4 tables, the price is a little pricey, but it's worth the size and quality. Personal turn off was that they don't offer ranch and no sodas with refill. 

We ordered the large pizza, with chicken, mushrooms, jalapeños and pepperoni. Took about 10minutes for the pizza to get to our table, and man, this was ZA pizza! It was huge for two! It tasted fresh and the quality was delish. I would bring my friends here.
author: Isaias P.

description: I've order 2 (Medium & Large), 2 toppings  pizza while staying at a local motel in the city. The pizza was okay, not really tasty nor fresh.  Will try another pizza place when we go back.
author: Derrick F.

description:
After a long day of morning meetings and driving about 7 hours from LA to Sf... I was pretty hungry. Luckily the hotel was just down the street from here. I really didn't know what I wanted to eat and with only a few places open this looked like the best bet. I took the steep hill walk to za pizza and it was worth it.

I got there probably a few minutes before they were closing so they only had a few pizzas left. We got the Da Vinci and Moma...I think. The pizzas came out pretty quick and I have to say it was pretty damn good. I took it to go and just ate it as I walked back to the hotel. I like the thin crust and big slices they give and a good amount of toppings.

I was actually pretty surprised how good the pizza was. I'll definitely come here again when I'm hungry in Sf... It's a good late night meal and the staff is super nice and chill.
author: Cory F.

description: Love this neighborhood spot. Solid slices. Solid dudes. Good beer and wine. No pretension, and the salads are pretty awesome too.
author: Lauren G.

description: Nice authentic pizza. You can taste the fresh garlic all over it. I dont remember the name of the pizza we had but it had pepperoni, ground sausage, mushrooms, olives, chopped garlic, tomatoes and green onions. It was a sturdy thin crust. It was made to order and cooked as we waited. The staff wasnt very inviting when we walked in but were helpful if asked questions and friendly after we ordered. There is a small bathroom onsite which I was very happy to know since we walked from pier 39 to get there. Those were some steep hills to get to that pizza. Not my favorite pizza but it was a good pie. It seems like a nieghorhood spot. If you go you will enjoy it.
author: Kelson P.

description:
Pull up a chair and order a slice of piz-ZA. 

This is a no frills neighborhood joint. You know know the place but you haven't found it in SF. All the other spots cater to tourists and 2am crowd. 

4 stars for the pizza, service and atmosphere.
author: Anthony K.

description: Delicious pizza! So worth the walk. Great service too! We love NY style pizza & this is just like it.
author: Myriam G.

description:
Enjoyable enough.

Big pizza with reasonable price. If you guys are big eater, this is the place. Do not expect careful service or clean interior. This is a place to eat pizza out and go quickly.
author: Jun O.

description:
Horrendous customer service when calling for delivery. Person seemed completely F*d up or otherwise disinterested. Had to repeat address, cc number and other things 3 times, and not bc it was loud in the restaurant. Asked for my pizza order to be repeated to me to make sure, since everything else he'd gotten wrong, and he sighed and acted put upon to do so. Good thing I did, bc he's gotten that wrong also! This is not inexpensive pizza, so when it's delivered it better be right or I'll be leaving another review. This one about quality of pizza and timing of delivery. Just double check everything if u call in bc something is totally up with their order taking person!


Ok, just got the pizza. Wonderful delivery guy.horrible pizza. Not even hot. Very little cheese. Waaay overpriced for what it is, and such poor quality. Hard pass. Order from somewhere else. Thank me later.
author: Amy W.

description:
This gem of a pizza shop is located in Russian Hill right off the trolley. 

My husband and I walked in. The workers glanced our way and kept making pizza. I wasn't sure where to order or what do so I stood back and observed. 

This pizza parlor seems to be where all the locals go. They walk in, shout their order to a guy on the right (behind the counter), get out of the way and pay after eating. It was a little intimidating at first, but there one guy wearing a Petaluma hat who was kind and made the experience significantly better. 

Besides that, Za Pizza excels where it matters most: Pizza making. Their crust is thin and cooked to perfection. The sauce is uniquely spicy, and the proportions of cheese are on point. All in all, this place is flavorful and delicious.
author: Val D.

description: Super friendly person taking orders by phone. Limited delivery, but pick up is available usually within twenty minutes even during peak hours. May want to take someone to stay in the car as finding parking can be challenging. Really tasty thin crust pizza with many pre-set options and add-ons available. Favorite though is their cheese pizza.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Review for Vegetarian: If you are visiting SF and need a non-touristy place to sit down and grab a quick bite, Za Pizza is the place! After walking up and down the steep streets of SF, we were relieved to find this tiny little pizza shop that has been running since the last 30-35 years. Great thin crust cheese and spinach & mushroom pizza, quick service and lots of drawings on the wall(by kids) to admire as you eat. The owners are up for a conversation too if you are seated at the bar. Located close to the tourist spots, finding a parking spot can be a bit painful though.
author: Malavika S.

description: Amazing! One of the best pizza spots in SF. The menu is simple but custom pizzas can be made. You can get pizza by the slice and the wait time is 5 minutes or less.
author: Kaela T.

description:
They hardly ever pick up the phone, and often hang up on me after I say "hi, I'd like to order a...". They've never hung up on my boyfriend when he calls from my phone, which makes me think there may be some misogyny behind who they choose to hang up on.

Giving two stars because the pizza is good, but the customer experience bites.
 
This is what I had said previously before experiencing this issue:
So gooood! My favorite neighborhood last minute bite! The crust is always perfectly crispy. I love Za!
author: Ania M.

description:
Walked by while visiting the city with my wife and it was slammed busy, which typically means the food/service is on point! Called in a pizza for pick up later that evening and it was delicious enough for dinner, late night, & breakfast the next morning!

Staff was friendly and literally were slicing the pie I ordered in exactly 20 minutes which was the time they quoted me over the phone! Way to go team Za Pizza, keep doing pizza right in Russian Hill! Cheers!
author: Bry M.

description: They have got a really small place! Barely few tables . But that doesn't even matter, since they have got great pizza for wonderful price and super friendly service! I would any day want to head back to this place for more. For pizza by slice they have got - cheese and pepperoni constant and one extra veg and meat option which changes!.
author: Navya S.

description: The most delicious neighborhood spot. Large slices. Fresh. possibly the best pizza in SF. It is a hole in the wall with a cozy bar and the biggest large you could order. Deliver is free. A few tables outside. This one is a must.
author: Maya K.

description: This was the 6th pizza place we tried on our 4 day trip to SF and it was my second favorite overall and first favorite New York style.  The crust was fantastic with a great crunch that was able to withstand several toppings.  We shared a slice of cheese and a slice of combination.  Both were excellent.  Next time we make it back to the city I will definitely make a point of stopping in here again to relive the quaint, by the slice joint on a quiet unassuming block.
author: Gena L.

description:
This is the single best pizza place in SF!

I highly recommend the Potesto (Potato + Pesto) pizza. I can't get enough of the whole cloves of garlic and cornmeal crust.

Pizzzzaaaaaaa!
author: Alec B.

description: This is hands down my favorite pizza spot in SF. Maybe even in the bay area. The owner is a little goofy but he definitely brings out the character of this place. 10/10 would recommend coming here after drinking too many denogginizers at the ferry building
author: Caitlin S.

description: They might have good pizza, but after the absolutely abysmal service I received here I will definitely not come here again. Their guy working the register could not affectively communicate what pizzas by the slice they had and then told me that I could not place an order for a pizza to go because they were too busy. When I asked for clarification he was uninterested in talking to me anymore. I don't understand the attitude, but I will happily take my business elsewhere. I work in the service industry and have no patience to be treated so rudely.
author: Stephanie E.

description: This is probably the best pizza in SF. However, their service and ordering process is a cluster fark. They miss orders, they incorrectly enter orders, their phone disconnects you and they forget when they put you on hold. This isn't an isolated experience, I've been there a handful of times this last month. Please improve because your pizza is legit!
author: Jack B.

description: Pizza is fantastic. Thin crust, not overly sauce, perfectly cheesy, delicious flavors. There is always cheese and pepperoni available and there is always one veggie and one meat option that rotate per week. Today, Wednesday, we have the sweet treat for meat and veggie daze, which is what I had. The Monday meat is one of my favorites. If you're lucky, you can score one of the outside tables at night to cool down, but sitting at the bar and chatting with the guys is cool. The dudes who work here are real, down to earth, friendly guys who really know their customers well. They're hard working, genuine and also relaxed and willing to chat, which is another reason I come here. Usually listening to music like  Metallica, Fleetwood Mac, you're sure to find an awesome sound going on. I could easily stay here for hours. Love you guys!
author: Leyna S.

description: Pizza is delicious. Good beer. Not to much to say about cleanliness and service. But it's ok for a quick meal and go. Ingredients should have been roasted a little bit more for my taste and u guys should be more in to your customers. That said go get a pizza in here.
author: Solrac E.

description: Amazing pizza and offers something unique to the neighborhood pizza scene. One big slice in-house could fill you up and they do pick-up and delivery as well. No frills pizza and customer service, but the taste is mouth watering.
author: Sarah H.

description: Very very tasty pepperoni pizza. I like it so much. The owner is a very nice person and very accommodating. Will definitely recommend.
author: Erica J.

description: We hit this pizza spot every time we visit SF. Great spot with a local vibe, cable cars buzzing right by, and great beers on tap. Oh, and the pizza is delicious!
author: Andrea C.

description: Pizza is awesome but the customer service is terrible. The guys who work here usually unplug the phones when they get too busy so people can't place orders for delivery. I wish I could give this place more stars but every time I go to pick up my pizza, the people who work here always make me regret that I spent my money here.
author: Alan T.

description: Very large slices! Great quality. YUM
author: Hiba Z.

description: This place is great! I stopped by today and it was 73 degrees outside!!! They set up a table in the middle of the sidewalk for us so we got to enjoy our pizza and fort point park in the perfect weather. Delicious pizza and great beer on tap. Kinda spendy ($5 for a slice - kinda big but meh, it's russian hill..), but I didn't pay, so no complaints here!
author: Angela L.

description:
Delicious. The single slices are HUGE (with a price tag of 5-7 dollars to match). The crust is crunchy and not too heavy. 

We got a salad with homemade basil dressing and the dressing was reminiscent of pesto but lighter and without the powerful garlic flavor. 

Definitely worth every penny.
author: M G.

description:
Hahaha so I had a very interesting experience here. This pizza is good, couple beers to choose from, lots of regulars come in and come by to hang out. The workers are awesome, friendly, talkative, good sense of humor. 

I had gotten a slice of the olive oil which came out hot and had a good flavor to it. Had a beer to go along with it. Then a situation happened, had to get away. I could recount it to you but well... Outing people on a public forum isn't reaaaaaaally my thing. Thank goodness for friends in the area. He was my captain save a bro in this case God bless his heart. Afterwards, I came back and had a good ole time sitting and chatting at the counter over some beers which made my evening. It felt like I was at a friends place, except they made pizza and had beer on tap. 

I'll definitely come by again to hang out and see the guys again.
author: David C.

description: Pizza was delicious.. I'm from nyc and this establishment bested some of nyc best pizza places.. the feta spinach slice was delish.. the crust is infused with something that gives it an amazing texture and taste
author: Ryan G.

description: We brought our 6 kids here after a day at the exploratorium. Everyone doubted my choices as we were very hungry and passed several other great smelling places on the way, but Za did not disappoint! The pizza was generous in portion, delicious and fresh toppings, and reasonably priced. The guys working in here were so patient and kind to our large family, it was well worth the trek up the hill and a great end to our day in the bay.
author: Cassandra H.

description:
Awesome pizza. My boyfriend and I wanted a less touristy pizza place while we were visiting in SF and came across Za. We stopped by on a Tuesday night around 7ish for dinner. As with a lot of SF restaurants, seating is extremely limited, and we were lucky to get the last 2 seats at the bar.

The beer on tap was great, the Caesar salad (we got a small, perfect size for 2 people and came already split into 2 plates) was decent but I've had better. The pizza was amazing. I got a veggie slice ("Veggy Daze"), my boyfriend got one veggie and one meat + veggie (I forget what it was called). There is nothing I love more than pizza slices the size of my face, and Za did not disappoint. The toppings were fresh, the sauce was delicious - just an all around great slice!

I'd definitely recommend Za!
author: Samantha O.

description:
Small pizza gem in the city of SF. They make daily specials of different types of pizza. We got the sweet treat (sausage, basil, some other items) and the veggie daze (a bunch of veggies).

The pizza is thin crust and comes in plate sized slices. The guy was courteous enough to offer to cut our slices in half and split our salad into 2 bowls so my bf and I could share. 

I loved that the garden salad came with green / red bell peppers, mushrooms, and tomatoes. The honey mustard dressing is the way to go. Za Pizza, you're amazing!
author: Jessica L.

description:
If you're looking for a good thin American slice in SF, Za is your place. This thin pizza has a nice crunch while also having some tasty subtle sauce. 

They always change up their specials if you want to spice it up from the staples of cheese and pepperoni as well.
author: Ian G.

description: I've been coming here on and off for 15 plus years.  Staff is always nice and I love the featured slices for sale each day.  It great to have a thin slice alternative in Russian Hill and it's close to Swensens ice cream for a casual dessert after your meal.  It harder and harder  to find good casual places like this in the area and I hope the stay open for another 15 years and beyond.
author: Robert C.

description:
Food:
Za Pizza! I'm a regular here now and I still haven't gotten a chance to give them a solid review. Firstly I'd like to say, I have an unhealthy obsession with pizza, delicious pizza. Because I've been hanging around Russian Hill more often now, I've really gotten to know Za's. Every slice is just amazing. Honestly, one of my favorite family owned pizza spots in San Francisco. Za's never fails to deliver and fulfill my constant pizza cravings. (I have Za's at least once a week now, I tell myself I should enjoy life to the fullest.) Though they don't do custom order slices, they do have a pretty tasty menu offering variety. My favorite is still the regular ol' cheese and pepperoni. 

Service:
The owner is really nice and so is the rest of the staff! They really like getting to know their customer base.

Atmosphere: Super casual and family friendly! This place is always packed with the cutest kids and dogs...you can find the epitome of cuteness at Za's. (They're dog friendly.) They have a ton of drawings of previous pizza eaters hung on the walls, which I can't help to stare at every time I visit. Though they're a smaller restaurant, people are coming and leaving constantly. So it's not too bad of a wait for a table. 

If you're in Russian Hill and craving pizza (aka always) check out Za Pizza!
author: Stefany Z.

description:
No-frills, small neighborhood pizza restaurant that offers both pizza by the slice (changes daily) & whole pizzas. 
I would recommend either coming here with only 1-2 people & find a spot at the bar to enjoy a slice and a beer and watch whatever sports game is on TV. There's not much seating, so would be hard to guarantee a table if you're coming with a larger group. 
The drawings covering the walls are cute & quirky decor and I always love looking at the new additions each time I come. The pizza itself is great. 

- 1 star because the ordering process can be a little messy/stressful (no real space to stand while waiting, a little confusing where to order at first, etc.)
author: Catherine S.

description:
Stumbled into Za Pizza with my 2 daughters, and decided to give it a try. We were hungry, and this was the closest thing open.  Za PIzza is a cute hole in the wall of a place, with lots of customer napkin art work on the walls, and limited pizza choices. I suspect that changes every day, but last Saturday it was cheese, pepperoni, or veggie pizza. I asked if we could have a slice of mushroom, and the man at the counter - he was very nice - said no. My 7-year old daughter later looked at my veggie pizza and asked: If they have mushrooms on your pizza, why couldn't they make mushroom pizza for me? Good question!

The pizza was served piping hot and it is good. The bottom is crusty, the cheese cheesy, and the toppings fresh. They also have beer on tap, and was surprised to see one of my favorite recent beers Trumer Pils.
author: Massimo M.

description: I was dying for Pizza and this place delivered literally and figuratively to my hotel. Alittle on the pricey side but for San Francisco $30 is the norm for a small. It was worth every yummy bite.
author: Lisa B.

description:
We ordered pizza and salads for a class today. Brooks made sure we had just the right amount, delivered it right on time and everything tasted great. 

Thanks!
author: Joseph S.

description:
Amazing this place has the great reviews it does. I would rate it above freezer pizza, below mall pizza. Don't you people know good pizza? The crust was tough, very tough, sauce was tasteless, and cheese rubbery. 
Rating based solely on pizza not the fact that we asked for the check and were told one minute but after waiting five went to the counter and paid only to see the guy that told me one minute at the laundromat across the street as we walked up the hill, ha ha. Maybe we caught them on a bad day, but with the options available in the city we won't be back.
author: Tracy H.

description: Hole in the wall location in posh neighborhood. Owner very friendly and warm. Menu has two items: pizza and salads. Both are excellent. I grew up in Brooklyn,NY, so I feel I can talk pizza. Fresh and quality ingredients. Inexpensive. Top endorsement
author: Lou V.

description:
Friendly & warm service. Great pizza. Very cute &
Creative drawings on the wall - enjoyed looking at each one of em. We had the meat Monday & vegetarian pizza. Good small pizza place to have a good slice or
Chill outside (they have 2 tables outside)
author: Hester D.

description: The pizza is fine but it is not so good, the dough is not authentic and the tomato always kills the taste. But the place is very nice and cool.
author: Zaïd P.

description:
This place is what you're looking for. 

No gimmicks. Just great pizza.  Don't be so suburban and order only the toppings you like, try their own pie recipes and prepare to be amazed

This place is hard to beat for simple pizza done extremely well. The Scaliano is a pizza lover's dream topped with spicy sausage, Roma tomato, fresh garlic, and green onion. INSANELY good. 

This place is small and crowded and I would never expect good service here, but they do that just like they do their pizza, unexpectedly excellent!

They have four tables and a bar so this place fills up fast.  Yet when I came here, I was asked if I had been helped by no less than four people. One waiter worked all of the tables and was on top of his game despite the workload.

This place doesn't played game when it comes to pizza. The room left over?  They fill that with pizza-making prowess second to none in San Francisco. 

Get in here!!!!
author: Skeeter S.

description: Hmmmm... Neighborhood joint with Amazing delicious pizza and BEER  Super friendly customer service. Overall Awesome service and A+ Pizza. A must pop in place while in San Francisco.
author: Alelia V.

description:
Oh, Russian Hill. 

Why do you make me work out for food? Don't I burn enough calories just shivering in my thin sweater in the SF Fog?

Guess not. 

Since the slices at Za pizza are HUGE, I think I would've have to work out more.

There are only 3 choices for pizza slices at Za's. No substitutions, no requests; but yes to cheap eats and yes to fresh ingredients. Mine had italian sausage, red & green peppers and onions. Filling and delicious at only $4.60 a slice! We were served like kings .. and queens.

I say "YA!" to ZA.
author: Janice C.

description: Love this neighborhood spot, both for delivery and for dining in. If you eat there, they have about 4 tables, cozy bar seating (about 6 seats) with a small tv and some good beers which pair well with a slice. Slices are large, and I like their preconfigured pies, especially the Scaliano and Salvador Dali. The salads are just okay - sometimes the caesar salad is a bit watery. Other than that, great vibe and good pizza.
author: Robyn B.

description: Happen to be in the neighborhood and dropped by for a sick pizza lunch. We were surprised with the best pizza that we had in a very long time! Keep the quality, we are coming back.
author: Isaac S.

description: Best non-coal fire pizza we've encountered.  Casual neighborhood vibe. Local brews.  Super friendly staff.  Recommend a side of their delish honeymustard sauce to accompany the bread crust.
author: Alberto P.

description: Love this place. Great neighborhood pizza spot. Fun to snag a slice, drink a beer and catch a Giants game.
author: Nick C.

description: Such good pizza by the slice! I can't stop thinking about it! The servers are so friendly and make you feel welcomed and like part of the family.  Unfortunately I don't have any pictures because we ate it so fast!
author: Helene O.

description: One of my favorite places to grab a quick bite in Russian Hill. Has a good community vibe and a couple tables outside for dining on a nice afternoon or evening.
author: Nathan B.

description: Ignore the negative reviews for Za unless you're just an overly sensitive person. Yes they stop answering their phones when the tiny kitchen reaches peak times and yes the service can be matter of fact when everyone is slammed. The big but is that you need to see the beauty for what it is without the negativity. Za is a no frills neighborhood pizza joint that welcomes both locals and tourists alike. The setting on Hyde St. is quaint and the pizza is solid, so let's not get elitist folks.
author: Mitchell M.

description:
Definitely all that it's hyped up to be.  Pizza was great and the employees are cool too!

I got an italian sausage and sun-dried tomatoe pizza and it was really good.  I will definitely be coming back.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Best pizza! Their pizza by the slice is a must for a quick dinner or late nite.

Seating is limited but you can always get slices to go at the counter
author: W R.

description: I've been to NYC, and ZA pizza is by far the best pizza my daughter And I had here in California. The sauce is subtle, the crust is crispy! We were greeted in and out, the server constantly checked on us, great customer service :)
author: Frances C.

description:
The pizza here sure is something! They do not skimp at all with the toppings, and the pizza is tasty... not to mention humongous. One slice is not enough for dinner, but I'm stuffed if I finish two! At two slices, dinner can get a little pricier than expected for pizza slices. With the amount of ingredients they cover the slices in, I guess it's probably sufficient to get one slice with toppings and one without, hm....

Considering their place is constantly full at all sorts of dinner hours, I wish they could warm up the slices faster or at least set aside some room for people getting take out. When there are multiple people waiting for food there, you will basically always be in someone's way.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Found this little gem on Yelp as we were here on a road trip from LA. Awesome, friendly atmosphere! Create your unique art and have it hung on their walls for all to see.  PizZA  is great here,  recommend the meat combo!
author: Rosie P.

description: Decided to go here after walking to Lombard Street.  Perhaps the best little neighborhood pizza shop I have been to in a very long time. We ordered one of their specialty pizzas, the Moma. Delicious!!! The guy running it spoke with us and knew all the regulars passing by outside. Give them a try, you won't regret it.
author: Laurie W.

description:
There's places that are highly reviewed by a gazillion people on Yelp because they're destination spots, + then there's places with identical acclaim because they're awesome local favorites. Za Pizza--a small hole-in-the-wall shop https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/za-pizza-san-francisco?select=M4d4MDRQ9qCzNqsRfPrOfA hidden between a dog groomer, Pilates studio, + a wedding dress boutique in Russian Hill--is one of the latter. 

I stop in for pizza by the slice for lunch on occasion because it's only $4.75 per slice. It's absolutely a steal of a deal as the slices are pretty huge + the guys here are heavy handed with the toppings. When I say huge, I mean bigger than the plate https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/za-pizza-san-francisco?select=cAa8afCdwHlsMV0RoJf5WA. Nowhere else in this area can you get such a quick, hearty lunch (or dinner) for under $5!   

The trick to their efficiency is their limited menu of only 4 different kinds of pizzas daily: Cheese, Pepperoni, a meat variety + a veggie variety. The 4 options are written on a board at the register, + then they warm up your choice in a matter of minutes. To be honest, I don't particularly have a favorite type of pizza here as I'm usually content with whichever meat or veggie selection fits my fancy at the moment. It would be difficult to have a favorite anyways as the options are always different + Za doesn't post their daily menu on a website or social media as far as I know. Unfortunately slices cannot be customized, but I suppose that's what keeps them quick. I have yet to be disappointed though as the ingredients are fresh + the crust is always nicely crispy. On my most recent visit this week, I was pretty happy with my slice of Sweet Treat (Italian sausage, artichoke hearts, sun-dried tomato + basil) https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/za-pizza-san-francisco?select=kNpsT3hmTMbeSFgziCPaew.

If you're looking to get a whole pizza, check the website to see the 7 specialty pizzas that they have available for ordering ($23.30 medium, $28.35 large) or you can customize your own out of a selection of 22 toppings. 

Interior seating https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/za-pizza-san-francisco?select=oZIU8xJgi4i3W4TCWf7kAg is limited to a few tables inside + stools at the bar so this isn't the type of place you'd stay to hang out a long while in. Anchor Steam is always on tap along with a couple other options + there's a TV usually playing a sports game up in the corner. I've seen a few families here + the lovely artwork covering the walls is an overwhelmingly apparent local stamp of approval. If it's a nice day out, sometimes they'll have a small table out on the sidewalk, or the Hyde + Vallejo mini-park (https://www.yelp.com/biz/hyde-vallejo-mini-park-san-francisco) a block away has a few benches you can sit at. Afterwards, if you're jonesing for something sweet, there's plenty of neighbors to hit the spot; Swensons old fashioned ice cream, Loving Cup froyo/rice pudding, Lush gelato, Basik Cafe acai bowls, Batter bakery, Teaspoon boba/shaved ice + The Candy Shop gourmet candies are all within walking distance. 

Parking in the area isn't too bad during the day but pretty impossible in the evenings. They deliver within a close radius as well.
author: Janelle Q.

description:
While it isn't deep dish (I'm from Chicago), I highly recommend Za's Pizza! This is our favorite place in the City to go for a slice or a full pie.

Things to note:
1) They normally have four options for Slices each day. It varies from $4 to $5.
2) They have full pies and their own specialities - ie. Vincent Van Dough (what I recommend)

I would recommend eating it at there - just note: they don't have much seating. If you are a group of five or more, I would definitely look towards take-out or letting them know in advance.
author: Saagar G.

description: Great pizza, huge slices, awesome service. In the neighborhood of Russian Hill, away from the super touristy parts of SF. Also, won't break the bank. Highly recommend.
author: Kristina H.

description:
Atmosphere: 1/5...tiny place thats always busy... everyone is kind of just scattered, very disorganized and chaotic. However, the kid drawings on the wall are cool. 

Customer Service: 0/5 Workers don't give a crap about their customers here. They are oblivious to what is going on... had to ask for ingredients that are already included in our pizza order. We called in once and were put on hold for 20 minutes!

Pizza: 4/5...hate to say it but I really like their pizza, however I would rather go to Escape from Ny on Polk street for the consistency, the better customer service, and their pizza is just as good.
author: Reese E.

description: Fucking dicks work there! Looks cool and artsy but zero customer service even to the locals like me who've been there 9+ years. The help changes hands like their skate and surf boards so does their service and attitudes - daily .. This place used to be an SF staple. I hope some rich FoMo buys it up and serves real hospitality, not when it's convenient.
author: vanessa k.

description:
Ordered Za through Postmates and got two completely different pizzas than I ordered. 

To make good, they refunded me the cost of toppings. Dafuq? Basically a huge f* you to us. Like "hey you ordered the fillet but I'm I'm giving you the ground beef. 

Pizza is about a 3.5 (it's pretty good just isn't amazing; which is great for SF) but receiving 2 cheese pizzas when you wanted toppings on both is unacceptable. Even worse is they didn't even attempt to correct it after calling it out.

If your ordering online just roll with Tony's.
author: Danny B.

description: Perfect place to stop to grab a bite to eat. Pizza was delicious and the Monte salad with balsamic dressing with just as yummy. We split a salad and two slices of pizza it was the perfect amount. Not to mention the slices were a good size too. Would definitely return next time I am in the area!
author: Laura D.

description: What is with this place? We went for the first time tonight and bizarre is the adjective most salient. I approached the counter and the guy helping us told me they were out of pepperoni and one of the specials. I proceeded to make another selection and then he told me it will probably be about ten minutes before they make the two pizzas they were out of. Mind you he's bustling about behind the counter so it's not a very clean interaction. Happy to hear it would be a short wait to get the slices we really wanted I order and expect to wait. The guy then tells me that it could be 15-20 minutes or more and he would not accept our order? WTF! The pizza maybe good but this is SF Boys, the land of food.
author: Kellen M.

description:
Actually - KEEPING IT TO ! START SIMPLY BECAUSE NOTHING HAS CHANGED 

Updated because the pizza is good, but the guys on the phone and for delivery SUCK. 

I just called, they complain that I want a medium cheese pizza and I want it delivered and paying with a credit card. Seriously, do you KNOW why you are in business AND have a job? It's because people like me have  yet to find a better local place to deliver. If GIOIA on Polk Street delivered, you guys would be looking for work.
FXXXERS. SERIOUSLY. DID YOU EVEN GRADUATE grammar school? Or is it simply you have no manners?
author: Sharon M.

description: Favorite pizza spot in the city.  Prices are reasonable and staff is super friendly.  I always come in for a slice whenever I'm in the area.  It's great that they change the option daily and I haven't been disappointed once.
author: Daniel W.

description:
By far the best Pizza I have eaten, ever.
Parking is typical SF.  Uber is a good option.
author: David M.

description: The owner (I assume) greeted us with charisma and warmth. Asked if we were from the Bay and made jokes about us being from LA. Aside from that, the pizza was incredible. The perfect amount of crunch and the right kind of melt on the cheese.  For a second, I considered taking an extra slice back home!
author: Avery A.

description:
I rarely give 5 stars. This place is a "home in the wall" pizza shop. AMAZING thin crust pizza for a fair price. 
My fiancée had the pepperoni pizza and I had the divinci. Both amazing.  
If you're in the mood for pizza this is a must go!!
author: Michelle L.

description: Best pizza in the area!! Whole in the wall and it makes a great spot! Very busy at night! Delicious crust and wonderful staff! Go in, there is history on the walls and enjoy that with their fresh slice of pizza!
author: Eugenia S.

description: Out of control great pizza. Warm friendly service.  Hot Fresh and yummy.  Could not ask for more. Great location to sit outside and take it all in
author: Reed C.

description: This is our favourite neighbourhood pizzeria. Just awesome, delicious pizza with some unique specialities. The Potesto is not to be missed!
author: Daniel A.

description: Za Pizza is a small friendly neighborhood pizza joint located in the Russian Hill area of the city.  We were headed to a wine bar and needed to pick up some dinner on our way and stumbled across Za Pizza.  We sat up at the bar and was greeted with a friendly hello and provided with menus.  The walls are plastered with various drawings of creative pizza, I'm assuming done by customers.  These provided something fun to look at while waiting for our food to come out.  They also had a tv with football on so that's convenient if you want to catch a game too.  You can get pizza by the slice in traditional flavors or their specials for the day.  They also have Medium or Large pizzas made to order.  We got a large pizza to go and a beer to wait.  I appreciate when a restaurant will do half and half even with different sauces and this place was accommodating.  We did a half Scaliano and half Salvador Dali.  The pizza was okay, but wasn't a standout.  I also asked for a side of ranch and unfortuently they do not have any.  They were able to give us parmesan cheese, red pepper flakes, and plates to go.
author: Stacey C.

description: Pizza is good, but staff is sorta rude. We initially tried to order delivery or for pick up, but the phone line would either be busy or just continue ringing without anyone picking up. No big deal, I don't live too far, so we walk in the rain over to the restaurant. The restaurant is small with limited seating, but it was full. There were a few customers by the register and we all waited a few minutes before anyone paid any attention to us. One guy appeared to try to pay, but when the staffer realized the guy was eating in the restaurant, handed the credit card back and told him to deal with his server. He wasn't much friendlier to us when we ordered our pizza. That being said, the pizza is good and I would go back again. Perhaps my friend and I are porkers, but a medium pizza was barely enough for two of us. Would order a large next time.
author: Annie L.

description:
Honestly, the guy at the cashier with a cast on his arm is rude (other reviewers here can confirm). He was rather impatient in explaining that take out would have to be eaten outside of the restaurant. Sorry, we were visiting for the first time, and it was pouring outside, so chill out please.

The pizza was good (da vinci + roma d'light) and $5 slices are huge. I did have to drink half a gallon of water afterwards though, so it's probably full of salt.

not sure I would be back. Pizza is 4 stars, service is 1.
author: Mingmei N.

description: There is no better pizza pepperoni. No bigger delicious pizzas like their large. Tiny place but best pizzas.
author: Tone B.

description:
Can't believe I haven't heard of this place! The workers are great! The pizza's delicious! 

Came here with my two sisters are having a full lunch. I know.. three girls with a big stomach... We can eat all day! To tell you the truth, we did walk up that crazy hill to get here. One major SF hill can cause an appetite! 

We ordered a slice of Veggy D-light (red bell peppers, mushrooms & green onions) & a slice of Sweet Treat (italian sausage, artichoke, sun dried tomato & basil). The nice worker that got our orders offered to cut the slices into 3s for my sisters and I to share. So thoughtful of him!

Boy oh boy! I love how thin it is! It's not oily like the other pizza places. The toppings were abundant. The flavors were great! Would definitely come back for a whole order! YUMS!
author: Jane C.

description:
Great pizza in a small local neighborhood restaurant.  We tried both the pepperoni and Sicilian slices.  Very tasty with a crispy thin crust.  This  was a trial run for ordering several delivery pizzas for a group of friends tomorrow  at our home 8 blocks away.  I sat at their small bar and ate the pizza right out of the oven.  I saw these guys work hard and deliver a quality product.  I also saw them preparing their fresh made pesto sauce.  Loved the smell of the fresh basil.    We  will be back again many times.

PS Yesterday, I tried a four star competitor who also delivers, from their California Ave business.  Crust was dry and flavor was lacking.... musta been a bad nite for these other guys.  Za Pizza won our business and our taste buds.
author: Ted M.

description:
1 star because the pizza is good. First time I came here was great service. This second, and last time my friends and I (4) were treated terribly. 
Walked to the man behind a register and he didn't regard us at all. Looked right past us. After 5min I asked if we order here. He said "at the register." there was another one. Waited a moment, another man asked for my friend's order and "for here or to go" there was no seating available so I said to go. 
Friend 1 replied "2 pepperoni" the man didn't hear and barked "what!?" (The place was loud) my friend repeated then I was sharply asked for my order, and then my 2nd friend. We were given our checks and I asked "we'd actually like to eat inside since a table opened up, if that's alright"  The man replied "not normally. if someone comes in they're gonna want to sit down" and then looked away. Another employee followed up with "it causes confusion." We were confused because we are those people coming in wanting to sit! My 3rd friend stood there disregarded until after we all got our pizzas and he had to ask for service. 
I had to tell friend 1 who sat down already that we aren't allowed to eat here. We waited outside in the cold for friend 3 to get his pizza.
Friend 3 filled us in on what happened inside:
He got his pizza and was still waiting to pay. A customer behind friend 3 asked an employee if he could order. Employee said "you have to wait in line" (behind friend 3) then the employee asked friend 3 "what do you want" friend 3 replied "I want to pay for the pizza you gave me!" Paid and left. All confused and angry for the service we were given.
author: Sean W.

description: The pizza is 5 stars. The service is 3 stars. I didn't come for nice people behind the counter, but it's not cool to be treated like an interruption the staff when you're trying to order/pay/get your pizza. I've been three times and it's the same each time. Will go back for the pizza. Hope they treat their customers better in the future!
author: Chris B.

description: Hands down best pizza in town! The staff is super friendly, the pizza tastes amazing, and what I personally really love is that it is more a local than a tourist spot. The area Russian Hill is pretty awesome too!
author: Anne-Kathrin S.

description: Great pizza!!  Should be five stars. But don't bother trying to order anything after 9pm. Their response is always "the kitchen is closed". Why say you're open till 10 if the kitchen is closed at 9?  Otherwise delicious pizza prior to 9pm. You have been warned.
author: Christy D.

description: This place is very small but the pizza and service was great.  We ordered a sausage Specialty Pizza and the crust was cooked perfectly.  I was only going to eat one piece but snuck another bite because it was so good.  Hubby is a New Yorker and like it just as much as we did.  If your looking for a dive pizza place that sells by the slice and has draft cold beer, this is your place.
author: Lori M.

description:
Called at 6, pizza was supposed to be ready at 6:30, came at 6:40.  Pizza not ready, checked back in at 7:20,  pizza still not in the oven.  Told them to cut the order.  They told me "OK SEE YOU LATER".

I get it that their busy but don't be rude to the locals.  The food is mediocre at best and you're going to be rude to a local patron.  Cmon figure it out
author: Kyle A.

description: This place is simply amazing. I live a block away and have no self control so I'm here about twice a week. Brooks is a gem and he has a knack for hiring. Everyone that works here is rad. And this is all apart from the pizza which has me drooling just thinking about it. Thanks guys. You rule.
author: Erin W.

description: This is (for anyone who knows San Francisco's Russian Hill) the go to place for last minute dinner. The staff are incredible, pizza is great - our favorite is the Scaliano - and anything with nectarines or other ingredients is a good choice. Order the small salads, and only before 7p - afterwards the heat of the place has the greens being a little tired. Much better and miles less pretense than Gioia and a collaborative Escape from NY Pizza. We've never been disappointed. And the large is always your best option ... 2 to 3 meals worth for two people. The credit card machine is very rickety ... but amazingly I've never been forced to pay cash.
author: Christopher F.

description:
Living just down the street really lucky there's such an amazing neighborhood friendly joint only several blocks away. 

The pizza is delicious, the slices are huge, and they have some nice beers on tap. It's small and gets really busy (honestly there are always people here) but the service is still pretty quick. Couldn't ask for more out of a neighborhood pizza joint. you can do half/half if you want to try different flavors too.
author: Lucas S.

description:
Really good pizza, wonderful service. We got pizza by the slice, and had one of the meat ones (Sweet Frank) and one of the veggie ones (I think it was a classic Margherita). Both were delicious. 

Cool, low-key, delicious pizza place. Staff was super friendly. Really glad we found this place and stopped by for some later afternoon pizza. Yum!
author: Jenn C.

description:
Za is one of the first gourmet pizza joints in SF.

NY style.

Cornmeal crust.

And the potato pizza.

It's potato, pesto, & garlic, called potesto.

They've been doing this potato pizza since back in the 90's.

It developed quite the following in the hood.

Their straight cheese always hits the spot.  The Van Dough is great, too.  But it's hard to divert from the potesto.  It's perfect when you want something deliciously different.

Service is awesome.  Cool & hip before hip developed the attitude & wasn't cool anymore.

They love to rock out here.  So if good music's your thing, this is your place.

Sometimes all you want is to sit at the counter in an unassuming place, & have a cold beer & some good pizza.  This is the place for that, too.

It's a small neighborhood joint.  If you don't know it's there or you're not looking for it, you can easily miss it entirely when you're driving by.

All this, plus they deliver.

A favorite Russian Hill vet still serving it up right.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Small little pizza spot with excellent service and really great pizza! As well as great salads too! The large salad is more than enough to share between 2 people. We even had more than half of mine to take home with us (my hubby and I split it). One slice of pizza is huge! It's like eating  2 slices in one lol. Really good though!! Price was very reasonable:) Well definitely be back
author: Jessica M.

description:
Is there no decency or honesty left in this world? Ordered a pizza over the phone; price on the website read $28.35.  When I went to pick up the pizza, I was told that the price was $32 and over $34 with tax. The guy working the register casually told me that their prices had changed and was completely indifferent to helping us. He refused to honor the online price without consulting a manager (who of course wasn't present) and told us that we were welcome to leave the pizza.

I cannot support a business that lacks any semblance of a customer service orientation. On principle, I left without the pizza. And I won't be going back.
author: Annie K.

description: Za pizza!! After my husband and I drove down Lombard street we became hungry and searched for a near by place to grab something to eat and found this little gem! They serve large pizza slices and have cute/awesome art work around the walls. We got to meet the owner of the place and he was very nice. Thank you for treating us like family!
author: Christina E.

description: Pizza was good, staff was very friendly.  Restaurant was very small but that's ok.  Only complaint would be they played rap music the whole time we were there.
author: Chuck C.

description: Their staff was rude! They were more interested in taking to each other or watching the game, and also I've NEVER been to a pizza place that doesn't have ranch! Overall experience, I definitely will NOT be coming back here again!!!
author: Vaping H.

description:
My boyfriend and I have very mixed feelings on this place, so I'm giving them a middle of the road rating and will write out both of our perspectives. 

My boyfriend loves pizza. If he had to eat one food the rest of his life it would be pizza. He loves more of a New York pizza, and in his eyes any pizza is pizza worth eating, but doesn't see a ton of value in more of a Neapolitan style pizza over others. He also really likes Za Pizza and would probably give them a 4. 

I also love pizza, but to me it's more of a treat and I want a really good frickin Pizza if I'm going to eat it. I love a good Neapolitan style pizza with a lighter flavor. I do not enjoy Za Pizza because it's too hefty and heavy handed on flavors. But I still eat it on occasion because I love him, even if I most definitely do not love their pizza. I would probably give them a 2 and feel really bad about it because they are super nice. 

Hope this helps!
author: Ally S.

description:
Honestly, it's a 3 1/2 star, but I decided to round down with the place. I visited this place while on a date... It was very crowded when I came, and was pretty small as well. There isn't much room for people. It's not the cleanest place either. We were waiting on this table and someone came over to clean it up. As we sat down I realized that I had to clean up the table a little bit myself because there was some oil and crumbs and stuff like that. Not a huge deal but it needed to be noted. The pizza itself was a little above average. Both me and my date got the bluto, and it was slightly above average. Nothing from that pizza jumped out at me and wowed me. It good, and I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the pizza. But overall, nothing was too memorable from this place. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. 

Bottom line: If you're in the area and you like pizza.. Check it out. But otherwise, don't go out of your way for this place.
author: Derek W.

description: My go to pizza place for sure. Consistent high quality, no delivery issues, and awesome vibe inside. Support this neighborhood business!
author: Amanda W.

description: I simply love pizza and when I found the za pizza I was delighted with both the service and the pizza thank you for the great service I highly recommend!
author: Gabriela G.

description:
Awesome pizza. Thin crust style - if you like a bready crust, this might not be your favorite. Ingredients are very good and the pizzas are consistent. 

Atmosphere is very casual. Makes me feel like I am in a college town. The opposite of corporate. Love this place.
author: John O.

description: SUCH good pizza, and by the slice too! The toppings were delicious! It was also pretty quick and the space is funky if you want to dine in, although they're happy to give it to you to go as well. Recommend all around, especially if you live nearby like me. I'm bound to become a regular. They're also open pretty late too, so make for a good bite after drinks.
author: Ana M.

description: I recently stopped in with my family on a visit to San Fran. I used to eat here 20 years ago when I lived in the neighborhood. Still as good as I remember! Pizza done right. I also appreciate that they were super friendly to all the out-of-towners who were eating there.
author: Peter M.

description: Perfectly done, crispy, crust. Seriously delicious and flavorful tomato sauce. Sumptuously and correctly proportioned toppings. Decent price. This place has just made it to the top of my list for pizza.
author: Karan J.

description: Excellent pizza! They offer their specialty pizzas as well as a "create your own" option. Very small & casual atmosphere. We dined with two children so we were looking for something convenient. We had quick service as well which was fantastic on an empty stomach. I did see delivery boys running around so it seems as though local delivery is an option.  Overall an awesome experience as a first timer.
author: Alicia S.

description: Awesome place with neighborhood friendly people!  Worth popping in for great pizza off the trolley line.
author: Caitlyn C.

description:
The service here on its own gets 5 stars. My friend was asking about their beers and they immediately brought us both samples of all of the beers and filled us in on the back stories for all of them. When we were leaving they all personally made said goodbye to us. 

As I said before, the potesto pizza is unreal amazing. If I could, I'd eat it everyday
author: Jenn T.

description: Went there again last weekend, and I stand by everything I said a few years ago, and that's saying a lot. The cornmeal crust pizza still excellent, the service was friendly and helpful, and the parking was still nearly impossible. A warning to all:  Any pizza you place in a cardboard box will taste like the box it came out of. If you care anything about pizza, you'll want to eat it on-premises, hot out of the oven.
author: Richard A.

description: Friendly staff, and the slices are giant! I ordered two slices because I thought it'd be small, but I barely finished it. Comparable to New York slices, maybe even better. The restaurant itself feels very homey.
author: Kris E.

description: our go-to Russian Hill pizza order for delivery. The house made sausage is delish.
author: Beth P.

description: This place was great! We had a big group for such a relatively small place, but the owner (I believe he's the owner) was very receptive to us and arranged seating for us. The service was good!  The pizza was huge and quite amazing! It's probably the best pizza I've ever had! I loved how kind and receptive the owner was. Will definitely visit again if I return to SF.
author: Care P.

description: Met the owner who gave me a flyer saying that they do delivery. When I called a week later, he was very rude. saying that diamond heights is too far to deliver to saying "it would take me all day to get to you"...I am 5 miles away. He went on to say he delivers only 1 mile, that should be on what he hand out then. Fake advertisement.
author: Julianne D.

description: Za pizza makes great pizza. The pesto & potato is fabulous. The staff is friendly,funny and has a sense of humor. We've been taking our daughter to Za sense she was a toddler. She turned 16 on 4th of July and wanted to take a group of her friends to Za for lunch. We called Za the night before and they said come on by we'll make it work and treat her like a princess. They were true to their word. She got to make pizza and they rolled out the red carpet. Many thanks to the crew for the wonderful experience and the delicious pizza.
author: Vicki S.

description: What jackasses. They think they r the pizza nazis. It really sucked.  And they r rude.
author: karin b.

description:
They don't pick up their phone. Therefore, they don't deliver. 

We tried calling during open hours for several hours. 

Bummer!!!
author: Karl R.

description:
I've just moved to the neighborhood, literally around the corner from Za and was very excited to try this spot out. I've heard awesome things about it and the reviews are all wonderful. Disclaimer: This review is not about the food itself cause the pizza is DAMN delicious. This review is about the service I experienced - particularly from one employee. 

It's a Friday and it's dinnertime -obviously it's a busy time and it's made very apparent that it is busy when we walk in. We come in and we start talking to a couple costumers/locals about the neighborhood, etc. I order a Specialty slice to go and shortly after my friend orders a couple more slices and some beers while we wait. We sit and drink our beers and chat with some people. I am in no rush about my order, as I am just chilling with my beer and having a good conversation. My friend who ordered after me receives his two slices (about 30 minutes after ordering) and aforementioned employee says, "We've run out of the Specialty pizza but it's coming up," so we wait for my slice a little longer. Again, I'm in no rush so it's fine. However, I begin to see people coming in and getting the same slice of pizza to go, after only waiting about ten minutes. It's when I see families who have come in long after me receiving ENTIRE pizzas when I go up to the register and ask how much longer it would be for my slice, which at this point as been an almost hour wait. No one responds to my questions- but I do see a slice placed into the oven to be warmed up and one of the cooks responds jokingly, "You'll have to wait another hour." I walk back to my friends, confused but hopeful that my slice is on its way. The employee comes up to me and says, "No one took your order." No apologies, nothing, and walks away after I stated that he in fact took my order and my friend's order as well. I have my receipt out ready to show him when he comes back with my slice and proceeds to say, "You shouldn't wait an hour before telling us that you're waiting" and shoves my pizza into a bag. I, shocked, respond, "I was being polite and I knew you guys were busy so I didn't say anything." I've worked in the food industry before, I know how it goes when it's busy and how awful it is to get complaints from customers during those time so I make it a point never to be the person to complain, no matter how long the wait is. To point out, I never did complain - just simply inquired how long it would be. He insincerely apologizes and as we are walking out, I can hear him complaining about me loudly to the other employees. I, somehow leave the place feeling bad about the entire situation. 

I am just so disappointed with my experience here. I was really looking forward to having this be my neighborhood pizza joint but I have no desire to step foot back in there. I am especially disappointed because the pizza is sooo good and the atmosphere is awesome. Honestly, if I had gotten a sincere apology or had not felt like I had made the mistake in this situation, then I would not be writing this review. In fact, I have never written a Yelp review before but this entire experience has made me feel awful that I felt it was needed. If anything, this review is for that employee so he could learn from his mistakes and hopefully handle a situation like this differently in the future.
author: Natalie B.

description:
Great neighborhood pizza place, and the best part ; watching the cable cars go by while eating.

We ordered medium of the Salvador Dali and the Vincent Van Dough.  The crust was thin and crunchy unlike other places..  I felt the VVD was a bit plain, but that was a friend's choice and not mine.  I loved the SD. The fresh pesto gave the pizza taste.

downside -- horrible parking, but what do you expect for Nob Hill/Russian Hill
author: Angelica C.

description: Cool environment,  the pizza is great and vey big slices.  Costumer service is good as well. Prices aren't bad and we were just really happy with the experience.
author: Anthony P.

description: Came here at 10:30 on a Friday night to grab a couple slices of pizza on our way back to our hotel.  Their yelp page says they're open until 11 PM, but apparently that is NOT true because when we walked up to the counter to order, we were told that they were closed.  The guy said we could order some slices to go, so we got some and waited a few minutes while they heated it up.  We then tried to eat at one of their tables outside, and he was literally taking the chairs away as we were eating because they were "closing up."  He was very rude and made it 100% clear that he wanted us out of his way as soon as possible so he could go home.  The pizza was good, but don't treat your customers poorly and have an attitude because you're advertising the wrong business hours.
author: Morgan H.

description:
Delicious, affordable thin crust. 

The one time I was by, it was late at night. I struck up a conversation about the Lonely Planet sticker they had, and next thing I knew, I had a whole pizza in my hands. I'm not saying that you're guaranteed a full pizza if you're charming enough and it's late enough at night, but Za Pizza is staffed by some very fine people.
author: Jane H.

description:
We usually order from here once every two weeks. If life is hectic, it's more like once a week. Fortunately Za doesn't feel particularly unhealthy so it's a (mostly) guilt-free indulgence, which is more than I can say for other pizza joints.

My boyfriend is in love with the Scaliano - It's a solid pizza that's unlike other pizzas I've tried. The cornmeal crust is my favorite part. The garlic is fresh, the spicy sausage is high quality, the tomatoes are juicy, and the scallions keep the flavor palette interesting. We tried adding pepperoni once but it was greasy and distracted from the garlic/tomatoes/scallions. Another time we asked for half Scaliano/Da Vinci and we both agreed the Scaliano was better. So now we keep it simple: Large Scaliano, straight up. It feeds us twice and reheats in the oven really well. They don't charge for delivery (SWEET!) and it always arrives in under an hour. 

Pro-tip: The menu they attach to the pizza box has a coupon so save it for your next delivery! ($1 off a medium and $2 off a large)
author: Shaina V.

description: Wow.. went into have a bite to eat after ubering across town and was told they were closed (rudely) an hour before yelp hours.. had to pay to uber somewhere else.. will never come back. Man with full beard was very rude.
author: Sherrie T.

description: Visiting from out of town, we checked yelp to see which was the best pizza place in walking distance. Za pizza it is! Tiny place with only about 4 tables (all taken with about 4-5 people crammed at each one), okay customer service, but the pizza was AMAZING, fresh, crispy, and totally worth the 15 minute walk up three steep hills! Would return if in the area again.
author: Nicole D.

description:
Pretty good.
Is there a menu? I'm no quite sure. All i saw was a white board with 4 different pizza by the slice options. So we got a meat, a play on the Margherita by the name of Van Dough, and a cheese.
The Van Dough was good. Had diced tomatoes, basil and garlic, I believe. The flavors were good. The meat one kinda reminded me of Celeste frozen pizza. It wasn't bad but I guess it was because the sausage really tasted like the sausage from the frozen pizza brand I used to eat growing up.
The crust is a tad too crunchy for my taste but overall one of the better pizza shops in the city.

Don't let the name fool you, it's not "gourmet" inside.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Great place on Hyde! Try the 'Potesto' pizza!!! Anything really! Great salads too. 
I would recommend them for a casual dinner out.
author: Kirk M.

description: This is my favorite pizza joint in SF. It's the definition of a no frills kind of place but they produce the best pizza in the Russian Hill / Knob Hill area. They small Cesar salad is massive and in my opinion nothing beats their sweet Italian sausage. They are always packed so it's best to just stop by if you want your Za!
author: Kylie P.

description: I went there with my friend and they ruined our night. The guy called Matt who took our order made fun of my friend's name and then tried to  mock his accent. He did it so loud and it was so rude and inappropriate that other customers seemed to be confused and disgusted by the situation. No one should be treated like that and the business which encourages it's employees to treat customers like shit should get any. Avoid this racist place.
author: Oleg K.

description:
I have mixed feelings about Za Pizza. 

Location/Atmosphere: 4/5. Za Pizza is on a really cute block of Hyde St. The interior is sweet with all the drawings. 

Service: 3/5. Variable and strongly depends on who's there. I've had both exceptionally good service and exceptionally bad service. Once, I came here with family who were visiting from out of town. The servers and chefs were exceedingly kind and friendly. One of them talked to my mom for about 20 minutes, and drew her a map of the city. My family kept talking about how great Za Pizza was. In contrast: A few weeks ago I went here with a friend one evening. It was well before closing time, but the servers were absolute jerks. My friend and I each ordered a slice of pizza "for here", and they gave us the slices in a pizza box and told us to "get out". I asked why--and they said they were closing. So we left and sat outside on the sidewalk. After we left, though, at least 10 other people came in over the course of 20 minutes, were served, and sat inside. Absolutely rude. 

Food: 4/5. The potato pesto pizza is my favorite. 

Overall: 3 stars is accurate.
author: Kate T.

description:
Fantastic pizza and Cesar salad. Brooks has been here 25 years and his establishment is definitely a hidden gem of SF. It's a must go-to EVERY trip to the city. Keeping our fingers crossed for foggy weather! Fog = excellent dough weather  
Until our next trip Brooks....
author: J B.

description:
I lived closer to many other by the slice places, and out of laziness would patronize them.  But on nice days I would often make the 25-30 minute walk and have a slice.  The slices were huge, tasty and hot.  I never ordered more than one slice, which typically covered the entire plate, and never left hungry.  I'd always go thinking about going to Swenson's for a float afterword, but usually was too full by the time I left.

Now they do have a bit of NYC gruffness, but in a bantering way, not a mean spirited one.

And no food snobbery here.  I really liked the crumbly sausage bits, and told the owner so.  He said they buy it by the bag at Costco.
author: Steve S.

description: When I order in Pizza, I order Za.  It's always delicious.  Tonight my Za showed up from delivery with half of the Pizza slid all over the box.  Hey I get it, stuff happens. I called Za and they handled it wonderfully and in about 20 minutes another pie showed up at my house and might be the best pie I have had from there.  Thank you Za for being my go to delivery and even when you aren't perfect you handle it gracefully!
author: Avia K.

description: I went there and all of the few tables were occupied and there was no room at the small bar. The staff just ignored me.  No one came to greet a potential customer or estimate how long the waiting time would be. I walked out
author: joe r.

description:
Really solid pizza. My wife and I stopped here after Lombard Street based on the Yelp reviews. I'd give the pizza a 4.5 but the staff was unbelievably friendly so that bumped them up to a 5. One of them even offered their parking spot to a customer that was on their way to meet a customer already there. They didn't stop moving the entire time either - all hard workers it appeared. 

We got a slice of cheese and a slice of pepperoni - both were HUGE with a very nice crunch. The sauce had a nice sweet flavor and the cheese was also very good. Will definitely come back if I'm in San Fran again.
author: Bobby C.

description:
This is one of those places you almost don't want to write a review to keep it to yourself or at least avoid it to be overrun by even more fans. So keeping it short:
The pizza crust is just right, the center not soggy from too much veggie moisture or oil, and the cheese and veggies on top had the perfect 'tan' from their oven.
Get it delivered and keep the little menu with the $2 coupon for next time -- which is going to be soon, I already know ...
author: Re V.

description:
I'm from the east coast, and grew up eating thin crust pizza. Those of you in the same boat know that this is not one of San Francisco's strengths. Za is the closest thing I've found so far. 

The menu is pretty straightforward - this is a pizza joint. There are a number of specialities, but I usually make up something of my own. 

The pizzas themselves are large, and the crust is thin. Sometimes there is a bit much corn meal/semolina on the bottom, but I'm not so bothered by it. The salads are pretty good too, if you're looking for a way to eat a bit less pizza. The ceZar salad is exactly what you would expect, and very tasty. 

Za is a little bit on the expensive side, but worth it given how much better it is than their competitors. 

They do delivery, which is nice, but I find that you get a better pie at the restaurant. Given the timing and heating constraints of pizza, this is expected, but the delta at Za is a little more pronounced.
author: Matthew L.

description:
More than beyond satisfied!!!
I was scrambling to get pizza for my son's first grade class lunch on their last day of school but had to work all morning.  I called way before they were open (staff is there prepping and someone will answer if they are free) and BROOKS answered and literally made my day and about 25 7year old's day too.  I probably threw a wrench into his day by asking him to make 5 large cheese pizza to be ready and he offered to personally deliver to the elementary school within the hour!  Wait what?! Did he say he would deliver it?? WOW that is service above and beyond.  Freaking made my day.  Letting down your child and his class room was something that I could not live down.  

Pizza here is definitely made with love.  Someone who loves his job shows.  Onto the pizza... It's so delicious.  Thin crust, tasty, and not greasy.  So glad it's a neighborhood small business pizza joint.  It's one of s kind.  In front of the Hyde street cable car track.  Same block as Swensen's ice cream.  Perfect place as a kids' play date or any date.  I'm in love with this place!!!
author: Lily M.

description: Definitely the best in SF. In addition to great taste and location, the staff is very courteous.
author: T P.

description: This is super easy to write! I ordered over the phone for delivery, it arrived in under an hour and was delicious. It's rare that you try a new place and it delivers everything you'd hope it'd be, def coming back.
author: Jeremy C.

description: Best slices ever.  Amazing price and the people are great.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Was a bit puzzled when I first stepped in. Most pizza joints I have been to generally had a jumbo menu board hung somewhere on the wall. All I saw were children pictures on the wall til I i noticed the small white board between the two cashiers. 

The menu was small and simple. Two pizza specials of the day were listed on the board the day 1 meat 1 veggie. The other two options are your classic cheese and pepperoni. I was a fatty and ordered 3 slices. Was full after the first slice. Working on the last slice right now. Its been 3 hours since purchase. Its cold but tastes better than most other pizza's I've had. 

Fairly priced, jumbo slices, friendly service.
author: Jason X.

description: Huge slices! The Veggie Monday pizza was great. Thin crust. Fort Point beer was citrusy and hoppy.
author: Matthew J.

description: Solid NY-style slice, small beer selection but some good, local choices. Nice to be able to grab a $5 slice with organic Early Girl tomatoes and fresh basil. Service is friendly.
author: Richard R.

description:
Za pizza is NOT good. Overpriced and too salty. Guys behind the counter are rude and act like they couldn't care less...

Don't waste your time.
author: Mary F.

description: Get the MOMA pizza - lots of artichoke hearts and red onion!  I haven't actually gone to the restaurant yet, but someone brought the MOMA pizza to a gathering and it was so yum with fresh ingredients and great flavoring.  Everyone spoke so highly of this pizzeria that I need to experience it for myself very soon!
author: Maile N.

description: Pizza is great. Salads are generously sized and very tasty and the service is genuinely friendly in this small, neighborhood pizza place. Will be back!
author: Bill B.

description: We walked by yesterday. We knew, from the crowd and wonderful smell of their pizza, that we had to come back. We went back for lunch today. Probably the best pizza we've had in years. Great pizza, good beer, good service.
author: D. M.

description:
Pizza Quality: 6/10 The pizza was good but it wasn't great. When I ate my own crust it was sort of a tasteless dough that needed a lot of ranch. Which is a shame. 

The crust is like the end of a movie, it has to be as good as the opening scene. 

Size: 10/10 Massive

Price: At $4.50 a slice it's expensive imo. Can't beat NYC dollar slices. 

Service: Mixed. 
These people hung up on me before when I called to place an order. Because I mentioned how they kept me waiting for 10mins. 

Buzz: Cool spot on Hyde, local style, bar, napkin art.

Overall, myself and my gf give it a 6. Better than average.
author: David L.

description: 3.5 stars for the very casual pizza place on Russian Hill. My family wanted to grab a quick snack after ice cream at Swenson's up the block, so we stopped by Za for a quick Large pizza to share. We got half cheese for the kiddies and half Scaliano for the adults. Great thin crust pizza, good sauce, and toppings. It seems like they change the specials menu daily. The staff was very polite and accommodating for our spur-of-the-moment large party. Great neighborhood pizza place.
author: Elaine N.

description: I would choose this over almost any high end pizza place. Amazing food and nice guys! Great neighborhood spot.
author: Caity Y.

description:
My husband and I are in SF on holiday for five days and we went to Za our first night here on a whim because it was close. We've now been there twice - so far.  It's not one of those places that you have to go to because it's a tourist trap. They just do amazing pizza.

Back home in England we have a friend called G (that isn't a pseudonym to protect his identity, we actually call him G). G plays bass in a band, and is powerfully gregarious. Every weekend he's doing something weird in Shoreditch or Lambeth. He's constantly backstage at various different music festivals; we know not how. He's been in Bruce Dickinson's house and dates disproportionately attractive women (mostly from the Baltic states, although this is not on purpose: it just happens to him).  Everyone who works in Za is a cleaner, Californian version of G. 

Four out of five of them at any one time will be wearing a baseball cap (in both forwards and backwards varieties); the fifth will be wearing a baseball tee. You get the impression that when they turn up at a house party they bring more cans than they drink and will either have on them - or know someone who can get - good weed. They all casually skate - Vans over Converse - and probably met Billie Joe Armstrong once but think he's a tosser. The entire time you're their they'll all be rushing about like blue arsed flies and doing several things at once, these including: taking orders for both in house and takeaway pizza; keeping an eye on who got there first and has been waiting for seats in the tiny venue longest; answering the phone and explaining the wait for delivery is the same as it was when the caller rang five minutes ago; manning the tiny bar and drawing pints over one another on opposite taps; checking on the bin lid sized pizzas in the oven; washing their hands; bussing tables; pausing to check the baseball on the TV and, one assumes, be slightly surprised at their own pizza-based acuity. There's a beautifully assumptive level of service: "Hey man, you need another beer!" and you realise, shit, I do need another beer! Sign me up, you probably-bearded dude.
