Your pizza will arrive about half way down the first beer, depending on the size and quantity of pizza ordered. The individual slices are just larger than an average person's head. They're thin, loaded with toppings, but not soggy, and they're pretty reasonably priced too (a comparable slice place in London is a fiver a slice which, depending on how far off a cliff the pound is today, is now probably five bucks too, and Za's pizza is way better). 

If you're the kind of person who appreciates an atmosphere that someone could, at any point, decide to lock the doors and turn it into a mellow all nighter, where you won't be judged for sticking to cola but where nobody, under any circumstances, will be allowed to play Wonderwall on an acoustic in the corner, and if, above all else, you like really really good pizza, then you need to visit Za. If you deduct points from restaurants for not having proper cloth serviettes folded into the shape of two birds of paradise fucking, then you probably won't like Za, but you shouldn't be allowed to enjoy pizza either, you joyless git.
author: Alice B.

description: I'd highly recommended going to other pizza places in the area.  Service is terrible and there are too many other good pizza places in Russian Hill/Marina area to waste your time at this place.
author: Bryan G.

description:
I love Za. The sassy staff and the yummy pizza. its well worth the wait if you can get a seat or table. They have local and non local beers on staff and will make a custom pie or you can grab a slice. My fav is the Potesto. Pesto, roasted garlic and potato on a thin crust pizza. Honestly it worth it to come here. Trek from far and wide to come here but make it a priority! They also deliver...

Slices are well worth the price. Go there. Eat and be merry. If you have room go to Swenson's up the block for a scoop or two. 

There is not another pizza place in Portland that can compare with you Za. Le sigh.
author: Ami K.

description: The best New York pizza we have found in the city (maybe a tie with Tony's Pizza). They have a cool hip atmosphere with beers on tap. Will definitely be back!
author: Caroline H.

description:
Simply the best pizza I've had in San Francisco. Being from the Northeast, everything inside me wants to hate all pizza not born from the dirty waters of New York or Boston, but Za's slaps the New England snobbishness right out of my mouth. 

I will say that sometimes I've been on hold for a delivery order for over 10 minutes, but I guess that's what it means to be the popular kid (or so I've heard...).
author: Alexis H.

description:
Although this has long been a favorite neighborhood spot, when I walked in recently
with a black friend (no, not boyfriend, just friend), I felt less than welcomed.  The wait staff on duty (he was new and European, I think) walked past us many times without welcoming us or placing napkins or silverware on our table (no, the place was not busy).  Finally, the owner came over to take our order  .... okay, maybe not a slight, but the Da Vinci Palette pizza we ordered was less than stellar  ... now that I think back on it, I don't think there was even any spicy sausage on it, the tomato sauce was thin and you could count the slices of pepper on one hand.  Racial prejudice in San Francisco in 2016???  ya think??
author: Cherie P.

description:
One of the best pizzas I've ever had, but that may be because I had just walked up the steepest dang hill and collapsed at their front door. (We're Texicans from the flat muggy lands of Houston)

This review of course covers only their ordering in service, which was excellent. My wife and I ate outside under the tree and people watched while munching on pizza and chugging water. (Again, Houstonians aren't hill people) The waiter came out multiple times and everyone working there was very friendly and prompt. 

They offer two specialty pizzas of the day and two mainstays, cheese and pepporoni. Each slice was $4.25. Pretty clear cut and good pizza. 

If you work up an appetite hiking up to the top of Lombard st. for that necessary tourist pic of a curvy road, make sure to stop by this nearby pizza joint for some needed sustenance.
author: Drew K.

description: We're from the Bay Area and don't really like to go to the city to eat because of the crowds and the amount of tourists everywhere. However, today we woke up feeling like trying something different so we took a cable car up to Za Pizza and oh em gee... not only was the pizza superb, but the service was EXCELLENT! We walked in with our 3 kids and a gentleman immediately walked up to us and brought over a high chair for the baby. When he saw that we pulled out our cell phones (guilty!) to distract the kids when they got a little antsy while waiting for the pizza (ordered a whole pie, didn't even take long), he quickly brought over some sheets of paper and markers for the 3 of them and the kiddos felt so special when he hung the drawings up. I can't say enough about how awesome this guy was. He checked on us, chit chatted a bit, made us laugh, and just kept it moving, making sure every customer was taken care of. Just some good old school, genuine, kind, friendly customer service. The place is small, but cozy and the service is fast. We can't wait to go back. Also, check out  Swensen's Ice Cream next door!
author: Mayra D.

description: Love this place , great pizza! They do great delivery for the city, it came piping hot! This place is small but simple. Slices are large but thin and really yummy. The guys that work at this place are all really nice.
author: Lily R.

description: Just yummy!
author: Matea F.

description: Outstanding pizza, great beer on tap, solid wines, and some seriously good salads.  The daily specials are always an excellent choice.
author: Troy J.

description: I was lucky enough to live down the street from Za for a number of years. It is a perfect place to walk to and get a great meal! Everyone who works there is very friendly and makes you feel at home. It does get busy, so you may need to wait a little for a table on weekend evenings, but it is worth it!
author: Blair B.

description: The cheese pizza was amazing!!!!!! Would go back to San Fran just for it. The toppings are great but the original classic cheese pizza is to die for. THE ONLy thing I'd change is the environment a bit too small and dim.
author: Sophia J.

description:
Great pizza, taste, texture and balanced.  Guys
who work there are really nice too
author: JD K.

description: Best pizza by the slice and the friendliest staff ever! I feel immediately at home when I walk in.
author: Rashmi J.

description: Best pizza in the city next to Tony's. Za is always consistent and never disappoints.
author: Camilla G.

description: Great neighborhood pizza joint with large slices and fresh ingredients. Highly recommend their version of a Margherita pizza (the Vincent Van Dough) once the pizza is done cooking they add the fresh basil on top.
author: Cara S.

description: Meat combo pizza!!!!!!!! HUGE slice of crispy thin crust with just the right amount of saltiness and flavor. Very fulfilling.
author: Lisa K.

description: LOVE!  As much as I love the Mission, I miss having this place just around the block...  Just picked up a pie on our way back from wine country, and it was as amazing as I remembered....
author: Rachael S.

description: Good Pizza in San Francisco is hard to come by.. I'm lucky enough to have a pizza spot that has good quality corn meal crust pizza in my own neighborhood.
author: Brandon N.

description: This pizza was amazing! We had potesto pizza and i fell in love. Will be back next time we're in the city. Staff was also extremely friendly
author: R C.

description: I enjoy the pizzas here at Za. I'm not a vegetarian but I tend to go for the meatless pies. I usually go for the Potesto (pesto, roasted garlic, and sliced red potatoes) or the Popeye The Greek (spinach and feta), both delish. I like the thin, crispy crust with the cornmeal underneath. Staff there is always friendly.
author: Kim L.

description: Zac is my favorite local pizza place.  I LOVE their crust.  Order a whole pie as it taste 10x better than their slices.
author: Ted H.

description: Wife was craving pizza so we chose this place because it was close by and had good reviews. So glad we did, you can definitely taste how fresh the ingredients were on the pizza. We ended up choosing a large pizza, half popeye the greek and half scaliano with pepperoni on the whole pizza. Wish we had a pizza place like this at home. Yes their large costs more than (2) XL pizzas from Papa Ginos but man, it was so good, you can taste how fresh the vegetables were. Our only gripe would be in regards to the server. Tall dude with the thin mustache, you gotta work more efficiently man. Can't be walking back and forth carrying one item at a time for one table. That annoyed us at first while we were waiting to be seated but the pizza more than made up for it.
author: Hung L.

description:
Thin crust is their specialty. So if u have too many ingredients added to the pizza it won't taste like a pizza because the thin base would get very soggy and wet. Everything will fall apart when you pick it up.

The cheese and bluto was delicious.
The place had good atmosphere and service was great.

Not traditional Italian pizza if that's what you're looking for.
author: Michael L.

description:
This is my go-to pizza restaurant.  

Recently, there was a misunderstanding, and they didn't deliver pizzas I ordered for a Warriors viewing party. I gave them a call after waiting a while. They apologized, and they promptly delivered the pizzas free of charge. 

Glad they made up for the misunderstanding.  Za remains my go-to restaurant.
author: Paul C.

description:
When driving around this Nob Hill area plus having seen
the Food Rush's Pizza Tour episode on the Live Well
Network, I was always curious about this pizza place.
Finally found a small parking spot, walked around the
corner, up the sidewalk to get a 'nice' slice of cheese
pizza (see photo).

It was SO big (How big was it?)... I thought I needed a
crane to eat it!  The thin crisp crust slice passed
'the fold' test too!

Service was friendly, chatted with the gentleman behind the
counter.  Told him about said TV episode with host
Ryan Scott and he smiled.  The place itself is very cozy
with cute pizza drawings decorating the walls.  On top of
that, the big board listed slices for the day.

If around the area, especially during the day, Za Pizza
is a nice spot for a grand slice of pizza.  Afterwards,
walk around and enjoy the scenic views of
San Francisco.
author: W L.

description: I always love going back to places...this time I took my husband who LOVED their pizza.  No frills SLICES and draft beers.  New York style pizza.  Choose from 4 slices on the menu board.   Average price is $4 per slice and they are huge slices.  Very cordial owner and employees.  This place will always have a special place in my heart.  Mad love.
author: Jen M.

description: Pizza so good that my über picky 5 year old (who used to eat only the crust of pizza) ate 3 small slices! We think that's the most she's eaten in one sitting, ever!! The service was great. They brought markers and paper for the babes, and they offered to double cut half the pizza so it would be easier for little mouths to navigate. They made a tiny mistake on our pizza and bought us our drinks! They really went above and beyond, and no one gave us the side eye when our 1 year old screamed in a deafening pitch. Perfect casual pizza eatery with the added San Fran bonus of cable cars rolling by.
author: Lucy M.

description:
Sat down for dinner on a Sunday night and ordered the Salvador Dali with artichoke instead of chicken. We ordered a medium pizza, which was larger than we had expected. Between the two of us, we finished a little over half so a medium is the perfect size for 2-3 people, depending on how hungry you are. 

Pros: Small menu, but yummy options. They serve slices and whole pizzas. The staff was super friendly while seating us and our waiter was very helpful and pleasant. Pizza came out piping hot and was pretty delicious. They gave us hot plates to keep the pizza warm. 

Cons: Prices are higher on their menu than Yelp's. No ranch. They had Franks and Siracha but both tasted funky. There was something sweet, maybe ketchup, added to the hot sauce. Apparently, one of the employees was rude when my friend brought our plates up. I didn't witness this but if a customer is trying to make your job easier just smile and say thank you.

Overall, it's pretty good pizza but not serving ranch was a big deal breaker for us so I would only order pickup or delivery in the future! Parking is also a nightmare so keep that in mind if you want to sit down.
author: Katie B.

description: Great variety of slices, friendly service, great prices, and good beer. They have a TV with a game on too. Great "New York" style slice (very large slices). They deliver whole pizzas as well!  Great neighborhood spot. Eat there and watch the cable cars roll buy, or better yet grab a slice and head down to Bacchus wine bar across the street!!
author: Jeff C.

description:
Come for the small hole-in-the wall appeal and ease of location for those who live close by.

Leave for the less than flattering pizza that was not bad by any standard but also not prepared too well, cooked to a T or overly tasty.

The cast of workers is all dudes in their twenties which could be a plus or minus depending on what you're looking for in a staff.

Gourmet? Nnnnot so much.
author: Christopher D.

description: We were taking a stroll down Hyde when the delicious smell of pizza stopped us in our tracks. My husband and I, both from NJ love pizza and miss NY style pizza. The smell of Za's pizza baking in the oven reminded us of home. The slice of pepperoni did not disappoint. We will definitely be returning for more!
author: Karen E.

description: Probably my favorite pizza place in the city! Huge slices for a great price and their sausage is amazing. Highly recommend.
author: Monique S.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Pepperoni pizza - yum thin crispy yet tasty tomato sauce... Mm


SERVICE:
Good


ATMOSPHERE:
small cute, hideaway on Hyde street so you can see the cable cars go by, it's got a lil bar with a few beers on tap :D some small tables inside, and two tables to sit outside. I really like the Hyde feel and the feel of this pizzeria, and it helps that the pizza was pretty delicious!
author: Angela L.

description: Scrumptious pizza in San Francisco! Really thin crust with savory cheese that stretches as you bite into the pizza. It is a small joint just like everything else in the area but it has a very cozy vibe. Perfect place to hang out on a Friday night with friends and enjoy the environment! And don't get me started on the decor.... Just go and check it out for yourself, you'll be impressed and charmed!
author: Cherise M.

description: Been coming to this place for years. Great service, solid NYC style pizza, family friendly and cold beer. I'm moving out of Russian Hill in a month, and this is one of my local stops I'm going to miss the most.
author: Scott C.

description: Not sure what the Pizza tastes like. Yelp and every other source says their open till 11 pm. Ubered over to give it a try. My Wife and I were there at 9:40 and was greeted by a very rude guy with a beard that informed us they only have take out. The place was all but closed up. If you're not open for sit down till 11 then state it don't give you're paying customers that want to try you're product an attitude. Try Golden boy pizza. Awesome pizza and great service.
author: Joe T.

description: The pizza here is edible but very average.  I can make better pizza at home.  The service was downright bad.  The place was packed, yet the waiter seemed very unconcerned about getting tables clean for new customers.  Not impressed.
author: Celeste B.

description: We stopped by 1.5 hours before closing and was rudely approached stating they were only supporting take out. When we mentioned that Yelp stated they were open till 11:00 pm the employee (with a beard) stated well Yelp is wrong. He was being a complete dick. I would never think of going back there again. We ended up going to Escape from New York Pizza which was Phenomenal. It's great food with a great employees.
author: Chris W.

description: I'm lucky enough to live between New Haven and NYC and have experienced some of the best pizza, regionally and nationally and have to say that Za's does pizza right. Their Vincent Van Dough (Roma tomatoes, fresh basil and fresh garlic) is truly out of this world. They have mastered the right mix of crust, sauce, cheese, and garlic.
author: Amin S.

description: This is my favorite pizza place in SF! Cool staff, delicious pizza and wonderful salads. Garden salad is perfect with the pepperoni pizza.
author: Seniha K.

description:
This is my absolute favorite pizza place in the city! I come here at least once a month, for the pizza and the friendly staff. 

Pros: huge, delicious slices that are reasonably priced. 
Super friendly staff 
Fun drawings on the wall by people who have visited Za
Good local beers on tap
Quintessential SF location - you can eat pizza and watch the tourists take the cable cars up to Lombard Street. Heck you can even follow the tourists up there if you need to burn off some of those delicious calories.  

Cons: NONE!
author: Neesh B.

description:
Review by Y.C., 1st Grader

There's a place near Swensen's near the cable cars on Hyde and Union. It's called Za. When you go in there it smells so so SO! Good. The room smells like not too fancy not too cheesy but just right pepper cheese. While you're waiting you can draw and the next time you go there you can see your drawing up on the wall. Out of a billion ten stars I give it a billion and ten stars. Go there if you like baseball or basketball: you can watch it. Or if you like beer, wine, champagne. www.bestpizza.com.
 gooooooooooo!!!! (There!) THERE!
author: Eric G.

description: Probably the best pizza I ever had. Its unbelievably cheap compare to their taste and quality. I would never resist ZA pizza even though I had 3 plates of dish. My favourites are cheese pizza and combi pizza . Tried potato once, interesting, but not my style.  Staffs are really nice too.
author: Stacy U.

description: I never yelp, but I just had to come on here and say that this place is the Mecca of all pizza in the Bay Area. Seriously. No others can compare. And J.R. (Guy who runs it) is hilarious and awesome. Definitely one of my favorite places for grease in SF!
author: Chris R.

description:
I wasn't blown away by this place. We got The Bluto and it was good but not outstanding. Their beer selection was sub par but was reasonably priced at $4.50 a glass. I wish they had more inside seating. We were forced to sit on the slanted sidewalk. 

I will definitely come back to try more slices.  I'm especially looking forward to trying the Potesto.
author: Erica C.

description: I'm from NY and this is the best slice west of the Mississippi. Hands down. Be friendly, put away your phone and enjoy.
author: Jesse S.

description: Thin crust, big slices cheesy toppings! Great service! What more can you ask? Best pizza I ever had! They totally know what they are doing!
author: Solongo B.

description:
I have a confession to make...It's a bit embarrassing... 

Being faced with the option of a slice of pizza with sweet pork sausage as opposed to a Veggie slice....I did the unthinkable.... 

I ATE A VEGETARIAN SLICE OF PIZZA! and it wasn't half bad!.....there ya go Hazel "O.M." G. =) 

Veggie Monday Slice ($4.60) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WKJzi4g1OGp1nW_6ZJD_rQ?select=yuSxBXQEs7992mImTnRMKw Fresh mushrooms, anaheim chili peppers and artichoke hearts....thin crispy crust, just enough sauce and quality cheese and surprisingly flavorful veggies, great combination! 

The wife had a sad little cheese slice http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WKJzi4g1OGp1nW_6ZJD_rQ?select=B2xtU9NzbKm9NSsSJOPWUg ....nuthn special....it was edible. 

So there it is....I think I filled my quota for vegetarian food for the rest of the year...I'm quite proud of myself....
author: Cesar R.

description: Love their pizza - great service - terrific delivery, gotta try it!
author: Christian E.

description: Minus one star.  Delivery from this place is always an issue and they haven't been so friendly the past few times I've been in.
author: Vince F.

description:
I thought the pizza was decent, very akin to Avellino's. Seems like a good place to grab a slice and a beer with a friend.

I thought the salads are huge, but overrated and tasteless.

Note: If you are only buying by the slice, they have 2-3 daily pizzas you can choose from. Also, delivery is only available for full pizza's.
author: Jess C.

description: It's an easy spot to get pizza if you live in Russian Hill. I wouldn't go out of your way to order from here but since I lived so close, I tended to default to this place. It's a small restaurant so take-out is recommended.
author: Samara C.

description: My friend and I were touring San Francisco and stumbled across the awesome pizza place based on the Yelp reviews. The atmosphere is very casual and the owner was so friendly and personable. He gave us excellent tips on the area and we really enjoyed talking to him about the local area. The pizza was delicious with thin-crust and fresh toppings. We also had the Trummer beer on tap and it was just a perfect find after touring Lombard street. I give ZA the "best pizza award" in San Francisco.
author: Katharine B.

description:
No idea how this place is 4 stars. Probably not enough New Yorkers chiming in. Za Pizza gets a solid 2 stars under middle of the road review. The pizza is ok, but nothing to write home about, and really really always underbaked and soft (although my wife likes it extra doughy like that). They're always busy and totally slammed every day during rush times, but I've come to the conclusion that it's really because they're the only gig in the nabe that has pizza and delivery of its type in Nob/Russian Hill, not because of the quality or stellar service. The customer service is weak sauce and has been for at least the past few years. I have NEVER had a smooth experience with it here and I always end up needing to eat dinner hangry having wasted time and money in the process because I forgot to order right after my last meal so that theirs would get there in time. 

2 stars especially for the delivery guys, or anyone you need to deal with over there in any customer service capacity. They are always rude, late, not willing to come upstairs to complete the delivery. Just the other day one arrived and called, I said there's a buzzer on the side of the door, and he proceeds to say he'll park the car and come up then promptly hangs up before I get to reply. I waited 20 minutes to hear from him again and he didn't answer our calls wondering where he was. If he didn't hang up so fast I could have said I'll just meet you downstairs... (I should add 95% of other delivery service drivers at any time of day figure out a way to park even in a driveway for 1 minute and come up, and when they can't I offer to come down). 

Another instance of poor service -- a few months back the person on the phone we ordered from didn't ask cash or charge - then when we wanted to use a card upon arrival, the driver wouldn't give us our pizza. He tried to call the restaurant to run the card (couldn't get in touch with them because no one answered the phone multiple times, even for their own driver...) then said he had other deliveries to complete, took off pizza in hand, went back to his car, and didn't return for over 25 minutes!?! During which time we had to call the shop again and again to get through on the phone to make the charge. The person on the phone couldn't care less about the fact that we were appalled with this situation and blamed us for not making it clear we were going to use a card, when we weren't even asked. Equip your CS folks and drivers appropriately, it's 2015 in SF people. Take an imprint or run a Square, or have a phone line your drivers can call, problem solved.

Always add 30 minutes to any delivery estimate, minimum. They like to tell you 45min - 1 hour, but it really means an hour and a half at least. We've waited up to 2 hours on a one hour estimate for a delivery before, and ended up with cold Za. 

Every time I order from this place I have to deal with something unprofessional, rude, and just plain annoying and stupid. Unacceptable in a market where there a a myriad of other options for food in one of the best cities for food in the country. I don't know how they stay in business with customer service like this. The only reason I agreed to order from them these last few times is because my wife likes the pizza so much, but we both agreed too many bad times and this was probably the end of Za for us. With so many options for businesses in any flavor in this city there is literally no reason to patronize someone or some business that makes you feel bad and wonder why you gave them money for a sub par experience. So many other more reputable places in this city make you feel great to do business with them.

Victor's Pizza on Polk is WAY better quality and much better customer service and delivery.
author: Niall D.

description: We literally can't order delivery from this place because the phone just rings off the hook. If you try calling between 6-10pm any night, no one will answer. Its happened countless times, don't know why we think it'll ever chance. It's absurd and a horribly run business. Agreed, guys behind the counter don't give a crap and are jerks.
author: Victoria J.

description:
Hm I'm not sure if I'd exactly call this gourmet pizza.. but the service was really great. It was about 8o clock on a Monday night but the place got PACKED! 

People were constantly coming in and out for pickup/takeout and there was a line out the door. insane.

My sis and I split a "small" chicken salad which ended up being pretty HUGE. I was full after but I HAD TO eat a slice of pizza which was ALSO as big as my face (I have a big face).

I think I actually enjoyed the honeymustard drenched salad more than the pizza (..sorry!), but what I probably enjoyed the most was the service! The waiter was super attentive amidst the chaos.

I'd def return again if there's a game on I want to watch to enjoy some salad (lol) and beer with.
author: Alexis P.

description: Pizza is amazing!!! Wish there was a place like this in San Diego (where I'm from). The atmosphere is chill, and I love all of the wall art! The food came out quickly and deliciously. Not to mention one slice is bigger than my hand spread out. Just thinking about it makes me want some more! Keep doing your thang, Za!!!
author: Natalia M.

description:
We eat their pizza an unhealthy amount and haven't gotten sick of it. Although it's a steep price to pay for pizza, we just can't get enough. 

We usually eat in but also get delivery sometimes. The service is great either way!

My favorite is their Caesar salad and their dressing is the best I've ever had. The scaliano is perfectly spicy, the thickness of the crust couldn't be more ideal and the fresh tomatoes on top reduce the guilt of it all while also giving me my vegetable fix (j/k). 

The only reason I give Za's 4 stars instead of 5 is because they can be inconsistent. The slices can be stale so stick to ordering a massive pie! It taste great for breakfast the next day too.
author: H K.

description:
HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE / MEDIOCRE PIZZA.  Save yourself the disappointment and keep searching.

tldr; phoned in for delivery, they called back 45 minutes later to tell me I was not in their coverage zone.  When I pointed out their website shows my address is within their delivery area - they said "website is old".  How am I supposed to know that - and why would you make me wait 45 minutes and charge my credit card to call me back and tell me you aren't going to deliver?

Since I was so hungry and it was late, I ended up going in to pick the pizza up instead .  The pizza is just not that great.  It's got a cornmeal crust that leaves a lot to be desired.  Definitely not done right - I would compare it to PAXTIS only worse.

If you want gourmet pizza - go to Paxtis (for the record I don't like that pizza either, just saying it was better than Za).
author: Chad S.

description:
We've been back many times grabbing a slice of pizza to-go and had it delivered once.  Our favorite is their vegetarian and the Scaliano.  The crust is thin, it really is the perfect snack.

We finally made it in recently to sit down and enjoy our pizza.  One reason was to catch the Giants game.  We ordered a medium ($21) half Moma (mushrooms, onions, artichokes and fresh basil) and half Scaliano (roma tomato, Italian sausage, fresh garlic and green onion).  Their medium is easily the size of a L elsewhere, if not an XL.  

They have four drafts - $5/each.  

Love their pizza.  Will have to try their Potesto, supposed to be one of their best sellers and it is great with some Sriracha.

The staff is super chilled and friendly.
author: Gloria H.

description: The pizza was good, and the owner is nice.  I ordered a very tasty meat lover thin crust. Will definitely come back for more.
author: Clear P.

description: Taking off stars for rude/bad service. I work with customers and you can't act like a jerk and have your service fall apart when you're busy. Get it together, ZA.
author: Aggie N.

description:
Its always a good thing and a bad thing when a place is packed.
Good thing is then you know the place is great.
Bad thing is it takes forever to get served
But funny thing is the service was great. Unsure of his name but he had a semi beard and skinny and slightly tall. He was very nice and served us promptly although being busy he was still very nice.
Not to mention the pizza is amazing.
Love. Love LOVED IT
author: Arlene M.

description: Awesome place.  Can't wait to visit again.  No need for some Gerald Broflosky like review here.  This place is awesome.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Andrew S.

description:
I stopped in for a slice of pizza at Za on my last day in San Francisco. 

I had a slice of the pepperoni for $4.10 I believe. The pizza slice was as big as the plate and it was delicious! Hit the spot for sure. One piece was enough and I was pretty hungry. The crust was thin and crispy. Just the right amount of cheese and sauce.

They had 3 or 4 pizzas available by the slice which I think is great. I was by myself so I wouldn't have stayed if they didn't have slices. They had a few beers on tap.

The guy helping me was very nice and friendly. Looks like they have a good crew there. I'll definitely be back when I'm in town again!
author: Chelsea J.

description:
Service wasn't all that great. Got put on hold for 10 minutes had to hang up and call back. When I went to pick the pizza up there was around 5 people in there, not busy at all, not sure why I was put on hold for so long. Also had to wait at the counter for another 5 or so minutes for someone to finally help me (again I was the only one at the counter) then the guy wasn't friendly at all. 

Pizza was alright nothing amazing. I've had way better for way cheaper.
author: David P.

description:
Ordered the scalliono pizza & 2 sprites for delivery. They said it would be 45 minutes. 2 hours and 15 minutes later, a cold pizza arrived with 2 root beers. 

"We ordered sprites?" I said. 

"Oh." He replied. 

We stood there for a moment looking at each other. He then thrust the pizza into my hands with a grunt and said, 

"I'll get you some sprites." 

"Oh, do you have extra in your car?" 

"No. I'll go to the corner store and get you a sprite. 

Needless to say, he didn't ever return with sprites. The pizza was cold and mediocre. 

Sigh.
author: Hazel J.

description: I was really upset that they would not deliver to my area (less than a mile away) I was pregnant and needed pizza delivery! I recently visited them to dine in and found that their pizza is REALLY great, which makes us even sadder that they won't deliver to us! The thin crust pizza here is top notch. I haven't been able to find a pizza slice similar to ZA anywhere in SF. Maybe I called on a bad/busy night when I got hung up on?
author: Sueann W.

description: Been here many times. Pizza is alright, but I don't like the rude attitude. In person and on the phone, they're short, curt and annoying. Be kind, it goes a long way when serving your customers.
author: T. L.

description: Long story short........ Don't waste your time trying to go here unless you live within walking distance!
author: Evan E.

description:
I'm ashamed of how long I've lived on Nob Hill without trying Za. They are extremely nice - I sat down at the counter and began babbling at them about my history in the 'hood and how I'd always wanted to try them. They listened more than politely and made lots of suggestions. Somehow rather than just getting a slice I ended up ordering an entire pizza. The whole staff swung by at one point or another to ask me if I liked the pie. Loved the pie I did. The crust is not bready - it's crisp and just thick enough to hold up the toppings. You're best off folding the slice. The toppings are generous. I loved my custom tomato sauce / pesto topping with shrooms, and olives. Their generous amount of homemade pesto is out of this world.

One thing we did not desire was to eat this pizza cold. It might be good, but the toasty crispy crust was too good to not have again. we heated the slices in a cast iron pan, stove top with a little foil over them and walla. 

Thank you Za for your hospitality and for the great pie.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
I have lived in the neighborhood for years now and often walk my dogs around the hood and while doing so, we pass the many restaurants that:

1. I won't allow myself to SPLURGE on such extravagant dining; and 
2. I will not permit myself to indulge in excess fats/carbs, etc.  

There are two places on Hyde that fall under category 2 = Za Pizza and Swensen's Ice Cream Shop.  Many friends in the neighborhood praise both and are always astounded and question "you've lived here this long and you've never tried ZA or Swensens?"  "You're missing out, you gotta try them."

Finally, I decided to indulge and take a seat outside of Za's Pizza with my trusty BFF's (best fur friends).  Monday nights on Hyde Street are not as busy with tourists and diners eating out, so I figured tonight is the night, I am craving pizza, let's see what this place is about.

Waiter - Attentive, very friendly, suggestive and helpful.  Service prompt and food  delivered with a smile.

Problem is - I was NOT as impressed with Za's as my friends seem to be.

Problem is, I consider myself a salad aficionado and always when dining out I order a salad, so when I inquired about a side salad, the garden veggie salad appeared to be the server's fave and not that of the Caesar.  

For a $7.00, I had high expectations.  I expected an abundance of LEAFY GREENS, tomatoes, mushrooms, red onions and sweet bell peppers.  What I got was disappointing; the so-called veggie salad consisted of mostly white and light green parts of the core of the lettuce and also added were a few cores.  YUK‼!  There were no visible leafs from the head of the lettuce.  There were however very few visible tomatoes and mushrooms, and quite a bit of red onion, red and green bell pepper.  

Where were the LEAFY GREENS that make up the majority of the salad?  I dunno, but they certainly didn't make it to my plate.  I should have sent it back, but the server was busy and I was hungry so I gave it try hoping the salad dressing would mask the core salad; I ended up feeding most of the white/light green parts to my bff, Ms. Emma who was ever so eager to help (she'll eat anything).  

My Monday Meat Lovers slice was questionable too, questionable in "Where's the beef?"  What meat I noticed was teeny tiny bits of meat sprinkled in one section of the slice.  I wouldn't call this a meat lover's slice and rather more like a cheese lover's slice.  I didn't detect anything else outstanding about the slice either (i.e., mushrooms, olives, etc.)  The sauce was definitely good and it took back to some of my favorite childhood memories; the pizza crust was incredibly thin which I kind of liked - in that the slice was NOT thick and overloaded with cheese and oil; I didn't feel guilty indulging in the carbs.

Would I go back - yes!  The atmosphere was pleasant, warm and welcoming - service was friendly, suggestive and prompt.  However, when I do go back I'll be ordering a pie made my way - with lots of meat and a slightly thicker crust (but definitely NOT Chicago style).  And the salad - no thank you, I will pass.
author: Cris B.

description: Awesome pizza! Three of us ordered a medium size Dalli. The owner is a very cordial person. Loved this place and the pizza.
author: Cheryl R.

description:
Really enjoy the pizza, not the service.

After getting delivery from them in the past, we are now literally 1 block out of their delivery zone and they refuse to serve us. They just lost a great customer for what? Bad business model.
author: Nicole T.

description:
This place have been my sis and I's go to pizza spot when she used to live 3 blocks up on Hyde. It's cheap and definitely GOOD pizza!

Thus, it was time to finally introduce the whole family to this goodness. It happened last Sunday - the place wasn't packed yet so our timing was good since we were 7. The place is small so fitting in 7 was quite a challenge but it worked.

My sis created her own combo (forgot what it was but it was delicious). We ordered one whole large of her special combo then a medium pepperoni. We all each a glass of beer. 

It was good dinner with good people. Can't beat that. Service was awesome...friendly and one of the guys behind the counter was kinda cute =) Nah I didn't make a move, I'm shy =P

I'll be back w/my girls for sure!
author: Cath M.

description: Pizza so good you don't want it to end.  Great little pizza joint, uber friendly owner, small but nice beer selection.
author: Paul H.

description: Really mixed feelings about the service. They wouldn't take my order when I called in like they were just "okay great thanks" and didn't take my name or anything so I had a feeling. Then I went in myself to check up on it and they hadn't made the order so the guy pulled out a random large pizza (probably somebody else's) and was like here I'll give this to you for $10 and I couldn't pass that up. So it was a loss but a win....
author: Hannah W.

description: Awesome pizza place! The place is casual but the service is amazing and the pizza delicious. Willy is great, he kept refilling our wine glasses. Definitely recommend!
author: Ruby V.

description:
I've just been there with my wife and kids. We took the cable car at Powel Street and went all the way up until Hyde Street, super close to Za Pizza. 
I was amazed by the quality of the pizza. We had one pepperoni pizza and another one half pepperoni and half pesto+chicken. Though both were very good, the pepperoni was something from Heaven !  I've never tasted something so good. Highly recommended.
author: Wagner M.

description:
We love the pizza from here so much! Tonight went with the 1/2 sweet sausage and 1/2 spicy sausage and add spinach all over. 

It's worth driving 20 minutes for.... Best pizza in SF! Just love the sauce and ground sausage!
author: PK R.

description:
This is the kind of pizza place I've been waiting my whole life to find. 

Slices are huge. Crust is perfect. Kitchen is filled with hot sweaty men. Mmm.
author: Tiffany V.

description: The pizza is great, but good luck getting them to pick up the phone for a delivery order. They don't seem to be on popular delivery apps, either. Not sure if they care, but they're leaving a lot of business on the table.
author: Morgan W.

description: Really avoid this place. First of all the food was average. It was cheap so you get what you pay for. Secondly, their workers are rude as hell, like they'd rather not be there. Left a really bad taste in my mouth. Will not go again.
author: Andrew T.

description: This is really excellent pizza! Light, crispy crust that is just the right balance of crispy and chewy. Excellent sauce. Our slices were limited to cheese and pepperoni but they were excellent. Slices are huge! However they will cut into smaller squares for kids. We were here on a Saturday and the place was full of families with small kids and rock in the KidzBop and Disney tracks. Super friendly owners/staff.
author: Terri S.

description: One of my favorite pizza in town. Pizza Za never fails, always taste great! The stuff is very friendly. Eventhough the place is so tiny, on a sunny days they put tables outside so you can enjoy the fresh air, crunchy pizza while sipping good celection of beer and wave to the cable car passing by. Love Russian hill neighboorhod with local food.
author: Stella N.

description:
Very nice place to have a pizza around the Russian Hill. Looks very casual, most of the orders made there are clearly take away & delivery, but there are a few tables available. The staff is very attentive & polite.
There are tons of kids' drawings hanged around, which is also pretty cool. 

My pizza itself was quite good, but not exceptional and hence, 4 stars.
author: Piotr G.

description:
Yum, yum, and more yum.  Just about the best pizza in SF.  Whenever I'm in the neighborhood I always stop by for a slice.  The pizza is New York style, thin crust, fold in half, with top notch ingredients.  You can get just a slice or order the whole pie.  Either way it's fantastic.

They guys that work there are incredibly friendly and always make you feel welcome.  It's a small space with a Mom & Pop type feel.  I highly recommend it.
author: Shane E.

description: Never again. Ordered delivery and told 35 minutes. I called an hour later to check and said it was out for delivery. Called 40 minutes later to find out there was a "mistake" it was sitting for pick-up , not delivery. They offered to deliver a pizza that was sitting for over an hour. NO Thank you! Customer service and organization is kinda a thing you need to run a restaurant. 2 hours later, hungry and food-less. Never again Za!
author: Jennifer G.

description: I love pizza and this place is really good.  Love the Da Vinci's Palette Pizza.  The place is small.  The service was great as well.  NY style pizza at its best.
author: Peter W.

description: So Gooooood. Love it. yyummy thin crusts
author: Chandni K.

description: This place isn't family friendly so don't bring little kids there. Their pizza tasted ok but you  could easily tell it's not made by real Italian.  If you like alcohol,  then this place is definitely for you.
author: S L.

description: Hands down, best pizza in SF.  Love the Hawaiian (turkey Canadian bacon!!!) and a massive salad with  the honey mustard.  Great hometown feel, great beer selection.  Sorry, no ranch...but real locals know the honey mustard is 100x better.
author: laurel f.

description:
My favorite go-to neighborhood pizza joint!

Here's the deal about ZA coming from a guy whose in here 1-2 times a week,

great pizza, awesome vibe and atmosphere, and fresh anchor steam on tap. All the boys that work here a mad cool once you get to know them. Brooks, the owner, is a very friendly guy whose always taking care of his customers. Place really has that old school san francisco vibe with the cable car passing out front. Pizza is a great thin crust ny style and portions are generous. They have kick ass ceasar salads that you can add chicken to. Always some cool jams playing as well, old school rock, reggae, etc. All in all my favorite hole in the wall pizza joint in the city!

ZA is the best!
author: Phillip F.

description: The BEST pizza in SF!  This little hidden gem in Russian Hill is by far the best pizza I've had in the 7 years I've lived in SF (and I've been to quite a few).  My favs are the Sweet Frank (sausage, cheese, mushrooms, green onions) and the potesto (thin-sliced red potatoes, garlic and pesto).  Delicious.  (Be warned though, their slices are HUGE).  Highly recommend this friendly, neighborhood pizza place!!
author: M. S.

description: Pizza Za is our go to for takeout pizza in Russian Hill. It's often very busy, so be patient, but always good. Decent crust, awesome toppings, Za is the perfect casual pizza joint kicked up a notch. You won't be disappointed if you order takeout or dine in.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: This place has the RUDEST staff. Recently, we came here for a quick bite. We proceeded to the counter to order our food. The guy who took our order did not ask whether or not we wanted to eat in or take it to-go... no big deal right? After placing our order, 2 seats at the counter/bar opened up so we sat down. A little after 5 mins later, the guy hands us our food in to-go boxes. We didn't think much of it so we decided to eat where we were sitting. (Reminder, this is a casual pizza joint, not a formal restaurant). In the middle of eating our food, the guy rudely tells us that we had ordered our food to-go, which we never did, and tells us to give up our seats so someone else could have it.....wow..... the last time I checked the counter/bar seating was OPEN seating. There was no waitlist or reservation to prioritize who could sit first. Why didn't anyone say anything while we were sitting there waiting for our food? I felt that they just wanted us to leave since they had already packed our food to-go (even though we never asked for it to-go and actually came in with the intent of sitting down to eat). I was very appalled by this and felt a bit discriminated against. We will never return.
author: Lynn T.

description: Best pizza place ever. Awesome wine. Awesome pizza. Awesome staff. I'll come here for ladies time always!! Thank you :)
author: Esther V.

description: this place has the worst service and staff in SF.  The Pizza is average. Why would anyone spend their money here.
author: Rene B.

description: From seattle. Walking around found it. Owner is very cool. Good pizza good beer. Good people. Loved it
author: Derek K.

description: I really love the pizza here! The crust is awesome and they have a great variety of specials that are very yummy. I really enjoy coming here.
author: Joy H.

description: Really tastey thin-crust za. Had it for delivery and held up in transit.  The do broccoli as a topping, which is pretty cool.  Only negatives were they put ham rather than bacon on my pizza and it was pricey - $30 for a three-topping large.
author: Drew H.

description:
I love ZA! I usually get the Da Vinci or pineapple and pepperoni. The pizza is aways amazing and the delivery is quick. Tonight I ordered at 4:50 and they said it would be 45 minutes... pizza was here at 5:15! 

The individual slices are awesome as well. The only reason for 4 stars is because they do not have ranch :(
author: Lauren W.

description:
The reviews are great, but honestly this is just another average pizza delivery place. I'm a bit shocked by all of the 5 star reviews.

Delivery was pretty fast, though the guy on the phone was a bit rude.

I would probably order again, since it was a tiny bit better than some of the other delivery options in the area.
author: Captain B.

description:
The scents that waft out of this tiny shop stop me in my tracks, every. single. time.  I don't know what they do, but their scent-style marketing works like a charm. 

I've done takeout, but dined in last night and left in pizza heaven. If you're in the mood for delicious pizza, a no frills, tight-knit ambiance, Za is your place.  We customized a large pizza - half sausage/half pep.  This thing was huge, it scared me a little bit. It came out quickly and piping hot.  We thought the pie stood no chance against my two trusty diners and I, but we were wrong. Score for leftovers today! 

Oh, and if you're going to splurge on the pizza, do yourself a favor and shuffle half a block up to Swensen's for an ice cream night cap :)
author: Brianna M.

description: Was walking along and stopped for a slice here. Fantastic.  Guys working here have big personalities. Crust was perfect and pizza very flavor able.  Winner
author: Greg C.

description: Always great service and great food. Even though the place is tiny, staff go out of their way to make you feel at home. Premium ingredients at a fair price.
author: Chris B.

description: Honestly I would drive 7 hours to San Fran just for this pizza. I've been to San Fran four times now and every time I get Za Pizza at least twice. That potesto pizza is so addicting. It's kind of a hole in the wall place right off Hyde, conveniently along a cable car route for tourists to hop off and get some great piZza and salad. The owner was there every time I went and you can tell he loves his business and customers. It feels very homey and comfortable in there and it's a good escape from the chaos of San Francisco. Also near the wharf if you just wanna take a nice walk over for some lunch or dinner, I wish I lived closer :(
author: Brenna P.

description: Ordered a simple sausage (sweet and spicy combo) pizza and loved it. Salad was really fresh too. Delivery was on-time too so they scored the trifecta!
author: Scott B.

description: I want to write a review based on their food but instead I am writing a review based on what they did not do. I called in an order for delivery, gave them my correct address etc. paid for the order, everything normal at this point. But When my order was supposed to arrive I get a call from the driver saying he doesn't deliver to my address. Basically he's sitting in his car, with my order telling me he can't drive down to my street. YAY. This is such bad customer service it is not even funny and now im hungry on hold with Victor's Pizza on polk street because it sounds like they will deliver to me. Again I wish I could write a review about Za based on their food but instead I an't because they won't even deliver my food. Do not call them for delivery as their delivery zone changes at will.
author: Erik P.

description:
Some nights, all you need is a giant NY-style slice, a pint, and a barstool.

Always a meat, a veg, and a basic option offered. By the slice or by the pie.

Bring your friends or bring yourself, the environment works for both.

Friendly service, a handful of beverage options, solid pizza options. You'll leave with a full stomach (and almost full wallet).
author: Alissa A.

description: the pizza was hugeeeeee. took actually like 2 minutes for pizza to come out.  crust was thin and crunchy (which is my favorite). place is outdated but amazing pizza
author: Clarissa B.

description: pizza and salad was awesome!  enjoyed the food.  salad was flavorful.  pizza was awesome.  thin crust and flavored sauces.  would I return?   of course I would!  wife enjoyed it too.  we had the cheese pizza and the protesto slices!  owner was great too!
author: Abe N.

description:
This seems like a quality operation.

The warm-up is prompt, the pizza is made well, the slices are generous, and the location is convenient and quaint. It's the kind of place where families can catch-up at a round table, single diners can drink at the bar, and kids can be kids ... and yet, it all works.

Very genuine.
author: Jackson B.

description:
Pros: Flavorful Salvador Dali -chicken sundried tomato pizza
          Cripsy crust with cornmeal underneath
           Delivered hot
           
Cons: Not cheap
           

**********************
Crust is average thickness not really thin or thick. Small salad is pretty big. The sauce has that nice tomato,garlic herbs smell. Phone service not the best but they got us the pizza. Large pizza fed us for days.
author: Kona B.

description: We had a Bluto slice with fresh spinach, Italian sausage, mozzarella and feta cheese. It was delicious and very friendly service :-)
author: Caroline T.

description:
Stopped by Za for a nice dinner on Saturday. Our server looked suspiciously like Theon Greyjoy. Let's just say, the ironborn give good service!

He was helpful, the place is charming and feels really local. Standard salad and tasty pizza. Although... a bit overpriced in my opinion. Overall, I would go back for a yummy slice!
author: Jasmine M.

description: Great service, amazing pizza and an excellent honey mustard duping sauce. Recommended for sure.
author: Rosie P.

description:
Delightful experience.  We found Za pizza on yelp and walked the extra mile to give it a try.  So happy we did this.  Small but fun place with good beer on tap.  The slice is huge and we split a salad, plenty of food.

The staff was friendly and great service

I'll be going back.
author: Drew M.

description:
Pizza here is amazing! This is honestly one of the only places I'll go in SF for pizza. 

4 stars because they close earlier than they have posted. The staff is super nice, but they tend to shut down the joint 30-45 min early regularly. Bummer!
author: Sumeet S.

description: The pizza is absolutely incredible. The service was very friendly. It is a really nice hole in the wall pizza place to watch sports. I suggest everyone have some Za pizza.
author: Spencer P.

description:
This is about Za's delivery.

Za Pizza.
I hate you.
I hate you because every single time we had the large pizza with cheese, sausage, fresh pepper, we are victim of a coma, we will lose about 3 to 4 hours for deep unconsciousness easily. 
Every single time. 
It's automatic.
Sleeping pills?
What's that for?

Za Pizza.
I hate you.
I hate you because that almost perfect nice crispy-chewy salty thin crust drives me to keep on eating.

Za Pizza.
I hate you.
I hate you because every time I have your pizza, I feel like I have an endless stomach that has no end in sight. I can NOT control my stomach at all and ... problem is ... my brain agrees with it. 
My stomach immediately control my brain when it comes to Za pizza.

I hate you because your pizza screwed up my diet so badly, I gain weight.
author: Nobu K.

description: Had the Bluto pizza. Sweet sausage, feta and spinach. It was pretty great and they had it ready by the slice. Great late night place, guys working there were super chill. Very casual. I'll be back.
author: John Z.

description:
Fancy SF exterior disguising a genuine East Coast pizzeria.  
Not sure if I should be comparing it to the trendy SF pizza joints like Pizzeria Delfina or Gialina or to the one in Haymarket I used to frequent in Boston. Set up is made for grab & go or a quick bite - seating is mostly on bar stools with 4 tables for groups. Service was efficient - we got waters quickly & our order was taken shortly thereafter. Combination pizza choices have fun names but are kept simple with a couple of items, no frills but with the quality of ingredients I have come to expect from SF establishments.  Thin crust cornmeal pizza stays crispy all the way through the meal. A friend and I split a medium a Da Vinci's Palette (red & green peppers, spicy sausage, onions).  The slices were huge (the size of my plate)!  Good ratio of cheese to toppings, could taste the flavor profile of each ingredient.  I can't believe I ate half the pizza!

5 stars for food, 4 stars for service

Of note: for the mildly lactose intolerant like me whose stomach doesn't usually tolerate the high lactose mozzarella cheese on fancy pizzas found in SF, Za's cheese was fine, no tummy ache later on. :)
author: Catherine A.

description: I love this place! Cozy place with lovely staff. Owner give warm welcome to their customer and myself! Special pizza for each day. Good quality of raw material,hygiene,good taste! Thanks
author: Ao S.

description:
Tasty thin hot pizza accompanied by a small but good selection of beer. This place is super friendly and has a community feeling to it. Good vibes all around.

It's a great spot for a quick slice and a brew.
author: Sabrina J.

description:
My sis made me trek up the hill to try this place. If you like thin crust, you'll love ZA Pizza. The staff here are really fast. We never had an empty cup and they picked up our plates right as I was finishing. We also had a salad which was quite large. It reminded me of the big salad in Seinfeld. They even split it up into three different bowls.

We ordered the Salvador Dali which had pesto, chicken and sun dried tomatoes. It was pretty tasty but I'm not sure if the chicken was needed. The prices seemed reasonable too. If I'm craving thin crust, I'll go here.
author: Amy J.

description: This place has great pizza great people, and fantastic salad. We have never had a salad with so many beautiful fresh vegetables, his basil vignette was amazing. My husband had Monday meat pizza and I had pepperoni, both so perfect. The owner is so great, you should come in just to meet him. A worth while experience!
author: Carody B.

description:
Good Pizza.
Not world changing, write home and tell your friends about it pizza pie.
Small dining room...but its the city right???
Few different beers on tap, the owners are sweet hearts and care alot bout what they serve and how.
In the area?
Looking for a good quick meal, at a decent price?
"Pizza Pizza" has given you to many heart attacks and the cheese is speaking to you?
Tired of "canned" pizzas...
Try this place..Great spot.
author: Mark S.

description: Nice fresh pizzas . I liked their slices and tried one of each Sweet Franks and Van Dough . Both were very good . Small neighborhood place and the ovens are nearby so the place can get really hot
author: Vin M.

description:
Okay, I know which side of the fence to come down on now. After a couple unsuccessful attempts, I've reached my saturation with 20 minutes of getting a busy signal trying to order. That's 16 phone calls, over a 20 minute period between 6:10 and 6:30. 

Their pizza is good, but not so good I can't find someone else to feed me. Sorry, Za, I give up.
author: Dave T.

description: Amazing pizza in SF!! I like just a classic cheese with extra sauce and well done. It's perfect and being from Boston it's the closest to being authentic east coast thin style crust and sauce. Very addicting!
author: Tracy B.

description:
Not much you can do to disappoint 15 drunk/costumed people, who'd been running from zombies for the last 4 hours (Journey to the end of the Night, anyone?).

We were starving and ecstatic to stumble upon this pizza joint in one of the "safe zones". Also, I live half a block away and we'd just made a pit stop to fill our CamelBaks with more iced tea, vodka, and jagermeister. This was EXACTLY what we needed.

Oh and one of the delivery guys had the MOST ADORABLE PUPPY. That + the pizza + our newly filled CamelBaks were an awesome combo.

I remember eating..
* Potato pizza
* Sausage pizza
* Cheese pizza

Slightly thicker crust but with a good crunch on the bottom. Good ingredients. Good balance of sauce, toppings, and cheese (you can definitely taste the tomatoes). 

Buy the whole pizzas, because my fried got a slice of the cheese and it definitely tasted older and more stale.

Oh and they were totally cool about hosting 15 really rowdy people. And gently kicked us out at when they closed (was that really 11pm already??).
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I had originally planned to write only 5 star reviews on Yelp - saving my public opinion for only the very best. In fact, the pizza from Za Pizza is a solid 4.5 stars, so maybe would have gotten a review.

Well, it took the strangest, rudest sequence of events to get me to prompt my first 1 star review.

Their pizza is solid, as most have noted, but WOW the hard to believe sequence I just had with their delivery driver demanded a public announcement.

The delivery wait on a Friday was about an hour fifteen - no big deal, the place is popular.  And the guy on the phone, while curt and not so friendly as others have mentioned, was not a big deal to me.

But that delivery driver...

When my buzzer rang, I did what I do for every other of the dozens of delivery places I order from - I buzzed the driver through the security gate, to walk a few steps to my door in our small outdoor courtyard.

When I opened the door, he angrily shoved the pizza at me proclaiming that he had tried to call me on my cell phone and I didn't answer (movie was on, didn't hear the ring - I know, can you believe my gall?!).  He was literally writhing in anger.

I asked if something was wrong with my buzzer? He said in a straight (and very angry face): 'we don't ring buzzers, we don't go to your door, we call you, you come outside'....UH, OKAY BUDDY, wait what - you don't ring buzzers or go to doors when delivering food?!?!?!

Perhaps if this was a strange requirement of Za Pizza and truly Za Pizza only that you need to answer your phone, not the buzzer and walk to the street - that they might have wanted to mention this on the phone when ordering, or on the website - or anywhere?!

Yet still, I incredulously signed the receipt and STILL tipped him $3 and said thank you.  After that he actually said the following: 'I will never deliver here again and you are out of the delivery area anyway'. Hmmm, I'm in Pac Heights, they are next door in Russian Hill, and now I'm out of their delivery zone? And, I'm not looking for favors, had teh guy on the phone said I was out of the area, that would have been fine by me - except they had delivered to me 3-4 times in the last year - no problems with delivery area then.

Wait, because I missed a call and you actually had to ring a buzzer and wait 20 seconds while I tipped you, you now like to berate your customers?

Out of principle, I would urge you all to seek your delivery pizza elsewhere, at least until the driver (in a gray Mini Cooper) is either fired or realizes he truly is miserable in his job and life in general and quits.

Oh, and you're comment about not delivering to me again...well, ZA, you sure don't need to worry about a call ever coming from me again.
author: Don D.

description:
Absolutely horrific customer service. The guys at this joint are an absolute joke and were some of rudest people I have ever have to deal with.

I tried ordering a pizza from this establishment only to be "greeted" on the phone by what sounded like an angry teenager. Only took him a couple of sentences to get me to cancel my order.

Do yourself a favor and forget about Za Gourmet.
author: Robert B.

description:
Here's my update on their pizza delivery:

We were quoted 45 minute delivery, came on time and was hot.  The pizza is kinda pricey ($26 for a large two topping) but it was excellent, I really like their NY style slices, not as much cheese but still great.  The roma tomatos and anchovies were very good.  Thanks!
author: Kevin W.

description:
I used to live next door to Za. It was like living next to Heaven.

Best pizza on Earth, PERIOD.
author: Christina S.

description: Scaliano - THE BEST! Our go to pizza in SF, hands down. I love getting a side of honey mustard to go with - delish.
author: Jordan P.

description:
I remember reading about the hubbub in the NY times when a slice of 'za was found to have hit the $5 mark. Mind you this was at what was purported to be the best pizza place in NY, and if memory serves the perfectionist owner insisted on making each pizza himself, but his health and age caused his working days to be reduced. So the $5 was partly to compensate. 

The barely hot $4.60 slice I had at Za ain't even a close second despite the price.
author: Henry Y.

description: I had an amazing thin crust pizza, which was crispy, and had just the right amount of cheese, veggies and dough. One of the best in SF for sure
author: Vlad A.

description: Just making the hike up the hill and came across this place. Super busy, smelled intriguing, stopped for a couple of slices to take with us to hotel as an after dinner snack. Not bad. Nice locale, they dealt with a crowd pretty well.  Enjoyed the people while waiting. Wouldn't make a detour for it though.
author: Susan S.

description: quality pie. quality pie. good to share, for sure. did i mention..quality? good neighborhood dig. solid stop for you guys on the romp. A+
author: Juls C.

description: Delicious pizza - the crust is thin and perfect.   Cooked right to the edge of perfection.   Staff is friendly.   Good with kids.   Awesome place.
author: Garcon R.

description:
This one time, my roommate wanted to order some pizza.  Seeing as how this place puts the "za" in "pizza" or so we say, she gave them a ring-a-ling.

The following is what I observe late one night:

She dials.

She waits.

She speaks, "Hi, are you still delivering?"

She listens.

She gets bold and states, "Cool.  I'd like to order a pizZAAAAAAAAAH!"

She looks at her phone, confused.  

She laughs.  "They hung up on me."

She fucked up.  Za was not a fan of her lame pun.

Za end.
author: Keeks K.

description:
These guys delivered my order an hour late (took two hours).  I was pretty pissed, but i was told that I would get a 50% off credit on my next order b/c my pizza was somehow forgotten about

lo and behold my credit isn't there when I tried to reorder a month later.  Apparently they tape stuff like this on a note and stick it on the wall.....yes this is 2012.  I carry a minicomputer in my pocket and these guys are using post it notes to track their customer 

anyways, i've been a long time customer, but never ordering from these guys again.
author: Eddie K.

description:
I've ordered Za in the past and the pizza always tastes great. The delivery service has been spotty in the before but nothing like what I'm experiencing  tonight. 

Called in at 5:30pm and was told the pizza would arrive in an hour. At the 1.5 hour mark we were antsy so we started calling...no answer. It's now almost 8pm and we still have been unable to get a hold of Za. At this point we are all in agreement that the pizza is not coming, but like I said, no answer so no way of confirming. Even worse, they have my credit card so it looks like I'll have to go through the credit card company to reject the charge. 

Horrible service, Very Disappointing. I love the pizza but you've lost my business Za.

Update: the pizza finally arrived 2 hrs and 50 minutes after we ordered. We refused to accept the pizza, and sent it back to the restaurant. Not the delivery man's fault and it's very unfortunate his tips must suffer due to poor management.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I struggle to write this review because this is our neighborhood go-to pizza place... 

The pizza is always AMAZING but the service is terrible (unless Brice is working). Our latest experience was on Friday, October 24th. We tried to pre-order a pizza at 5:30 to have delivered 7-7:30 and was told NO to call back 1 hour before we wanted it. We started calling at 6p and called repeatedly for about an hour. When we did finally get through we were told it would be a 2-3 hour wait. So we decided to walk to the restaurant. There were 3-4 guys behind the counter when we mentioned the phone conversation they were terribly rude. We ordered two slices to go but then asked to share a table with another couple.  After we sat down, the counter guy approached us and was visibly upset, he said that we should have waited until a table was empty then order our pizza.  Odd experience. Good pizza - weird/bad service.
author: Jody G.

description:
Let me just start by saying that their pizza is amazing! I tend to order once a month with roommates on a lazy Sunday.

However, their costumer service on the phone is by far the most horrific experience I've ever encountered in the restaurant industry. One of the guys had put in an order for a few friends and I. An hour later we called to check up on the order and a different guy tells me the original order was never placed. Horrrrible!

The guys on the phone are rude, noisy background, and absolutely horrific.

I think 'pick up' will be a better option next time I consider ordering from them.

I give it one star because the pizza it's self is delicious, however, the guys that work there are terrible and rude.
author: Juan S.

description:
What a NY style pizza gem in SF! 

I came here a few months back with a friend and got a solid slice of cheese pizza. I've been searching for such a slice since I got back from NY and I finally found it. I know folks are turned off by the service but they were pretty friendly to my pal and I. Granted there were no others in the place when we went so maybe they just had time to kill. 

Love love it though, will be back again for sure.
author: Raina B.

description:
The pizza is really good and they deliver really fast. However, like everyone has said before, their phone service is pretty bad. I like their pizza that's why I keep ordering from them but they really need to learn how to speak to customers on the phone. Just recently I ordered a pizza and of course it was loud there due to the game. So I'll give them that. I was about to give him my card number when the guy on the phone said hold on, so I hold. Then when he came back he said "So are you gonna give my your number or what?" Then I proceeded to say "Oh I thought I was on hold" and he said "You were." So I'm kinda pissed at how rude the guy was but their pizza is good and I would order from them again but only if I 
REALLY need to.
author: Angela J.

description: Back on my great list again after dining in a few times.  This is the best pizza in my hood, hands down.
author: Matt P.

description: I happened across his place while walking around Russian Hill on a Saturday afternoon. It's a fairly simple setup offering cheese or pepperoni slices with 2 more specialty options as well. The custom make whole pies with most anything you'd want but I stuck with traditional slices. Pizza was pretty good and a solid NY slice. They offer a few local beers on tap if you need a beer as well. The staff is very friendly and the service is quick. It's definitely a good spot to stop in to get your pizza fix.
author: Jason W.

description: Love this place. Went there for the first time and I always appreciate a very laid back, cool environment. The people who work there are laid back, not to serious and the pizza is delicious. At first when we were in there, it was all a younger crowd but within the hour we saw families, older couples, etc. It was very fun  to hang out there! Thanks for the awesome service!
author: Angelica D.

description: Awesome owner, great customer service, great food and great vibe.  Check it out if you are in San Francisco.
author: Sonal H.

description: The pizza is huge and crust good. Wish there were more toppings and less sauce. Tried both the vegetarian and meat slices. Toppings were good but pizza needed more. The Caesar salad is delicious and enough for two.
author: Barbara M.

description: Great Pizza.  This is a little hole in the wall but well worth the visit. Great pizza.  Great service very friendly. Our young waiter from Boise Idaho was the best.  They serve a larger pizza 18" if you eat in.  16" if you take out.  Well worth the value to eat in, just take the left overs with you. Will defiantly eat there again when we visit.
author: Mini L.

description: I live in sacramento orginally from NYC. I was looking for good pizza and found this place on yelp so I decided to make the drive from sacramento to check it out. It's a cute little place the staff is friendly and the pizza is delicious. They get fresh ingredients (at least some of them) from their local farmers market and I love when people support farm to fork.  The slices are bigger than Rays pizza in NYC. The only dissapointing thing is they don't make custom slices and this place isn't a traditional pizza parlor in that they keep several custom hot pies ready to serve slices. Still delicious big slices and fresh ingredients! They make their pies fresh to order and they keep cheese and pepperoni avaliable for slices. A full large pie is a lot of pizza and only 28 dollars plus tax. You will definitely fill up with a medium though.  Thanks guys!
author: Ryan S.

description:
So I got my hair down on Polk, and I was hungry for dinner, I did some research on Yelp of course on where to find some good food I can take home. Came across this local pizza joint. O-M-G this pizza is so flippin good! You think how can pizza especially by the slice be super good, but I'm telling you its kinda like gourmet pizza. I got a slice of Olive Oil (not sure why they name it this cuz theres more too it then olive oil) it has tomato, spinach, garlic, and feta. Then I got the side salad, the homemade basil vinaigrette is out of this world!!!! I love it so much. Now I also asked the guy for a side of ranch he looked at me kinda crazy, like oh your a ranch girl but I enjoy some ranch who cares. Anyways... he suggested the homemade honey mustard that they have instead and literally its so good I dreamt about it that night in my sleep.

COME HERE EAT HERE YELPERS AWESOME!!!
author: Jess O.

description: Potesto pizza! We order their pizzas all the time in our office, but I finally go the chance to stop in for a slice after a long run. The place is SUPER small, and was packed, but one of the servers pulled a wire table and 2 chairs outside on the sidewalk for us - that's all we needed!  Also great for people watching since cable cars were going by during our dinner :)
author: Sheena C.

description: I actually love the pizza.....is my favorite in the city the deliver service is horrendous. It takes about 1hr 30 half to deliver the pizza and when you call they always put you on hold for 20 minutes. Once they deliver they call you so you can go downstairs because the delivery guy is to lazy to bring your pizza to your home. Avoid the delivery  service is a nightmare.....great delicious pizza once you get it though...
author: Baldomero S.

description:
I've read many yelps about pizza and specifically laments about the fact that it's difficult if not impossible to find in San Francisco a pie or slice equivalent to a New York slice.  Having lived in Manhattan for a number of years I can well understand the bar being set, level of pizza pie excellence being demanded.

Alas, Za may want to consider pulling back just a slight fraction on the amount of sauce they apply to their pie.  

If you don't do so already, allow me to suggest you request 'extra crispy crust' that for me dear reader takes this pie near rarified heights and certainly the best pie I have thus far tasted in my lovely new home, San Francisco.  

You could do a lot worse than Za Gourmet Pizza.

Enjoy.
author: Jay D.

description:
I tried again to get them to deliver. I haven't been able to get their pizza off my mind.

THIS is how good they are!

I called mid day, mid weekend & they were agreeable! I tipped the driver a full 20% just to show my appreciation -- he didn't blink or thank me, but I didn't care! I had my pizza!!!

I tried the Popeye: Spinach & Feta -- superb! Even better than the Italian sausage/mushroom or the Potesto- pesto/garlic/potato.

Highly recommended!
author: Yasi S.

description:
Yes, the potesto pizza is AH-MAZING!  Potato?  And pesto?  On pizza?  Yes, please.

We also ordered the Salvador Dali (chicken/sundried tomatoes/pesto/tomato sauce) which was also excellent.

We ordered the pizzas for delivery and they managed to get to us in a timely manner.  However, we had a very difficult time calling in as some other reviewers mentioned.  Three of us all on cell phones calling in constantly for about 10 minutes until one of us said, "It's ringing!"  You could say that we were determined.

But you know, that's just a sign that it's a pizza worth waiting for.  And it is.
author: Angela D.

description: Za is tiny but hospitable and they put out a mad amount of pies! By the slice, whole pies and salads - we had salads and slices and both were delicious - love the crust!!! And the staff was super friendly even though they were crazy busy. Just visiting San Francisco but would be a regular if I lived here!
author: Meredith D.

description: Got here at 9:29. The staff said they were already closing when their hours were til 10:30. A bit disappointing but they said we could order pizza by the slice and take it to go. Not my ideal form of customer service but what can you do. I got a couple cans of soda though as they were closing! That's customer service. Woo hoo! Pizza was good.
author: C T.

description:
ZA is a small local pizza treasure in Russian Hill on Hyde St. I'm seriously a fan and here's the breakdown for my 5 star rating. 

+1 star for huge portions (especially if you eat there), the Medium size was enormous!
+1 star for great service
+1 star for the Scaliano pizza
+1 star for the availability of having Siracha
+1 star for the fresh Monet's salad to rid my guilt of eating all that delicious pizza!
author: Naomi C.

description:
This place was delicious.  As an east-coaster who lived in LA for a couple years before moving to SF, I've been really down on West Coast pizza (I have friends who swear that Frankie & Johnnie's in Brentwood is the second coming.  Come on!  That pizza is microwaved cardboard).  Thankfully, Za's single-handedly restored my faith.  We started with a salad, and then got a medium Da Vinci's Palette.  Great value - the portions were huge.  The service was outstanding too.  I'll definitely be back.

PS - bonus points for the music.  They had Outkast's ATLiens album playing through.  Such a great cd.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Horrible service. Tried to order at the bar and was told to take an open table and that someone would come to take my order. After 15 minutes, I'm still sitting and waiting for this mythical "waiter", with plenty of time to write this review. I keep hoping someone will come by and allow me to upgrade this review...but I guess it is time to leave and never come back.
author: Michael G.

description:
Had the worst experience in the first two seconds on the phone. The guy was so rude, dismissive on the phone that I finally thought "no pizza is worth this" and told him never mind. 

Hung up and immediately called Patxi's Pizza where the service was like night/day. Friendly person on the phone, quickly took my order - you could hear the smile on their face. 

Za? Sounded pissed he had to take phone orders, I must have been keeping him from his break. Will never go there again - especially when there are so many other good AND friendly pizza spots in SF.

The only reason for the 1 star is it's the only way to post the review.
author: Renee J.

description: They were open and engaged on a catatonic Monday afternoon in Russian Hill (everything else was either sparse, closed or both), and the art on the walls was a nice mix by adults and children, and someone was playing obscure tunes by The Band on an endless loop.  A nice guy refilled my wineglass and told me about something I need to see in the Mission.  I will come back for pizza some day--it smelled lovely but was not an immediate priority.
author: Suzanne E.

description:
This is a super tiny restaurant with maybe 4-5 tables and a bar area. We came in around 1:00pm on a Saturday and were able to find one table free to seat the four of us.
