Crust is super thin and crunchy. We built our own medium pizza with our own toppings. Ordered a side salad and one of their daily slices. Prices are reasonable. Salad was fresh. Pizza was tasty. Nice sauce. I really like their pizza. I would come back. The staff is super nice. The main guy (could be the owner) gave an out of town couple a "Za pizza" t shirt for free just because the couple's son is named Za. How nice is that. 

Some people on Yelp has complained about slow service or long hold wait times when ordering via phone. But you gotta understand if you're calling around 6pm to order pizza... of course the place is going to be super busy. You're calling during primetime. 

Since this is a small place, you gotta fight for a seat or just take your pizza to go. Geez people. Be more understanding.
author: Banana B.

description: Problem with this place is that it is inconsistent ---when they are good they are very good but when they are not----only OK at best. Either way, it is still overpriced. And as for the service---every one says the same: what a bunch of F&*! Ups.
author: Bill B.

description: Been here twice for lunch. Look for the white board for pizza by the slice which is awesome. 2 specials and then cheese and pepperoni available. Pizza and service is ballin. Definately check it out if you like pizza by the slice.
author: David S.

description: Excellent pizza! Me and my fiancé got a pineapple pizza and they used fresh pineapple. No other pizza place has done that. Service was awesome as well!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Amazing slice of pizza. And the guy who owns it was amazing, super nice and makes you feel like a regular, even on your first trip in. 

I got the cheese slice and it was a great cheesy slice. The slices are huge, but they still manage to have a nice gourmet flavor to them.

Best of all its cheap! A great weekend lunch!
author: Eric T.

description: Great Pizza in San Francisco, parking is hard but if you use the cable car, is on the way
author: Jorge E.

description:
Za-normous.

Best part of the Vincent Van Dough was the clever name. Combination of tomatoes, basil and garlic was good but not great.

Getting a slice almost the size of two for $4.50 was great not good.
author: Jason B.

description:
Best pizza slice in the city, and it's not even close.  For $5, the sustenance of a slice is equivalent to a personal 10' pizza at Delfina Pizzeria, which many consider the best gourmet pizza in SF, but that will run you $13-$20.  Arguably, Za is just as good.  

The people - Jamie, Brooks, Mark, Andrew, Flavio, etc. are awesome and make you feel like part of the neighborhood.  Great casual feel to the place.  The Scaliano is my personal favorite slice, but all of their pizza dominates because of the fresh ingredients.  I've never been disappointed.
author: Thomas B.

description:
We were at a relative's house searching for a place to get some takeout.  Za Pizza became the choice for dinner.  We phone ordered the Scaliano and waited to pick up. 

 It was interesting to note that another yelper also experienced the dismissive attitude of the employee who picks up the phone to take your order.  It must have been our lucky day to get the same guy.

The pizza was good but not that good to justify the price.  I'm no pizza aficionado or anything but if something is good I will remember it.  Unfortunately Za's pizza isn't one of them.
author: Cris H.

description: I've been a regular here for years! It's awesome. The pizza is great, the people are friendly, service is fast. Just a great atmosphere always. Oh yeah, the Monet's Garden Salad is incredible, especially with the basil vinaigrette dressing and added chicken!
author: Allen C.

description:
It's become a weekly ritual to head to Za for lunch and with all the other regulars on a first name basis, it's obvious I'm not the only one.

The pizza is the best I've had so far in the city. There's considerable reasons for it too. The crust is delicious, and this coming from a guy who usually discards anything that ever resembles crust; it's salty, soft, and doesn't encompass a large portion of the slice.
The sauce is also minimal but tangy and flavorful. 
Za does different slices of the day, each day and you'll likely find a favorite.
author: Muz H.

description:
What I Ate
- Popeye the Greek (feta and spinach)
- Da Vinci's Palette (sausage, red and green peppers) are my favorites.  

Would I Go Again?
Yes.  This was the second time my company ordered Za for delivery, and I would be happy to eat it again.  My favorite part of the pizza is the crust--very thin and a great combination of crisp on the outside but chewy on the inside.
author: Ben M.

description:
I had ten New Yorkers over and they were super impressed. Za is really THE best in SF. I wish I wasn't on my Gluten-free program right now or I'd nose-dive into a huge slice in a second. 

OK, so there is one thing you should know about this place: The guys there do flirt with single ladies. At first I found this annoying, but the pizza was so good I said "Whatevs" and faced the onslaught. I mean, honestly, you're usually in yoga pants and looking fugly when you make the decision to have a takeout slice, but those guys (god bless them) still somehow make you feel like you're driving them nuts. Lol. And I've sent my friends in there (one who had full-on braces) and they say they get the same thing: good pizza with a slice of "horny". Actually, we now call it "horny pizza". Anyhow, I'm 45 so what am I complaining about? Exactly. Just go for the pizza! Get fat and feel sexy, ladies.
author: Pamplemouse L.

description:
I love the pizza... and I have loved it for almost 18 years. The owner is the biggest sweetheart. Great stuff! 
Just the odd fellow at the cash register who thinks the world is at war with him. Poor Toby... that guy needs some help. Rude, condescending,  interrupting. No manners, no care. Easily confused and flustered.  And he easily gets your order and bill wrong. 
Toby, either change professions or your attitude.
author: To K.

description: The best little pizza shop in SF.  The guys who work here are all super nice guys.  I've been a patron of Za for many years and now live in the burbs.  On my twins four year birthday we went there to get a slice.  One of the guys (sorry didn't get his name) made a point of high-fiving them, asking them if the pizza was ok,and really connecting with them.  It is a mellow place, I love all the art on the walls, and the pizza is just delicious.  I'm never disappointed.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This is my favorite pizza delivery in the city! I like stopping by for a slice, but we tend to deliver more often. I like their pepperoni, and my bf loves the sausage & pepper. Reliable, delicious, definitely worth it.
author: Liz O.

description: Still the best place for a slice in the City. Go and you won't be disappointed.
author: Joseph S.

description: Pizzaaaa! Well I just had one of the best pizzas till date. I am stilling drooling with the taste. As soon as the pizza reached my table I knew that it was going to taste amazing, but oh man the taste was a thousand times more than I had anticipated. The Van Dough was yum! The crust was as soft as anyone can imagine while the topping was extraordinary. Each and every bite of my Margherita (aka Van Dough) was filled with cheese and herbs. I cannot wait to visit this amazing place again!
author: Grethel S.

description:
We stopped by this little nugget after some great wine. We ordered slices for all 3 of us, each being different. I went for the all meat slice and it sure delivered. What flavor, spices and plenty of cheese all with a great price. 

The pizza and salad topped off our night. Thanks Za. We'll be back and we'll help spread the word. I'm craving pizza now, great. How much is a flight to SF from SNA? Grrrrr!
author: Brad G.

description: In town for a conference, took a break to go check out Lombard St, needed to grab some food.  Super friendly staff, food was amazing, and the beer was crisp.  Highly recommended!!!!!!
author: Shad M.

description: This review is based on delivery of one pizza with pepperoni and red onion. The pizza was mediocre at best and the crust that is raved about was soggy and not flavorful. The cheese was bulk mozzarella. Sauce had fine flavor but there wasn't much. If I had paid $12 or even $15 or even $20, I wouldn't have bothered to review and would have chalked it up to a bad night. But this pizza was $25.13 + tax = $27.33 for a pizza that these guys should be sad they sold.
author: David B.

description:
Table service! We were around the area and was drawn in by the aroma.

Stepped in and was greeted by very friendly staff.  Took our order (1 slice each of pepperoni,cheese,Davinci, and Olive Oil with baby spinach), also a small garden salad and a beer.

Since we were splitting a beer, they ended up giving us a pint and threw in a small glass for free.

They brought everything over quickly and the pizzas were very good.  (Large thin crust slices.) salad was very good as well, peppers, mushrooms, tomatoes and artichoke hearts along with red onions and croutons.

Seemed like everyone that came in knew the staff.

Would definitely come back again.
author: David T.

description: Listen, I judge any pizza joint by their basic cheese pizza. Now, I've had a lot of pizza in my time but the basic cheese pizza from Za is on point. A perfect combination of crispy, chewy, thin crust and a sweet sauce with savory cheese. No need to get cute with toppings, just keep it OG. You can thank me later.
author: Colin H.

description: Delivery driver literally leaves the pizza on our doorstep then leaves; we can't find him to pay. Then he has the nerve to come back ten minutes later, ring our doorbell aggressively and cuss us out for not paying. Dude, you literally LEFT.
author: Jenna D.

description:
I've been on the search for the best pizza in SF for a long time and I would have to say that Za is within my top 3.  A small hole in the wall in Russian Hill, the pizza is top notch!  If you're a fan of thin crust and big slices this is the place for you! On top of that, the service is great!  I am never leaving this place disappointed.  

I would recommend the Sweet Treat which is sweet sausage, green onions with feta cheese! Yum!!!

I take away one star simply because parking can be a pain (unless you're willing to pay 8 bucks next door at the lot)
author: Daniella J.

description: Za is, and for the last five years has been, my favorite neighborhood spot.  One of my best girlfriends and I know it as our 'place' and have a strict pact to NEVER bring anyone we are dating here, lest we develop an 'aversion by association' once we're no longer dating them.  It's loud and packed at dinner time.  They usually blare classic rock and have a game playing quietly on TV.   The pizza is really good, and reasonably priced.  The beer on tap is good and they keep you topped off.  The staff is super cool and provides friendly, casual service.  You genuinely want to tip well because they're so cool, and if you're a regular, they remember you and take good care of you.
author: Kelly S.

description: Solid pizza although a bit pricy. Caesar salad is absolutely delicious also. I love coming in here on Hyde street and sitting at the bar.
author: Eric S.

description: Za Pizza is the only good pizza I've found since I moved from the east coast (2 years), I'll keep searching, but so far there's no other pizza in the city that can compete.  The large cheese with roasted garlic topping is my absolute favorite.  Free delivery to in the immediate neighborhoods.
author: Jesse G.

description: Only given 5 stars for the gentleman named Brookes. Was the only person to actually give some customer service. Without it, would have given the place a 3 only for the quality of pizza.
author: Andrew A.

description: This is the most overrated pizza place on Yelp/SF.  There are at least 12-15 better spots.
author: Mister H.

description: Best pizza I've had in the city so far! The owner is super sweet and the service is amazing! Plus hell and high watermelon on tap, yes please!
author: Courtney P.

description: Say open to 10:30 on Yelp, called at 10:10 and they were closed... EPIC FAIL!
author: Mr. P.

description: I love Za! The pizza is delicious, the service is friendly, the beer is fresh, and the wall artwork is entertaining. I love that they throw the slice in the oven after you order it so the cheese is hot and gooey and the bottom of the crust is crunchy. I usually get the special slice of the day that's on the board, but everything is good. It just feels like such a cozy, friendly neighborhood joint where everyone knows everyone. There needs to be more places like this in the world!
author: Jessie L.

description:
I live around the corner from Za so I hit up this place on a regular basis. 

Lucky for me it's not only convenient it's also a pretty damn good pizza! The cornmeal crust is tasty, thin and crispy.

The staff is hit or miss. The one and only woman that works there is super sweet and very attentive. I can't say the same for the rest of the guys who work here as they're usually drunk or stoned and have little patience. On busy nights it takes 5-10 minutes just to get your order in and another 20 minutes for your pizza to be ready. The wait is worth it as they will occasionally take the pie out too soon and it's a little doughy. 

The restaurant is pretty small they have about 5ish tables inside and if the weather's nice they have a couple tables set up outside and there's about 8 seats at the bar as well. 

On any given day there's 3-4 specials in which you can order by the slice, otherwise you have to order a whole pie to customize or order a specialty pizza. My all time favorite is the Salvador Dali with an add on of artichoke hearts. 

Their garden salad is full of fresh veggies and a perfect side to go along with the warm, tasty and rather large slice of pizza. Seriously....their slices are the size of my arm!
author: Kristy M.

description: Small place. Big taste. We came to SF for one day from SD. We ended up coming here because the kids wanted pizza. Am glad we stopped by because the ambiance was great, the owner kept checking in with us to make sure all was good. The walls are filled with drawings of other satisfied customers. Next time we are in SF we will be stopping by. ZA!!!!!!
author: Jay M.

description:
Awesome thin crust pizza. Was stuck in my hotel for several days, recuperating from surgery and was craving a really great pizza. Za was a complete home run. Polite on
the phone, delivered right to my room, pizza was nice and hot, and the crust was thin
and crisp. Liked it so much ordered delivery a few times and then when my husband came to SF, we actually went to the restaurant and loved the atmosphere, small, local, and friendly....
author: Dria B.

description:
Za probably has the best pizza I've had in SF. I haven't gone to all the big pizza places around here, but I've been to several, and after some reflection, I do think I'd go with Za.

Keep in mind the kind of pizza we're talking about: big, sloppy thin-crust slices of the kind you'd find at that hole-in-the-wall down the street. The kind of pizza you'll grab with a beer on a weeknight so you can settle down and watch the game. This isn't a delicate little Neapolitan pie served in a precious cafe atmosphere. If you want that, go to Delfina. (Or wherever.)

As a point of clarification, I enjoy the Delfina-style pizza as much as the next guy. It's just a different sort of experience. It's the sort of thing you'd go out with friends to have on a Saturday night. It's a special occasion. It's pretentious--but that's fine. It's good; it's tasty.

But Za is an unpretentious pizza. And ultimately, that's the kind of pizza I love most. I like my pizza big, sloppy, kinda greasy, and absolutely 100% delicious. That's what Za delivers. They do a great job.

That said, I should mention that I've had some kind of crummy customer service experiences here. These were mainly the first few times I came here, when I was under the impression that they supported the stand-around-and-wait-for-them-to-hand-your-pizza take-out model of service. I've since come to learn that things work better if you sit down and order something rather than just walk up to the register and ask them for a slice. Which is a little weird, considering all the stuff I said above about making unpretentious pizza that's big and sloppy and casual. I see from some other reviews that some people find this to be a problem. I sympathize. But I really like the pizza, so oh well.
author: Greg P.

description:
After bring told there would be a 2 hour + wait at Leopold's for our party of 3, we ventured forth to find another joint with good food before heading out on a saturday night. Yelp mobile app told me about this place nearby, so why not? 

Walked in. 3 stools at the bar open. done. Ordered a medium pizza half scaliano, half salvador dali. Ordered a couple beers while awaiting the pizza to be made and having our senses teased by the aroma of the other pizza's in this place. Definitely a casual joint with seating probably for only a total of 20 people inside. 

First Bite: HOLY CRAP. I knew this place had decent reviews, but I did not expect the pizza to taste this good. All the toppings tasted fresh. The crust was thin and deliciously packed with flavor. The sauce...flawless. I personally liked the Salvador Dali a little more than the Scaliano, but both were amazing. 2 and a half slices later, and I'm stuffed and satisfied. A great surprise for only about $21 total for the pizza.
author: Andrew S.

description: I love love love this neighborhood Pizza Haven. They make the best thin crust in the city, and that is quite an accomplishment considering all of the competition. The one thing that I love about them is they offer a great vegetarian option in the Moma. But my favorite is the Hawaiian (Turkey Bacon) pizza.  Their daily specials are excellent as well, and their very generous with their portions.  Find yourself ordering one-size down from your normal pizza portions. Overall I must say that this is one of the best pizza spots in the city, I can't declare one over the other because they are all soooo good!
author: J Y.

description: Obsessed! Za is the prime combination of non fancy pizza and quality ingredients--unless you want fancy pizza, then they have that too. I don't like weird stuff on my pizza, and Za makes bomb combinations of simple ingredients (ie the Van Gogh). The slices are huge and cheap; easy to eat 2 in a sitting because of how good it is. And they'll deliver to a local bar (as long as the bar allows it). No question, my go-to pizza spot in the neighborhood.
author: Emilia S.

description: I love this place for what it is.  It is a casual neighborhood joint with delicious pizza and hefty portion of salad.  It is not gourmet but it is friendly and super chill.  It makes you feel like part of the block.
author: Peppa ..

description: We were visiting San Francisco from Seattle and walked a few blocks out of our way after reading so many great reviews about Za Pizza. It lived up to all the 5 star ratings here. The pizza was delicious, but more than that the staff and owner made us feel so at home that we were wishing we had our own Za Pizza in Seattle. We are so glad that we stopped in to this friendly neighborhood stop. We will definitely be back on our next visit.
author: Lisa N.

description: Well, am I disappointed!!!  My slice last night had no sauce, hardly any meat and was so bad I had to throw it out.  Brooks what happened?  You guys used to be great but your cutting costs. And for those of us East Coast transplants that know what pizza is supposed to taste like... Well i don't think I'm going buy your stuff any time soon.
author: Cheri C.

description: So much for our [once] super friendly neighborhood pizza joint.  Yes, it's busy Sunday evening for you.  But really, guys?  Being rude is never necessary.  I stood in line waiting to place an order to go -- + one beer to enjoy while waiting -- given there were no seats.  Just as I finished paying, two people left the bar so my fiancé sat down (unbeknownst up me), and at the same time, I was handed the beer and two slices of our three-slice order, on plates.  I presumed he saw what was happening.  I asked the cashier/ bartender if the slices and beer were ours?  "YES".  A moment later I was yelled at by the cashier, manager and a waiter for taking the food m.  I tried to apologize about my mistake, but all I got from the cashier/ bartender was an irritated, "Yeah, whatever.  It's not yours."  So I slunk over to my seat, and not two seconds after I sat down at the bar next to my fiancé, the irritated cashier/ bartender came over and now more irritated said, "You told me you were taking to go".   My fiancé responded that he found these two seats and very politely asked if it was ok to stay after all.  Again, irritated cashier answered with another rude remark, and proceeded to ignore us while I sat low in my seat confused by his attitude.  So much for a nice dinner up the street from our house
author: Mary Beth S.

description:
STOP!  DO NOT GO HERE!

Read the negative YELP reviews.  They are telling you something.  This place SUCKS!  Service is rude and they don't care about you.  Delivery is a joke and non-existent.  This place should and will be out of business.

YELPERS need to band together and send this place a message.  Your service is bad and deserves to be put out of its misery.

We ordered a pizza.  We were told it would be 45 minutes to 1 hour.  After waiting 1 hour and 15 minutes, guess what?  No pizza.  Called them back and they said they don't deliver to our area.  WTF!!!

I would give ZERO stars if I could.  But I will do better than that;  I will tell my family, my friends, my co-workers, heck people I meet on the street to not patronize this P.O.S.

Do yourself a favor.  Go to Costco and get a slice of pizza.  It tastes better without all the drama.  You have been warned.
author: Art S.

description: found them on yelp and thought we'd give them a try. so happy we did! the medium pizza was perfect for two people and it was really good! the thin crust wasn't soggy and the toppings were plentiful! we had the popeye and i loved it! the delivery took a bit longer than estimated but the delivery guy was really nice and the pizza was really good. we forgave them for the wait.
author: Tera K.

description: They lived up to my expectations for awesome customer service! Our waiter last night made us feel welcome and had a great friendly manner and made the meal fun. The pizza was one of the best I've had with a thin crisp crust and great toppings.
author: Keith S.

description:
We ordered a combo pizza that was half Moma and half Potesto. My preference was the Moma but my friend preferred Potesto. Something about potato on a pizza is just too starchy for me. Nonetheless, the thin crust pizza was delicious. We also shared a garden salad between the 4 of us. 

I wish that there had been more wine options, but it was still a great pizza and we were happy to get a table in the small and and crowded restaurant.
author: Cassandra B.

description:
The chorizo pie here was AWESOME. The crispy, chewy crust is absolutely up to snuff. The cheese to sauce ratio was perfect. The combo of spicy chorizo, tangy fresh garlic, and crisp fresh green onions was killer. This will be my go-to choice on return visits.

The potesto (a potato/garlic/pesto white pie) was also good but a liiiiiiittle on the dry side. A lot of very good pizza places struggle with their white pizzas, and unfortunately Za was no exception. It wasn't bad, but it needs work. The moisture from the potato kinda boxes you into a corner because it makes it hard to get a good crisp on the crust without overcooking the whole thing. For advice, give the folks at Basic Pizza in San Diego a call because they've got potato pizza down to a science!

The only other knock on Za is that the prices are really pushing the reasonable limits of pizza,  even for SF. I know it's gourmet, but still. $60 for two large pies is just....wow. 

Still, I'll be back!
author: Bradley M.

description: Read other reviews and got the highly-rated Scaliano. It's definitely the way to go!  Not too salty or greasy.  Perfect mix of sausage and garlic. Unfortunately the restaurant itself is really small. I wouldn't recommend eating here (I ordered take-out), but definitely a good place to order pizza from!
author: Riz W.

description:
After the 7x7 staff published results of their quest to find the best pizza delivery in SF, I thought I'd judge for myself.

Za and Patxi's came crust to crust for having the best tasting pizza delivered to your door.

I have to say Za really is the best pizza I've ever had delivered mid-day. I ordered a Medium pie with half Pepperoni & Cheese and the other half Spinach & Feta, and both were delicious. I've had 4 slices today, and it's only 5pm.

The pizza came fresh, piping hot, and only after 35 minutes of the order being placed. When I opened the box, I was surprised to find that it looked as if it might had I physically eaten on-location. The crust was crispy and not too doughy, the cheese was melted perfectly, and the toppings were neither too light nor heavy.

After keeping it in the fridge, I had another slice hours later, and it was great without even having to heat it up. Now, that's good pizza.

I'm definitely putting Za on speed dial for future orders. Too bad it's not open late night.
author: Winnie W.

description: the absolute worst delivery service. the delivery guy did not want to walk up a hill and called to tell me "i'm down the street." apparently that was code for "walk down and get your own damn pizza." he never delivered the pizza. i called the store and was informed it is now their policy not to have to deliver the pizza to the door.
author: Jason R.

description:
I've got no business writing a pizza review. I mean, I like pizza, but I don't ever crave pizza nor do I ever order a pizza when I'm hungry. But my temporary roommate hyped it so much that I had to jack a slice of his "Da Vinci's Palette" special from ZA's.

Amazing.

Simple, yet amazing.

Ingredients: Red and Green Peppers, onions, and spicy sausage, all on a thin crust pizza. Not too much sauce or piled with buckets of shredded cheese, the end result was a well put together pie.

Medium pizza was $21.00 bucks, plus delivery, plus tax. I'm on the cheaper side, but I'd definitely order it again
author: Dave K.

description:
SUPER DELICIOUS THIN CRUST PIZZA, and FREE DELIVERY? Don't mind if I do.

We got the medium sized pizza with sausage and mushrooms. Tasted really good and economically priced (~$20). Slices are huge. You don't even have to eat it with a fork and knife. Place is pretty small though, only a few tables and a bar area. Will definitely be calling them for DELIVERY.
author: Adele Z.

description: The food is good here and the staff is friendly and I like this place.  The yelp profile is misleading though as it closes before 1030 pm except on weekends.
author: Todd F.

description: Found myself here twice this week and it's only Wednesday ... It's a great neighborhood spot and good for both take out and eating in (although don't expect anything fancy when choosing to eat there). Haven't had a pizza yet I haven't liked, but the Salvador Dali is my favorite.
author: Brooke T.

description: Do not recommend, mainly due to service. Overpriced pizza, very rude people.
author: Ryan A.

description:
I don't know if it was because I hadn't eaten all day, but I scarfed down half of my mushroom and sweet sausage pizza in about 2 minutes. 

I'm excited to have found a tasty thin crusted pizza joint up the street to satisfy my occasional pizza craving. 

Definitely worth trying!
author: Allie E.

description:
I go here about once a week as I live a block away. 

BLUTO is by far my favorite slice. 

THE BEST PIZZA I HAVE HAD IN SF BY FAR.

All the dudes that work there are super chill
author: Jared G.

description: Good pizza, casual environment, good service.  We had the bluto, vegetarian, and pepperoni.  All tasted great, vegetarian was the best out of the 3.
author: Daisy L.

description: Best! Best! Best everything! The great thing is that they're real, all of them everyday, and that's priceless. (Reason for this post: Andrew went above & beyond today) Thank you!!!
author: Melissa W.

description: ZA saved my life... Enough said. I've been looking for a pizza place all day and all I could see were tourist traps or franchises... Went in, cold beer, great pizza... I will be coming back for sure.
author: Ecm P.

description:
Bleahh..I came here after a long stroll through the city last night and was just totally disappointed. I got a slice of the daily special and ordered a salad to share with the bf...I asked for my salad with dressing on the side..it came tossed in the dressing..
My slice of pizza looked as if it had been sitting out for way too long..was completely soggy. When I tried cutting up the piece all of the cheese just got mushed up..the negative experience was amplified as we sat next to a table of the most loud talking people...who managed to bump into our table throughout their stay. Okay..I know..it's a pizza joint..not a restaurant..but can't a girl enjoy a nice slice of pizza in a non-hostile environment???
Adding insult to injury..as I got up to the front to pay for our food..they brought out a pie fresh out of the oven...it did at all not resemble the crappy slice that I was dealt it!
author: Mimi T.

description: Best pizza I've ever had, great service, laid back atmosphere and reasonably priced beer. Wish I lived in San Fran just for this.
author: Melissa M.

description: Good pizza, great salads, friendly service. If they were closer or deliver to our area, I would order from them more often. But that's not the case so I've only had their food a couple of times. Their potesto is what they're known for and it's good. The scaliano is just ok. Next time I would like to try typical pizza offerings like pepperoni or combo to see how they compare to other pizza joints.
author: Al B.

description: I come here quite often and loooooove the Pizza but... You charge $3.90 for a slice of pizza but $10 for a small Cesar salad????? No surprise that people eat unhealthy!!!
author: Chris S.

description: Fresh materials, crisp pizza, kind guys.I like it.
author: Sf S.

description:
I had dinner here last night with a couple of girlfriends. We sat at the counter and had such a great time! Our server was SO nice and engaging. I love the atmosphere of this place, and how cozy it feels. The pizza is also really good and the portion size is perfect! 

We are definitely coming back again!!!
author: Christina S.

description: Great specials always tasty pie's and good beer on tap. Pizza Monster Approved.
author: Chris D.

description: Great place for a slice!! Or a whole pie!  Workers are super friendly so love eating here. Good beer on tap too!
author: Ken J.

description:
Pizza and a beer, what else do you really need? Add non-greasy, absolutely delicious thin-crust pizza to the mix of things and life really couldn't get better when you're thinking of what you should have that's low key but great enough to satisfy your weekday dinner needs. 

Delivery is free. Dining in is great as well. The service is awesome. The beers on tap are great as well and the ever changing list of pizza by the slices (if you're into that) are good as well. But really, go for the whole pie. Split it into two of their signatures and you can try two at the same time. But you will be left cursing when the half you really liked suddenly disappears within minutes. Keep an eye out for it.

We got the Scaliano (roma tomatoes, spicy sausage, fresh garlic, and green onions) and salvador dali (roasted chicken, sundried tomatoes, fresh pesto & tomato sauce). I'm torn between the two - and thankfully I didn't have to decide because we got it half an half. Two people and a medium pizza works really well. Though both were amazing, I'd have to side with the Scaliano - the spicy sausage did it. So good! And the thin crust is great - never greasy and you don't get that queazy feeling after having really greasy yummy pizza. This just eliminates the greasy part and still manages to be yummy - very yummy.

Love this place. Best pizza place in the city I've had so far.
author: Aditi R.

description:
I wish I had heeded the advice of other Yelp-ers that wrote how awful their delivery service is.

I ordered a pizza for delivery at 730 pm. Was told it'd be about 45-60 minutes. They did not take any payment information, which I later thought weird but at the time figured no biggie. One hour passes. I call them and ask about the status of my delivery. The guy on the phone says all deliveries are out. I ask if that included mine. He just repeated himself. Didn't ask what I ordered or where I lived. 

90 minutes pass. I've since mae myself a PBJ b/c I knew the pizza wasn't coming.

The guy on the phone asks me if I received my pizza. I said no. He said, okay thanks for confirming. I had to stop him and ask him what happened, why didn't I get my pizza. He said - I don't know. that's not my job. I just want to know if I should charge you for the pizza. Could not believe my ears. 

This place sucks.
author: Heather W.

description: My friends and I ordered the Scaliano (spicy sausage) and the Moma (mushrooms, onions, artichoke hearts). With tasty sausage, the Scaliano was definitely a bigger hit. I prefer more tomato sauce, but Za Gourmet Pizza uses fresh ingredients and has a great crust. Not really "gourmet" though, just expensive.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Great New York Style Pizza

Huge slices, Two are equivalent to half a pie.
Add a soda and you are out of there with about $10ish.for damage.
author: Po L.

description:
Really great service... loved the guys that were working there. 

However, the pizza was just okay. The crust was great... but the rest wasn't that special. 

There is for sure better pizza in the city.
author: Gina H.

description:
This pizza's pretty good. Thin crust style, a lot of toppings. I enjoy the veggie special pizzas here more than any other pizza place I've been to.  

There's not a whole lot of room in there so I'd scope the place out before bringing a (large) group to sit down to eat here.
author: Andrew M.

description: The pizza here is delicious. Crispy thin crust pizza made fresh when you order it, even when you order by the slice. I have never had pizza here that was not hot out of the oven. Service is friendly and quick, and I love the neighborhood feel. I used to spend a lot of time in Russian Hill and this was my favorite Friday night pizza and beer place. Perfect for a quick slice and brew with friends or fast and hot delivery!
author: Florence M.

description:
I have had them deliver a number of times and they are always very friendly and accommodating.
The pizza is very good and the salads are large and fresh
author: SF H.

description:
I thought I knew what good pizza was. And then I went to Za. 

The veggies are fresh, the cheese is perfect, the sauce is delicious, and the crust....AMAZING. 

There are only a few tables and bar stools, so if you come and the place is packed, do NOT leave. You won't regret the wait!
author: Krisi W.

description:
It's a travesty I haven't reviewed this place yet. I live a block away, I come here 2-10 times a week (depending on if my gf is out of town or not... haha) 

Best thin-crust pizza I've had in SF, hands-on. Ingredients always fresh, pizzas always super creative. I've tried every kind of pizza they have, some are for sure better than others but all are bomb. I'm super happy I live nearby.

By the way, I hate that Yelp doesn't let you flag others' reviews. That "Ziyan C" person leaves a 3star review but rambles on about how good this place was... Makes no sense. Long live ZA
author: Rob G.

description:
This place is close to home and they are reasonablity priced.  I can't complain.

Za definitely is one of those places I frequent when I don't want to cook dinner.  I also love that it's on Hyde and the cable car dings as it goes by.
author: Sofia H.

description:
I've lived just a few blocks away from Za for 7 years...or at least for however long its been around, and I've never tried it out until a month ago.  I've been missing out!

Ordered some delivery and got the Moma.  So good.

I usually order from Uncle Vito's since they offer pasta dishes as well.  But when it's just pizza I want, I'll be going for the Za from now on.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Slowest delivery ever - like watching paint dry!

We ordered a medium pizza and a salad on an evening where there was "a little" rain.  I did not expect to wait almost an hour and a half for my pizza. We literally were 5 blocks away... FIVE BLOCKS! 

The pizza came luke warm, as usual. The salad was quite tasty. 

The redemption factor: the pizza tasted AMAZING the next day after it was heated up in the oven. 

I may go back, but it will take some convincing.
author: Lisa L.

description:
We're pizza snobs always in search of delicious pie and we were definitely impressed. Delicious thin crust pizzas that my picky toddler gobbled down in minutes, GREAT attentive service, and fun and laid-back atmosphere that makes this place a definite winner. 

Our picks for the night: 1/2 Vincent Van Dough (roma tomatoes, fresh garlic & basil) & 1/2 sweet sausage & mushroom, and a simple but tasty cheese pizza for our son.
author: Sarah L.

description:
I had faith in you, Za, and you came through!

I gave you a second chance and was impressed with the results. All the "issues" from my first experience were resolved:

1. I skipped the over-salty sausage and got mushrooms, tomatoes, feta and pepperoni. Excellent combo of ingredients. Tangy tomatoes and sauce, rich cheese, earthy mushrooms, briny feta and meaty, savory pepperoni. This will be my order from now on.

2. The medium with all those toppings came out to about $23 and fed 3 adults and 1 child. Plenty!

3. The order taker reminded me that I am outside of their delivery area, but we made a deal that I would come outside to conduct the transaction rather than making the delivery guy park and come in. I can live with that for a really good pizza.

4. The crust was perfect! No burnt spots, and all that cornmeal flavor that I love.

Best test was that my kid ate almost an entire huge slice without picking off the mushrooms like she usually does!
author: Valeria R.

description: Best family night out, drinking beers as the cable cars rattle by, eating delicious pizza of the day. We are in and out in 30 mins. Perfect for a quick and cheap meal with the little ones!!
author: Sarah C.

description: Best pizza I've ever had, hands down.  But, they're a bit on the pricey side.  I always order the potesto pizza whenever I'm in the neighborhood.  It's worth every penny, just with I could afford it more often!
author: Natalie L.

description: I had previously reviewed Za and had an issue with some of the staff being very rude on the phone and in person. In the last year or so of going there people have been way nicer. Who I imagine is the owner (bald guy with glasses) is incredibly nice and I imagine he has turned things around. I love their pizza and I live around the corner so I'm glad customer service has been improved.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Forgot to review Za! 

After day drinking in Dolores Park, all you need is pizza and beer to kick away the impending insta-hang over. Go to Za.
author: Vonetta Y.

description:
Was looking for a casual pizza place in the neighborhood and was pleased to have come across Za. 
Ordered-
I never thought I'd find myself ordering a vegetarian pizza (was raised to think any meatless meal belongs in the appetizer or desert category) but being with a friend who couldn't do sausage we went with:
Potesto- roasted red potatoes, chunks of roasted garlic and fresh pesto...must say I was both surprised and disappointed. Surprised by how quickly I scarfed down every last deliciously rich slice, and disappointed that for years I'd convinced myself I was the sole master of the potato pizza
Popeye the Greek- spinach and feta cheese, good stuff
Contrary to some other reviews I thought the service was good, the guy working there had a sense of humor that made you feel comfortable...but then again it seems to just be dudes that are baring the brunt so I wouldn't know :)
author: Mahsa K.

description: Delicious gourmet thin crust pizza, after a little bar hopping in marina area this place is heaven! the service was impeccable, the owner greeted us and had us draw a picture as well as a round of beers... great place to check out for some yummy pizza
author: Jonathan B.

description: I cannot believe this place has 4 stars. The sauce they use is way too sweet! Unable to stomach my order, this place was a complete waist of my time and money. There are far better places to eat on Hyde St. however they are far more expensive than ZA Pizza which is why I would recommend walking three blocks down to Polk St. There I would recommend Gioia Pizzeria or Victor's Pizza. Their pizza is much better! Plus Polk St. is filled with more food options and are reasonably priced.
author: James F.

description:
Not NY Pizza but GRRREAT!

Ok it's not  NY but either way the staff, the pizza, and the bar rock.  VERY small space that would probably get slammed at night or on the weekend but definitely worth it if you're going to be nice to the staff.

The one star reviews on here seem to be people who don't like how a bartender or employee at this location treat them.  Let's just think about it from their perspective... if you're an unpleasant person to be around or too pushy they probably don't want to deal with your attitude and may dismiss you completely.  Look it's a $3-5 slice and maybe a beer they're people too! Why should they be nice to rude/pushy people.  

Either way great salad, loved the Spicy Italian Scaliano pizza with fresh garlic and green onions (could have ate an entire pie of that alone).greaaat pizza - why be nice?


Date Rating: 3    (order in for a higher date rating if you've got candles)
Pick up Scale: 2


Strong Suggestions: Be patient, be nice, and smile.
author: Megan C.

description:
Za is alright, but it isn't that great. I had a slice of their meat special, which seemed to have ground beef and jalapeno slices. The sauce wasn't spectacular, and I've definitely had more flavorful meat. The crust was stiff and tasted of raw flour, which is a sign of shoddy baker's work in my view. For thin crust, it's not thin enough or flavorful enough; good thin crust should have tangy sauce and have flavorful toppings.

The wait staff was friendly enough. I noticed the owner waive the checks of two foreign girls who only had fountain drinks. Kind of made me a little jealous.

I think for a place that calls itself "gourmet", Za has a ways to go. Yes it's good for the price, and I may well go back for more since it's convenient to my location. But memorable? Nah, not really. In a city of food experiences, Za will be a faded memory before long.
author: Chris S.

description:
After many hours on the 22nd floor, tucked away in huddle room D (yes that is its real name), a girl needs to unwind with a big slice of pepperoni pizza and an icy cold root beer. Hoping to find this at Za, I kicked off my heels tonight in exchange for a well-worn pair of flip flops and wandered over. Two of us ordered a large Caesar salad and a medium pizza. It was more than enough food and all of it was super delicious. Hooray for great pizza just .06 miles from my homeshed!

Seems Za also does a brisk delivery service so if you're in the 'hood and can't be asked to get off your duff, try ringing them up. You will not be disappointed.
author: Miriam W.

description: Such great pizza and hats off to the caesar salad. Wow. Great service. When we are in the city and want pizza this is where we go. If your ever in the ZA area besure to treat yourself to some great pizza and a cold beer.
author: Melissa F.

description:
Za is life! I live up the street from it, and I can't say that my diet is in tact....because Za is on my way home from the gym!

Perfectly crafted thin slice pizzas, with the right amount of flavorful sauce, tasty cheese, and fresh vegetables. None of the oily/greasy feel with these pizzas.  

A slice of cheese is $3.60, and with other toppings, it's around $4.60. One slice fills me up, so that's (IMO) a cheap and fantastic meal!

Only four stars because the service is slightly uppity; you'll get a bit of attitude from the people behind the counter and a long(ish) wait time for your pizza to heat up, but  I can't say that I mind it when I know what's on the other side of the oven!

--

EDIT: I've been meaning to edit this for a while, and am only about 2 years late. Look, I live down the street from Za and am tempted to get their delicious pizza at least once a week -- but who wants to be disrespected / talked down to by service? 

At some point, you have to accept it as part of the alternative style of the place, and you have to get used to not being acknowledged until you wave someone down at the counter

During my last visit, a poor out-of-town-looking man was waiting behidn the counter for nearly 10 minutes before I decided someone needs to tell him that no one will service him until he becomes more aggressive and speaks up / waves at someone. 

Essentially: the pizza is good but the service is not. Enjoy at the cost of your self respect.
author: Meghana D.

description: This is really a pretty good pizza spot with a nice vibe and a creative menu of pies. Particularly into the potato pesto one everyone loves and its free delivery too! I was really stoked to try their homemade pesto base with a to go order we went in for just today but they forgot the pesto. It was still a decent thincrust pepperoni deal but yeah I'd have given another star if they had gotten the order right.
author: Joycelyn L.

description:
Other than me, everyone seems to like this place a lot.  It really is just OK in my book.

Let's start with what I like:
- It's only a couple blocks from my place
- Thin crust and big slices
- lots of vegetable options
- Seems like a lively place to eat (I've only ordered take-out)

What I dislike:
- Not enough cheese and grease.  I know that sounds awful ... but when I want pizza, I want that CHEESY GREASY thin crust pizza from Enzo's in Westwood!  
- I've had a couple of their specialty pizzas and it seems they're missing some flavor
- It's a pricey pizza pie
- I'm really not that picky about service, but I wish the guys behind the counter would smile a little! 

I'll order from here every now and then ... hopefully one day I'll finally figure out what makes this place worthy of 5 stars.
author: Dina H.

description:
Za serves California-style pizza (thinnish crust with creative toppings).  They do a decent job at it, but the pie doesn't have a distinctive flavor to it that they can call their own.  We tried the vegetarian, the scalliano, and the chicken/pesto/sun-dried tomato combination, with only the last one scoring major flavor points.  Nice selection of beers on tap. 

On the service side, we couldn't have asked for more.  Our server was super accommodating and helpful, and went above and beyond the call of duty when there was a minor screwup with our order.  Hats off to him.

3 stars?  It may sound worse than I mean it.  I was expecting a lot out of Za's given their reputation, but it turned out to be a small neighborhood pizzeria undistinguished from so many others.  Other folks seem to love the place, so they're doing something right, and they should keep on doing what they're doing.  For me, tho?  Next time I'm looking for super stellar pizza, I'll probably look elsewhere.
author: Laurence W.

description:
Pizza delivery guy sucks ass and rude!! He ruined the review so it could of been better...we had no napkins and no pepper packets, WTF! Also, pizza is not worth the price, could be $6-$8 cheaper! Rate them at $$ pricing!! 
**I RECOMMEND TO GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!**
author: Victor D.

description:
After almost 5 years of ordering delivery to my place from Za, suddenly I am apparently no longer in their delivery area. Or so says the rude guy on the phone.

Later Za.
author: Greg G.

description:
Being from NY/NJ area with possibly THE BEST thin crust pizza in America, I can say Za lives up to those standards! I crave their pizza- the perfect amount of sauce & cheese plus their innovative topping combos! 

It's pretty small, maybe 4 or so tables, seating at the bar.  They do have 1 high chair for little ones. I always get the feeling that all the guys who work there are college buddies, its awesome! 

Best place in Russian Hill for pizza & a beer 

Cheers!
author: Barbara B.

description: Perhaps the best pizza slices in the world are served here. For about 5 dollars you can get a huge slice that will take your taste buds on a journey. Highly recommend. The dining room is small so thats the only downside if you come at a busy time.
author: Michael T.

description: I live 2 blocks away and come here often for a delicious slice.   I was entertaining guests last week and decided to get two pies delivered rather than picking up like I always do.  The pizza came cold and the delivery guy refused to walk up the stairs to my apartment.  He kept calling me on my phone after I buzzed him in until I came downstairs.  I've ordered delivery from restaurants all over the city and this is the very first time I've had to walk downstairs to get it.  I live 2 blocks away so delivery could not have been very difficult for them.   This was very very disappointing.
author: Nic B.

description:
Fantastic Pizza. ZA PIZZA! 

The workers here are always cool and their prices and items are fairly good. Their pizza tends to consist of thin crust with delicious melted cheese followed by your favorite topping. They cook it to perfection and if eaten fresh out the oven, the cheese will fall right off yet still be delicious. I usually order for pick up or delivery and under both circumstances they are very fast and effective.

Their very large pizza is to die for. I personally am an all time pepperoni pizza fanatic and i feel that it would be so wrong to never eat at least a slice of pepperoni from any pizza spot. Therefore, here i usually order a large pepperoni or a large half pepperoni, half broccoli pizza. Trust me, this is a good combination and the broccoli half is very delicious as well. On average, the bill totals $20-22, well within my budget for a large pizza and in the end the stomach is content, my appetite is satisfied and leaves me with the feeling that Za has done it again.
author: Jesus A.

description: It's unfortunate that they have great pizza because their service is absolutely terrible. The guy who takes orders via phone for delivery is always a huge jerk and not at all helpful if you need to ask a question. On this particular night, we placed an order for delivery at 6:50. They said it would be 45 min-1hr. At 8pm we started trying to call them to find out the status of our pizza and all we got was either endless ringing or a busy signal.  I'm guessing they just stopped answering the phone because we tried to get through with no luck for 30 minutes.  We finally gave up and got Chinese.  FINALLY at 9:15pm they tried to deliver the pizza, are you kidding?!  It doesn't matter how good a product it, with service like that it's not worth it.
author: M C.

description: I wandered into Za's after spending an afternoon around Fisherman's Wharf. I was looking for pizza by the slice and Za's was perfect! It was abnormally hot in SF last week and they have one single table situated outside the restaurant on the hill.  The owner was very friendly and chatted with us for a bit while trying to help us balance our plates and drinks on the slanting table.  The slices are huge - i'd estimate it to be a cut the size of a quarter of one of their pizzas. Yes, it's thin crust but i love thin crust pizza! It reminds me very much of The Pizza Place on Noriega. It has the same flavor and texture.
author: Samantha L.

description: Intentionally rude wait staff kinda nukes the quality of the food. Still can't believe another staffer didn't tell our waiter to take a break from lecturing us. Do I ever go back knowing that if I see this clown again I will just turn and leave?
author: K W.

description: This is just really good pizza. Take advantage of the free delivery. The eat-in atmosphere wasn't the best, but I didn't even care because the pizza was that good.
author: Nathan H.

description:
If I feel like the traditional flimsy-pizza-that-you-need-to-hands-for style that's got good grease with a somewhat chewy crust, this is your place.  

Living in Russian Hill has its perks like getting delivery from Za Pizza.  I have become a favorite of just plain pepperoni pizza with roasted garlic (they do give you quite a bit of garlic so maybe don't do it on the first couple dates, or better yet wait till you're married).  

On the upside, it hits the spot when I want good delivery style pizza- but on the down side, their crust didn't have the crunch to it that I liked and they also didn't have ranch.  Yes, I'm one of those that loves to dip the pepperoni pizza into ranch dressing. I know it's dipping fat into fat, but I can't help it.  It makes my stomach smile.
author: Hannah W.

description:
I hate giving this two stars because I only went inside because the aroma wafting onto the sidewalk was irresistible. I was letdown.

First of all I got two plain slices and it came to $8. Steep. I was hoping that maybe the 'gourmet' in the restaurant title would make up for it but alas when the pizza came it was nothing special at all. 

The bread was very mealy, having absolutely no spine and made for a flimsy slice, especially given that it was somewhat lukewarm. The cheese was also uninspiring. For the same quality I could get supermarket pizza from safeway or whole foods for less money.

The atmosphere is also lacking. Too many hand drawings by little children, while sports blast on a TV competing with frankly too many cooks yammering away behind the counter.
author: Ash S.

description:
We just visited after work and school. It is as good as people rated here.
Ordered medium half moma and da vinci. The draft beer is great too.
The pizza is thin crust. The medium size comes out 'wow. huge' I told myself when waiter put on table. Since this is thin pizza, I think it is equal to the normal medium size?

We love Da Vinci most, where it has sausage. Yes, we are the meat lovers. Yummy. The deco of restaurant has good 'flavor', I like the pictures on the wall ... 
After finished (tried hard though) the whole pizza, we walked home. likely 10 blocks? :)
author: Gloria W.

description:
If you like pizza, try Za.  I've never ordered off the standard menu and always create my own.  The portions are good, the crust is good (but not particularly exceptional), and the toppings are delicious.  For the price, I'm always satisfied.

I've eaten in and taken out.  Both are good experiences.  The inside is tiny, so don't count on finding a seat unless you're going during an off-hour...though I'm not sure when that is since pizza is the kind of food you might crave at any time of day or night.

One note: they definitely use a lot of salt so drink water or you're going to wake up in the middle of the night dehydrated.  That said, I wholeheartedly recommend this place.
author: Jon B.

description:
So maybe this is a little skewed coming from more of a thick crust lover (hence little star and zachary's get my 5-stars), but as far as the thin style goes I think Za's does a nice job. I've only gotten delivery from there and as far as pizza delivery goes it's probably the best possible option.

The Moma (sans onions) and the Salvador Dali are my favs.
author: Nikki M.

description:
I have no idea about the pizza. This is b/c they don't deliver to a mile-ish away. I live at Sutter and Jones and they won't deliver. 

don't advertise free delivery if you aren't going to deliver. 

I'm sure the pizza is fab.
author: kristen s.

description:
I used to live by Za's on Hyde. Really enjoyed being able to walk down  and enjoy a slice of anything they had available heated up and sprinkled generously with crushed red pepper flakes. The crust is always thin and done right. Love all their specialties but my favorite's got to be the Potesto.

Phone orders and delivery  is always a breeze... for me at least.
author: Coco M.

description:
Finally, a place that serves thin-crust pizza! It could be thinner, but the dough was really delicious and definitely not as filling as that thick-crust crap.

Between 2 of my girlfriends and myself, we shared a medium pizza and small salad -- and we left stuffed. We couldn't decide between the Scaliano and Da Vinci's Palette, so the server suggested we get half and half. When the pizza came out, both sides were very similar, but it stil tasted good. The Caesar salad was really standard.

My only complaint -- they don't serve pitchers of beer!

Our total bill ended up being $40 something, which included the pizza, small salad, and 3 beers. Not as expensive as some people have said in the reviews.
author: Patricia Y.

description:
Anyone who gives Za less than a perfect score is obviously deranged or posturing because Za does everything that a pizza place should. To name a few:

-HUGE slices
-Personable staff
-Perfect carbonation for soft drinks
-Embodiment of San Francisco atmosphere
-Quick service (except when it's super busy, Thursday-Saturday nights, but pick up is almost always 20 minutes)
-Fresh, local ingredients that vary from day to day
-Frequent discounts (they come both on the box and are given liberally for loyalty)
-Delicious salads that are also very big

One of the best part's of going in to eat is that there is no one type of clientele, you will see everyone at Za. 

I might be a little biased because I've had the great good fortune to eat at Za my whole life, but this is how pizza is meant to be.
author: Rita C.

description:
Really good pizza, unfortunately our service was horrible. 
We called ahead to place an order for pick up but our walk from the hotel was longer than we thought so we decided to eat there. We asked if it was okay and they said yes but our server (the bar tender) was horrible to us. Never once asked if we wanted something to drink, offered us condiments, or if we were enjoying our meal. My boyfriend had to ask for the check and for a box and our server replied with "sure". 
The worst service I've ever had in my life. Will not be going back. They do not deserve our service or money again.
author: Janell G.

description:
With the BCS Bowl game and the Warrior's are playing in two separate sporting events in one night, it's not fair for Matt and the kids to be at home enjoying and watching these sporting events, while wife had a  company meeting, therefore getting off work later than usual.

However, she did manage to go grab some pizza at a place not only close to our house, but also one of Matt's bookmarked locations.

She bought an order of large plain Cheese Pizza to take home. The $15.00 pizza had 12 thin-sliced pieces. For a family that infrequently eats pizza, we enjoyed our Italian pie very much and tasted even better with Warrior's game and beating the San Antonio Spurs. 

A tasty Pizza + BCS Bowl game + Warrior's game and hard-fought victory =

"A Wonderful Night!"
author: Matt G.

description: Guys have great food and gave great advice to us tourist.   Obviously a locals location, and worth while for any and all
author: Robert M.

description: Kids and wife enjoyed the pizza, I enjoyed the salad, and we all enjoyed a really casual place with good food while on a weekend trip to SF. Loved the staff, the music (pretty sure it was the jam band station on XM/Sirius), Gold Cup soccer on the TV, and the overall vibe - made me wish I came here more often. Definitely recommend.
author: Mike A.

description: This is the holy grail of pizza in San Francisco. I'm a certified pizza enthusiast, from the birthplace of amazing pizza...NYC and everything from the personable and charismatic owner (who happened to deliver my first pie from there) to the outstanding ingredients and impeccable final product gets my seal of approval. I ordered 2x in one week and think about it daily since then..........
author: Kevin G.

description: Best pizza in town! A local favorite and loved by everyone in the neighborhood and beyond. Keep up the great work!!
author: Rachel M.

description:
I called in on a Thursday night for the first time to order a pizza to pick up because I didn't have cash for them to deliver it. 

The thin styled pizza came with generous helpings of toppings. We got mushroom and sausage and it definitely fulfilled our "good pizza around the place" goal. It was exactly $20 for a medium pizza with 2 toppings and it was perfect for 2 ppl. 

Next time, I will make sure I have cash so i can take advantage of the free delivery.
author: Jeff C.

description: Just called for delivory and got an extremely rude response.  We were staying at a well known major hotel a half mile away from the restaraunt. I told the guy the name of our hotel and he asked for the address which I didn't have on hand. He rudely refused to take my order without an exact address. According to the reviews they may have good pizza but because of our terrible customer service experience we will never try to order from here again.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Very good spot for a slice of pizza in Russian Hill.  It's an east coast style pizza...thin and crispy.  There's usually two combo options available for slices.  I tried the Bluto and Moma today.  Both were very tasty.  The guys behind the counter are also friendly.
author: Alvin J.

description:
I live a block and a half away from Za and have been coming here for almost 3 years. They definitely have some very good pizza and their salads aren't bad either. 

That being said, their customer service is terrible if you are a male. Multiple times I've found myself just staring at the guys behind the counter for 2-5 minutes waiting to place my order while they hang out and talk to people at the bar. It's not like I'm debating what to order...they only have 4 choices of slices for to-go orders. There are a few times when I've been in a hurry and had to leave because I was waiting too long. 

What happens when I take a girl there? They wait on us right away. Look, I know that if you are surrounded by dudes all day in a pizza place you are probably more likely to want to talk to a girl more quickly than a guy, but it's BS to make people wait just to talk to your friends at the bar. 

I've started to go down the hill to New York Pizza on Polk. There they have a dedicated person on the cash register who only takes orders. I get waited on right away. Why can't Za do this? Aren't both places under the same ownership? 

I would definitely come here more often if the service was better. But I have trouble giving my money to people who couldn't care less about my business.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Love the family friendly, mom and pop atmosphere and the pizza is amazing to boot! Weeknights you may have a little wait for a table, but grab a beer and make yourself comfortable. I love the sweet sicilian sausage added to just about anything. The thin crust is unbeatable here. 

Its great you can get a large pizza and its huge(!!), or just grab a slice which is posted on the board everyday. 

This is my go to in Russian Hill. I heart Za!
author: Natalie N.

description:
Sooo good.  Everytime I visit my parents I demand we order from here.  Scaliano, Salivdor Dali and Potesto are to die for.

Dammit.  I'm probably going to go "visit" my parents tonight.
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
You cant really go wrong with pizza...  ;-) 

Next I'm going to have to try one of their specials.... the potato pesto looked amazing!
author: Jodie B.

description:
So delicious!

After having a few glasses of Sangria, a friend and I decided it was a great time to stop in to Za's, a place that I have been dying to try for quite some time. Sitting up at the counter, my friend and I ordered a Sierra Nevada and a 'slice' of the Vegetarian. The term 'slice' doesn't even begin to describe how large this piece of pizza is... it mights as well be a small pizza it's so big! And SO delicious! My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our time sitting at the bar for few hours as we shared stories, spoke briefly with some of the employees and enjoyed our beer and wine.

This place gets super busy around dinner time with people looking for a quick delicious dinner option.
author: Emily S.

description: All the guys there make you feel right at home when you walk in every time.  It's my "Cheers" bar since I live down the block.  SUPER friendly crew whether you're alone parked at the bar w/ beer & pizza in hand or with family & friends.  They're extra kid-friendly, my kind of neighborhood joint not to mention the BEST thin crust corn meal pizza in town and anywhere in that matter...ok Delfina is pretty good too but sadly not in my hood like Za.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I had a large Scalitiano and it was pretty much standard pizza. I guess their thing is the pizzas are huge but big doesn't mean all good. I judge pizza mostly on the flavor of it's crust and believe me when I say there's nothing special about it. It's got nothing on Tommasso's or Amichi's. I also had a cesar salad there it pales in comparison to Amichi's.
author: Greg T.

description: Had a party of 8 out-of-towners who agree: Great food (both salad & pizza), great service and a wonderful, friendly owner! Very pleased with our visit. Check it out, you will not regret it!
author: Danyale C.

description:
Best cheap pizza in the city. 

I used to go to escape from new York for the quick sudden pizza urged until I tried ZA. It's like escape from new York.. Only better.. Escape is awesome, ZA is awesome'r. 
I'm a meat person however at ZA, their spinach n feta cheese pizza is to die for and the thin crust is amazing.

The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars, is the very limited delivery radius :-/ I've been turned down for delivery several times which is a bummer cos when I want pizza at home it usually means not having to make an effort to get it.
author: Adam O.

description: Called four times and their phone did not work. When I need pizza delivery it is, by definition, a food emergency. C'mon fellas. 90 percent of the game is blocking and tackling.
author: M G.

description: Saw 3 roaches in the corner and the wait staff was extremely rude. Would never come back here!
author: John S.

description:
My wife and I have been coming here for five years. She introduced Za to me shortly after we started dating and I fell in love. Sure, the waitstaff had attitude. I didn't care. I'm from the East Coast and that comes part and parcel with all the best eats. I put up with it. When they did commiserate, the waitstaff was cool. The pizza was yummy but far from sublime. I didn't care. The ambiance, the za, and the company made it worth it. The not so subtle, but amusing jibing of Steve and Jose made it even more charming.

That was then. This is now. I have had exactly five burned pizza slices served to me in the last ten times at Za. Now the distant waitstaff is not charming, but degrading as I sit there and gnaw on slices that take five solid strokes to cut with a knife using all my force. I'm 6' 1", 220 lbs and most nights lately Za's pizza bests my honest attempts at dissecting and digesting. Add to that the fact I noticed they pull the slices from some slab of overcooked pie they keep hidden under the counter, and I am ready to move on. Goat Hill and Little Star are WAAAAY better.

I don't think it's a random happenstance that the pizza went down hill when the owner bought Escape from New York on Polk, for all these changes came to fruition when he merged what was once tasty Za with "I only eat it when I'm drunk Escape from New York."

I hope Za comes back into its own. If you'd caught me two years ago, I woulda given this place 4-stars. But being as times have changed, and Steve and Jose (and quality) have moved on, the most I can justify is 2-stars. Meeeh.
author: Christopher M.

description: This is a review for delivery, I'm betting that in the restaurant the pizza is probably better.  We ordered a couple different pizzas recently, the Moma pizza with artichokes and the Da Vinci's Palette with sausage and onions.  The sausage one was more exciting but I felt both were delivered a little limp.  They were better when we threw them in the oven and were able to make them a little more crisp.  I would try this place again, but next time only making an appearance in house, instead of my house.
author: Janelle C.

description:
Rating relates to service, not pizza.

Unlike advertised, this place will only deliver in Russian Hill, and maybe Marina if you ask nicely.  Pls update your web site (1min of work), it saves us the hassle of choosing a pizza and you taking the order.
author: Philip I.

description: It's just really solid pizza. My favorite in the city.
author: Dave G.

description: If this isn't a great pizza, then Alice and Wonderland wasn't written on heroin.
author: Jaime L.

description: Cool spot. We got two pizzas. One, potato, was eh. The second was delicious. Nice service.
author: Noah L.

description: Not only was I placed on hold for 4 minutes when trying to order a pizza, the guy who finally came back to my call was extremely rude. I felt as if I had made some grievous error even thinking about calling them. If i'm going to order pizza from a mid-high priced pizza joint (especially one in my own neighborhood) I expect to be treated with respect. I will not be ordering from Za again anytime soon. Za Za for now!
author: Hamish F.

description:
OVERALL:2.3   FOOD: 2   SERVICE:3   AMBIANCE: N/A   VALUE:2
Suckered in by the free delivery option & measly online coupons, which are ultimately canceled out by the inflated base prices.  We're talking standard, greasy, NY pizza...nothing special 'bout it to justify the price premium.  Considering  North Beach is dotted w/legit pie joints, definitely NOT the best choice--my bad.  Phone & delivery guys were pretty bare bones and borderline gruff, but adequate.

Uninspired by the menu combos, so went with the DIY version.
BROCCOLI + SPICY SAUSAGE + BASIL ($29.21 + tip, Large):
Meh.  Super greasy, but somehow the crust was bone-dry, and quickly cooled down to the consistency of well-cured concrete...C+ at best.  Not a big fan of the crumbled/shredded sausage either...close resemblance to Bacon Bits **grumble*grumble**.  Flavor=good, Texture=bad.

Thanks, but no thanks.  Hook me up w/some Tony's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/tonys-pizza-napoletana-san-francisco#hrid:-xeFoFHHdh_0EY6U-ZYGDg)!
author: Amy K.

description: SPECIFIC TO DELIVERY SERVICE....Hold 1 min, hold 2 min, hold 8 min..... ok now you can order a pizza .... not just once, but twice this has happened.... Yes the pizza is good, but the customer service is ridiculous. Order from Paxti's, Escape from NY, Tony's, Pizza Orgasmica etc. as they at least do not put you on hold for 16 minutes and they deliver in less than an hour, not 1:30 +......
author: John R.

description: WOW I HAVENT SEEN PEOPLE TREATED THIS BAD SINCE SLAVERY. I went there today I felt completely uncomfortable thanks to the curly headed blonde guy. yeah making dough in the back is real cool bro. Anyway today I went in and asked for a beer and the curly headed blonde guy said " are you even old  enough to drink" obviously smarty pants. After being disappointed that I was of age he threw my I.d down.
author: yoo s.

description:
When I'm walking down this street (once in a while), I usually like to stop by here and then Swenson's. Perfect pair.

Delicious, large slices of pizza. I feel like the service would be better if you were a regular.

If you're driving here, good luck. Parking is rare.
author: Jeanette P.

description:
Imagine if we could create a magical pizza slide ruler. On the skinny, left end of the ruler, we'd find cripsy, wafer thin pies such as Pizzeria Delfina and Pizzetta 211. On the chunky, right-most, deep end squats the plump, stuffed Zachary's. Za comfortly slides in two notches from the left.

While called thin crust, there's enough crisped dough for a delectable chew. Which is nice because sometimes the micro-thin crust pies get burned and are more like topped crackers than pizza. The corn meal crust adds crunch and keeps the delicate interior firm but toothy. The toppings are top notch and balanced nicely with the amount of tangy sauce and cheese.

Service is friendly, the price is nice, and it's in the hood. 

4.5 * stars
author: Brady K.

description:
As far as deivery goes, Za delivers (pun intended). I've been calling Za whenever I need a pizza delivered for about two years now and their service is always friendly and pretty prompt. I'm a big fan of how they store my phone number so I don't have to repeat my address every time I call.

My personal favorite is the Scalino but they'll make you pretty much whatever you want. Thanks for coming to rescue when my stomach starts growling Za.
author: Bryan B.

description:
I really shouldn't live this close to Za...

Growing up in NJ and thisclose to NYC, it's pretty hard for me not to be a bit of a pizza snob. I like my crust thin, yet substantial and toppings should be simple. Za fulfills most of those requirements.

Stumbled across this little gem over Memorial Day weekend and it's now my go-to pizza spot. This is probably closest I've had to NY/NJ style pizza in AGES and I love it. 

I've sampled a few of their pies (I believe they have 2 daily specials on top of the regular menu) and my favorite was the Pluto (spinach, sausage, feta, mozzarella). My only complaint is that some of the pies end up getting super soggy in the middle...perhaps too many watery toppings? 

You may have to wait a bit for a table if you go during the dinner rush, but it's definitely worth it. Oh, and they do pizza by the slice. Another thumbs up in my book.
author: Karena Q.

description:
I hosted a couple of "out of towners" this past weekend and after days worth of full decadent meals, we were ready for a change of pace and opted for a simple fast dinner: thin-crust pizza and salad.

The large ceasar salad was more than enough for 3 people, it would be perfect for a size of 4.  This salad was perfect with just enough dressing and was very fresh.

We ordered a large pizza half Salvador Dali and half Moma (?), the vegetarian with artichoke hearts. My personal favorite was the Moma because you can taste the fresh ingrediants while I thought the pesto was a little overpowering on the Salvador.   The large was more than enough to last for the next few days.  

Service was good. Our waiter was a little anxious with us at first but that was probably a good thing as we were a bit indecisive on our order.

We were all overly happy with our pizza & salad meal.  I will definiely be back.
author: Jackie D.

description:
I was honestly expecting a bit more, considering all of the hype and the price. It cost me over thirty bucks after tip and tax and everything for a pizza that my fiance and I ate in one sitting. We're not huge people and we don't have big appetites.

Now, it was pretty delicious. And you can tell they use good ingredients. The guy who took my order was very polite and helpful. I just couldn't help but feel that I could have gotten more out of Escape from NY, or for the same price, I could have gone to Pizza O, which is far better in my opinion.

Not a bad place, and if I was walking by, it would be a more attractive option because of the price factor - but it wasn't "amazing" or anything like that.
author: Nick B.

description:
Came to Za for a Valentine's dinner with my parents, yeah pretty romantic huh?

I am a huge fan of thin crust pizza and Za did not disappoint. The crust wasn't as doughy as i would have liked, but I still enjoyed the pizza very much. The crust wasn't overcooked and the pizza did not taste like cardboard (always a good thing!).

We ordered a medium half Vincent van Dough (tomatoes, bazil & garlic) and half Popeye the Greek (Spinach & Feta), but were delicious. They also sell slices!

Great little neighborhood spot, I will definitely be back! (they also have been on tap)
author: Elaine S.

description:
Delivery was quick, and my pie and salad were both tasty.  I really liked that their "caesar" dressing wasn't the standard creamy caesar, but a tasty oil based vinaigrette.  I had the Salvador Dali pie, and while not usually a fan of chicken on pizza, the red sauce, pesto, and sundried tomatoes made me a very happy camper.
The crust was pretty decent for a thin crust pie.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Great vibe with the tone set by the friendly, welcoming, guys behind the counter.  They seem to know and greet everyone who walks through the door.  Nice neighborhood spot that stays open late and makes a very good pie.  Another thing I love about Russian Hill, Za.
author: Jim H.

description: NY style pizza in SF with a super friendly owner.  We catered a team event for work and Brooks delivered the pizza to the office on time.  A crazy driver on the road resulted in one of the pizza's getting a little mashed up and Brooks comped the meal since they weren't in perfect condition.  We ordered a meat lovers, a tomato basil and even a cheese-less veggie pizza for our house vegan.  We also had 2 salads.  Everything was delicious and the service was great.  We will definitely be using them for catering next time we opt for pizza.
author: Ashley T.

description: It would be five stars all the way if they had a better seating arrangement. It's three awkwardly large round tables and a few spots at the snack bar. But, I do like how casual it is (and I actually really like being in a place that I feel the employees enjoy eating and drinking at). The food is great, staff has always been extremely accommodating, and its unpretentiousness is a breath of fresh air.
author: Ryan M.

description: These guys know what's up. Best service every time. Pizza is great as well.
author: Matthew B.

description: Za Pizza was a great find. Super casual and low key and just enough draft beers to wash down a couple of good slices. Loving spicy foods we ordered the Scaliano and then topped it with Sriracha! Never tried hot sauce on top but would definitely recommend it.
author: Sunny I.

description:
I decided to go explore parts of San Francisco on one of my first weekends here. I decided to do a walking tour - Start at the Embarcadero, walk down Market to the Civic Center, then walk up Hyde all the up to Russian Hill and Lombard Street.

Needless to say, once I started walking up those hills, I started to get weak. I needed some fuel to keep on going. I saw some cafes around, but I really didn't want any of that stuff. I just wanted some greasy food and a drink. Not much to ask, right? That's when I ran into Za.
