5 stars for the best pizza I've ever had. Whoever thought up the cornmeal crust idea is brilliant. 

For living exactly 2 blocks away from here, I'm surprised I don't eat here every night. The Scaliano and their chicken caesar salad is the perfect meal. 

2 1/2 stars for the actual "restaurant" since there are only 3 or so tables and a few bar seats, it's always super crowded on weekend nights and it's extremely hot since the kitchen is part of the dining area. Definitely more of a take-out place. But I did eat here once and the server was superfriendly, the pizza came out pretty quick, and he even gave us a beer for free (perhaps unintentionally).
author: Natalie H.

description: Great pizza for delivery or at their location.  I have tried all the pizza's and the potesto is my favorite.  And don't forget to get the Cesar salad... they make their own dressing.
author: Neil M.

description:
Ceasar salad...romaine lettuce chopped in small pieces, tossed with romano cheese, non-creamy dressing and crutons with some chopped up dried herbs.  I dont' know what it is, but it looks more complex then other ceasar salads and tastes more complex.  Whatever it is, its a delicious salad.  A large salad ($7.50) easily feeds two for an appetizer.  In fact, since I like salads, I ordered two large salads for three people and the waiter thought I was crazy.  

Pizza
size:big slices
crust: cornmeal and thin
sauce: not tangy, maybe a little too sweet sauce; pesto is fresh, must be home made; tastes grrrrreat
toppings: fresh and perfectly scattered
author: Wakako U.

description: Always order the pizza by the slice, then you can try a couple different varieties.   The place is affordable and pie's are some of the best, the beer is cold, and staff are friendly.   Seating is very limited however.  About 5 tables & half a dozen bar stools.  Parking around there is another issue.
author: Alex S.

description:
A pretty good slice of pizza for SF.  It is no Zacherys but I enjoyed it and like it alot for a thin crust pizza.  I woul have given it 3.5 or 4 stars if the delivery driver was not such a stiff.  He did not say a word and I gave him a 2 dollar tip which I feel is ample for delivering a pizza.  Maybe I am wrong on that but either way I hate when someone does not say a word or say thank you.  I just think it is rude.  Solid pizza though.  I may have to go and try it again at the restaurant.  
 (Two weeks Later) Found out that I shoudl be tipping more now on deliveries.  I guess you shoudl give 15 percent.  Anyways he still was rude but will have to come and try this out at the restauarant at some point since it was good pizza.
author: Harry E.

description:
This seems to be the staple place in the area when my friends and I want pizza. To be honest about it, it's pretty good. The sauce has a sweetness to it that seems to be perfect. The crust is really really good as well. I'm also a fan of the pesto dressing on their salad. The price is what turns me off about eating there. I just think that for the price I should be eating something better.

I think this one is going to need to grow on me.
author: Diana R.

description: Had the pepperoni and it wasnt very impressive especially for food in the city. I suggest you try out Tonys down the street. =)
author: Genaro R.

description: Even if you are the type of person to always order meat-lovers anywhere else, don't deprive yourself of some veggies at Za. The tomatoes are fresh and amazing, and unlike anything else I've ever had on a pizza (and I don't even like tomatoes). I usually go for the Vincent Van Dough.
author: Mike O.

description:
Just what my roommates and I needed on a Sunday evening for our Golden Globes viewing party! We had a medium Salvador Dali between the three of us and it was divine. 

Minus one star because we had to call twice before someone picked up (and the guy initially thought they didn't deliver to us in North Beach) and we were not told delivery was cash only. Pizza was amazing though!!
author: Shannon C.

description: Today, I had the pleasure of eating the Scaliano and the Potesto. Both were excellent. I prefer a pizza where the crust is the conveyance and the toppings are the stars- I don't want three inches of dough topped by a millimeter of cheese. I like to fold my pizza. ; )
author: Johanna S.

description:
Here is the deal.

These guys run a tight ship. They are always friendly and very timely with your order. The pizza is damn good too.

Best part about it:
4 great beers on tap and a little bar to sit and enjoy your brew and a slice.

They deliver.

The pizza is not your typical New York style or Chicago- it is a very satisfying in between the two.

Seating outside.

Parking and Transportation:
Street parking on the cross streets are your best bet. Or, there is a parking garage right next door.

Bus 45 takes you here as well as the cable car.

Enjoy! You've just been yelped in.
author: Aaron A.

description:
VERY DISAPPOINTING! Surprisingly WAY Over-rated and poor value!

If you like cheese and toppings run away!

Medium good sauce (very light covering), below average crust, below average toppings (average density on a proportionally low amount of the surface area) and hardly any cheese and overall poor coverage make for a pretty disappointing pie. 

I am quite confused as to the "Gourmet" moniker. The only possibly definition I can support is one of very low portions of main ingredients; I was so blown away I actually measured it and the sauce ended a good 1 3/4" from the end of the slice and the cheese and ingredients ended a full 3" from the end (over 1/3 of the total radius and even more of total surface area was uncovered by toppings!). 

Also the "spicy sausage" was really ground salted pork with little spice (no fennel seed). 

$28 for an 18 1/2" pie with such minuscule coverage and mediocre taste is a huge rip-off IMO. I would have been oh so much happier with Golden Boy or even North Beach and probably even Dominoes.

This was for delivery but I have a hard time believing that the service, ambiance and immediate freshness buys it 4 times as many stars.
author: Mike L.

description:
5 stars because they made me a vegan pizza with the grated soy cheese I brought in. And man was it good!!! I no longer feel the need to drive to Oakland to try Pizza Plaza. 

Minus one star for hectic craziness in there on a Sunday evening. It brought my hangover back.
author: Cindy R.

description:
Someone should tell the staff that this isn't the Soup Nazi in New York, so stop giving me dirty looks when I walk in!  I just want to buy pizza, is that OK???  They give you a dirty look upon entering. And after you order and wait for your pizza, you almost have to apologize for standing in their view.  Just look down at the floor.  I once asked for some parmesan, and the guy handed me the glass bottle.  I asked for some to go, and he gave me another dirty look, made a big deal of trying to find a little plastic container for the cheese, then gave it to me reluctantly.  Man, do these guys have attitude or what? 

5 stars for pizza, minus 1 for cost and minus 1 for service.
author: Caroline I.

description: Worst piece of s*@#! pizza ever!  I'm from Chicago, have had some pretty good pizza, and trusted the online descriptions of this pizza.  Unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend this pizza to a starving, dying, homeless person.  The crust and cheese were barely cooked, the sausage was like something on a frozen pizza, and to be honest, the entire pizza tasted like it was cooked in a microwave.  Do people from San Francisco really eat this kind of s*@#!.  Yikes.  My girlfriend got sick from it and if I could give it zero stars, I would.  Avoid!!!
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Wow!  Yelp was correct!  The Salvador Dali pizza was delicious!  I love their crust and their sun dried tomatoes.  Small joint with great pizza and awesome atmosphere.  So far this is my favorite pizza in San Francisco.  They had our order ready and they have coupons with $2 off for Large pizzas.  I suggest you take a pic of the menu online if you don't have a coupon handy and the staff will accept it.
author: Camilo G.

description:
Sunday night.  Pouring down rain.  Just past 9 PM... and Za closes at 10 PM.  Not promising... right?

Wrong.

Piping hot pizza, half-and-half order on the money, no attitude.  And it's at my doorstep in 35 minutes from the moment I hang up.  

Not sure what some of you haters are talking about, because that's about as good as it gets when it comes to pizza delivery.

And yes... the pizza is great at the location too, especially if you're looking for a quick slice or two along with a cold one.  

All hail Za!
author: Chris C.

description:
Pizza is excellent.
If you call for delivery, the person on the phone is kind of rude, and the delivery is not so fast, but, oh well... it is worth it!
author: Elle H.

description: Ordered delivery and it was on time and the driver was really nice.  Now being a Chicago pizza snob,  I am a tough grader.  We had a Canadian bacon, jalepano and mushroom Za.  Overall, I say average but my wife liked it.
author: Bill L.

description:
This pizza tricked me a little bit.

On the first try I thought this pizza was the jam. The second time, it was ok. The third and fourth times, bad heartburn afterward. I'm not sure why, but I think I am allergic to their tomato sauce. It's really rich and sweet.

As far as SF pizza goes, this is a good place to order from, and it's worth a try or two. The cornmeal crust is good.

I am just really disenfranchised and disappointed in the SF pizzaria scene. 

Call it east coast pizza angst.
author: Andreas T.

description:
there's crack in that there honey mustard. i put it on my salad, i put it on my pizza. hell, might as well put it on tap and pour me a pint of that sh*t.

oh, and whoever started the Yahtzee trend here is a genius!
author: jaja w.

description: Most delicious cheese on a pizza I've had in a long time.  The tomatoes were juicy and the thin crust was perfect.  Brooks, the owner, was super nice and gave us a special price because it was our wedding anniversary.  It's a small place, but worth the wait.  Or just take it to go.  Would go again...and again.
author: Tena V.

description:
Za's is pretty BOMBTASTIC!  I prefer this pizza now over North Beach Pizza and Escape from NY.  The staff is friendly and the pizza never dissapoints.

Keep up the good work gentlemen!
author: Noneya B.

description:
Go Sit at the bar.
Grab a pint of Sierra summerfest and a slice of Potesto.
Wash down said slice with sweet nectar of gods that is summerfest.
Repeat.
Go home happy
author: Deep S.

description: One of my favorite spots in the neighborhood!!! Great people, beer and pizza. Plus, Swensen's is just up the block for dessert!
author: Cheyenne C.

description: Good delivery pizza.  the pizza came hot and in about 45 min, so standard time.  It was above average pizza.  I got large pepperoni pizza.  Used the $2 coupon on their menu and it came out to $25 even. The crust was pretty good, it wasn't a wow pizza but def good for delivery.  Its between this and Escape from New York if im looking for a thin crust pizza .  I would defiantly get this again.  If you are looking to try a new pizza place besides your regular, its worth a shot.
author: Mark M.

description:
Great place to drop by for a quick slice of pizza. The slices are huge and they always have 2 specials. Never been disappointed.

If it's nice outside it's great to sit and people-watch.
author: Alli J.

description:
Great pizza, friendly owner/employees, great salads... can't go wrong.  Definitely my go-to for neighborhood pizza.  

Love the house salad - plentiful serving, so perfect for sharing with someone.

My #1 pizza preference in my 'hood.
author: Alice H.

description:
Definitely my favorite pizza in the city. There's something charming about enjoying a slice of pepperoni while sitting at the slanted little tables outside- gotta love a hole-in-the-wall eatery on a hill!

And after you're done stuffing yourself with greasy goodness, head up the way to Swensen's for some awesome Cookies 'n' Cream ice cream.
author: lindsay w.

description:
3.75.  Solid pizza.  I think they take themselves a little too seriously though.  I just mean that it's good pizza, but it's not really the "gourmet" pizza I expected with a name like "Za Gourmet Pizza."  

The guy who took my order at the counter was very nice and friendly.

I like the neighborhood too.  If you want to spend time in the cute part of Russian Hill and have pizza, this is a great place to go.  Just beware - there's a big lack of parking in the 'hood.
author: Angie C.

description:
ok so the service wasn't the best... but at least the food was good. 
They have survived in this hood for that long, there's got to be something there... I lived in russian hill all my life and have seen some restaurants come and go, but Za's stayed. 

I love it because it's close to home and whenever I'm craving good pizza I can just walk down the block. I never ordered anything complicated so my orders are always right. I like that they have beers on tap, like a realy pizza joint. hmm... I forgot to ask if they had milk or root beer, because there are times when I crave for Milk and Pizza, anyone else??? 

3 solid stars.... again... when you're dinning out be nice and they will be nice to you. ***KILL THEM WITH YOUR KINDNESS****
author: Judi K.

description:
Super awesome!

The pizzas are great. My firm ordered some pizza for lunch. Not sure why, there wasn't even a meeting. Pizza in the kitchen!

The pizzas here aren't like Dominoes, or at least we didn't order the typical Mushroom Pizza or Pepperoni or Hawaiian.  One had goatcheese and other assorted different toppings.

Anyway I like pizza. I'm a guy. Guys like pizza.  The crust was fantastic!  There are two kinds of people: the kind that leave the crust and the kind that eat it.

The crust here will make anyone a believer in crusts!
author: Robert L.

description:
Ok I give this place 4 stars, but only because I knew about the "creepy" guys before I even walked into the place, otherwise I probably would have been totally creeped out and given it 3 stars like my friend Trisha down there (hello there).

Our friend told us that if we went in with all girls there would be a good chance of getting a free meal... didn't happen, but I blame it on the female waitress serving us. Anyway the pizza is awesome, I am a big fan of the thin crust and don't love heavy heavy tomato saucy pizza. 

The menu is good for all types of personalities. You can order one of Za's creations or create your own. The only weird thing I remember is that you cannot order anything smaller than a medium (i don't think) so no personal pizzas. They also did not have ranch, the guy did go out and get some for us, but the salad dressing ranch is just not the same as the pizza ranch (maybe im a little picky).

Anyway, overall... a good experience. If you're a girl, I would peek in to see if a girl server is there or not, if its all guys it sounds like you might have agood chance at getting a free meal or at least a free beer.
author: Jen S.

description:
If you like sandpaper for crust, then this is your place. The crust could easily be confused with gravel. Sauce = tasteless....

I'm TOTALLY confused as to why this place has as many stars as it does. I feel a little let down by my fellow yelpers. You're better off...WAY better off with Pizza Orgasmica....
author: Z L.

description:
I'm one of those annoying New Yorkers living in SF that bitch about how all Pizza and Bagels outside of New York are garbage.

While this is true, Za's pizza hits it out of the park. I'm not a fan of "gourmet pizza" - whatever that means, but Za's does use very fresh ingredients and always have consistently great tasting slices. I don't mind paying 4-5 bucks/slice because:

1) They are pretty huge
2) Almost perfect Sauce-cheese-crust ratio
3) Everything is made in-house (like the pesto sauce, etc)

No frills, great tasting food, great neighborhood. I'm actually heading out right after this to pick up a slice for lunch. mmmm
author: Peter K.

description:
Stopped by Za after a "drink away a long work day" session at Amelie last night.

The pizza was four star all the way, and many stars to the sweet girl behind the counter who gave me 5 slices for the price of 3 when her uber-douche, rude-ass co-worker refused to make me a small pizza to go because they were closing in 15 minutes. Except he didn't actually refuse me to my face. He ignored me, and told her loudly, while standing about a foot away from me, that he wouldn't make it.

Said uber-douche stole a star from this review. As far as I know, after years spent in the cooking/waiting/hostessing/bartending trenches, when a restaurant is OPEN it makes FOOD for people who come in. Also, for the record, I used to cook at a pizza joint and I know a small pizza takes 20 minutes tops. So I would have gotten my food to go five minutes after the place closed? Wah.
author: Angie R.

description:
Great place to get some pizza.  They have great salads to go with a good variety of creative pizzas.  They have always provided great service and are very friendly.  Here are some examples of great service from them:

First I was there with a group of four and we were enjoying some beers and pizza and we were there for an hour and did not even notice it was taking long.  When we got the check the waitress took off for a round of beers since she said we had to wait too long

Second, Once I got a pizza delivered and apparently it was a little too hot when it was either going up or down a hill and essentially I got a pizza where it was only on one half.  I called them up and it was no problem he offered to bring me another one, give me a future free pizza or credit my card.  I got my card credited and that is just good service
author: Dan G.

description:
Friendly staff, generous portion, delicious pizza, comfortable and casual ambiance.

Need to say more? Oh, forgot to say that you will be stuffed with a $4 pizza. Totally worth it!
author: Pauline H.

description:
I ate at Za Pizza few weeks ago and had an ok experience there.  People were friendly, service was good and the pizza was decent.  I wouldn't call it gourmet pizza though.

Their crust is thin and has a nice, bready texture to it.  Za's sauce leaves something to be desired.  It's thick and pasty and was overspiced.  

Their toppings and specialty pizzas are quite creative and stand out from the typical pizza joint.

The restaurant itself is quite small.  It consists of two or three tables and a small bar area.  I'm guessing a large part of their business consists of takeout.

If I lived near Za, I would definitely order take out from here on a regular basis.  If you're looking for gourmet pizza though, this is not the place for it.
author: Dheeraj I.

description:
It's all about the dough/crust as far as I'm concerned!  I always order mine 'extra crispy'.  I'm a big fan of the pepperoni, but broccoli on a pizza!  Fabulous!!!!  

The only gripe I have is that it tends to be cheaper 'by the slice' as opposed to buying a whole pie.

I used to live right around the corner, but now I have to make a special trip and hunt for parking in the neighborhood.  The lack of parking is what keeps the the clientele local.
author: Faraaz M.

description:
Bluto Pizza...that's all you need to know.

Za has the best sausage and sauce that I've tasted on a pizza.  The crust is delicious, both crispy and chewy, but not overwhelming.  Although I agree with one poster that they corn dust the crust a little too much.  The price is a little ridiculous, but I'd rather eat Za than North Beach, Pizza my Heart or any other place in SF.

I won't go as far to say that it is the best Pizza out there, but the Bluto is my favorite topping combination on any pizza I've ever had.
author: Ken P.

description:
A slice of Brooklyn & NYC in the Bay Area.

I have to say, it's about time. Most of the pizza joints I've been to in the city have been completely underwhelming, though there are certainly a few that shine. Za is one of 'em for sure.

My wife and I were walking down the street, headed to Swenson's for ice cream, when we happened to pass this place. Looking more like a bar (which it has) than a pizza joint, we ignored until we got a hint of what was inside. We stopped and decided to grab a late lunch.

Totally lived up to our (personal opinion) high standards of what a pie should taste like. Great crust, great flavor in the sauce and from the cheese. And a solid price, reflective of our local pizza joint in Park Slope Brooklyn, where we lived previous to moving to the Bay Area.

On the service tip, they were totally great. I definitely don't agree with those that have said the service sucked, although I will say we were there during an off time. Perhaps when it's crowded they can't handle it. But the guy who took our order and served us outside was really great. Perhaps the owner, but I'm not sure. 

I'll definitely venture back for another slice, and next time get it at the bar with a beer!
author: Charles A.

description:
From some of the reviews, I was expecting a NYC slice of pizza. (which I would consider Joe's to the the quintessential NYC slice.) When I hear a place serves up a NY style slice my accent slowly creeps back and I throw some trash out the window to ready myself for the experience.

This is not in any way shape or form NYC pizza. I really wish people would stop writing this, because you have no idea what you are doing to us New Yorkers. It's Friday night, we're tired, we hit yelp and give in to your frivolous words. It's like me saying that Safeway has the best Philly Style Cheese steaks, and for truly authentic Dim Sum you just have to hit the Panda Express. Now, that's harsh, because this Pizza is not bad at all, it's just not NYC style.

Cornmeal crust such as this can be found at Two Boots, which is indeed located in NYC,  but no one would consider that representational of Manhattan. It's more for the recently migrated post college girls to stumble into at 3 am after they have worked up a mighty appetite dancing on the top of bars.

That said, if you like Two Boots/Cornmeal/modern riffs on pizza this is a pretty good one. It just was not what I was expecting. But not necessarily bad at all. The pies are huge, and delivery is fast, and people seem nice.
author: Sir M.

description:
I'm torn about this place, as I'm sure many other people are.  

The good:  the pizza is the bomb-beazy, and I've never had a bad slice here.  Whether it's simple cheese or pep, or one of their interesting creations, it's all good.  

The bad:  overpriced pizza and arrogant service don't take too well with many restaurant go-ers.  Case in point: I enjoy my pizza with a side of ranch about half the time I eat it (either ranch or garlic sauce; an addiction of mine, but I can't enjoy pizza without a sauce whose portions I control added on top).  So one time at Za I ask the server if I can have a side of ranch, and he stops, scoffs loudly, and responds, "We don't serve ranch here" and walks away.  I don't care who you are, nobody deserves to be looked down upon because of their pizza eating preferences.  So never again will I pay an insane amount of money to wait an hour and a half for a pizza.  The Front Room is right down the street.
author: David G.

description: Three star pizza that can be delivered (within the predicted delivery window!) gets promoted to 4 stars. We got the da vinci palette, which has red and green peppers, onions, and spicy sausage. I was initially put off by the appearance of the sausage, which looked more like ground beef. But it was very tasty, and the peppers and onions were thinly sliced and well-cooked on the pizza. I liked the cornmeal crust, which was not cracker-thin but also not overly thick. I would prefer more sauce and probably a bit more cheese. Anyway, with all the recent rain, I appreciate decent delivery pizza.
author: Lisa K.

description: Best Thin Crust Pizza Ever!  --This place led me to realize that by using Yelp to find a place to eat, you never have to have a bad meal again.  This place was very good and on top of that the service was off the hook!  The server was smart enough to bring the cheese pizza slice out for the kids early so that it would cool off and he had even cut it up for them.  This was a great meal.  We'd drive 1hour to the city to eat here again.
author: Jacqueline Y.

description: Try the bluto with a caesar salad. This is by far the best pizza in San Francisco that I have had. It is respectable nationally based on my independent taste test. The sauce is zesty, the crust substantial, tasty, and perfectly textured. The toppings were generous and flavorful. If you have a anti-SF pizza bias, this place may kill it.
author: Andrew K.

description: After a car show in the city. My buddy mentioned this place and he explained it was really good. So we looked it up on my iphone found directions and found a parking garage nearby. when you walk in its a pretty small restaurant, theres a bar,couple tables and outside seating. I ordered the meat slice which was good and suprising really big! I was impressed how big they make their slices. My only complaint is the waiter forgot about my water and I had to ask him for it after I got my slice.
author: Brian B.

description:
Awesome NY style pizza. Fresh ingredients, thin crust, yummyyyyyyyyyyy
You may have to wait a few to get a table and parking, but well worth it.
author: Mercy G.

description:
So Lloyd and I were wandering around the Marina after DYK this past weekend.  We both missed lunch and needed some food.  We pulled up the highest rated pizza place within a half mile and Za Gourmet Pizza popped up.  Okay, lots of reviews, reasonable rating -- it's worth a shot.

The verdict?  Totally worth it.  Their slices are somewhat pricey ($4.50 for mine), but pretty big and reasonably filling.  It's a crispy thin-crust pizza, dusted with corn meal for texture.  The toppings are tasty and (thankfully) not drowning in cheese.  I'm sure I'll stop by again if I'm in the neighborhood.  The pesto pizzas look good...
author: Andrew C.

description:
I grew up on New Jersey/New York pizza, so I feel I can rightfully judge good vs. bad pizza. Overall, SF pizza has a long way to go, but  Za is definitely up there. I love going there to pick up pizza and have a beer at the bar while waiting. The staff there is also really cool and helpful. They put our pizza back on the over when we weren't finished with our beers so it would stay warm. And they also deliver for the nights we are feeling too lazy to get off the couch and walk up the hill.

The one thing I would say is that I wish the sauce wasn't quite so sweet but overall a great Friday night treat.
author: Katie W.

description: Definitely my go-to place for pizza -- delivery and eating in. Za is a true Russian Hill classic. I wish they would update the taps a little more frequently -- if they put as much emphasis on their beer as they do on their amazing pizza (see: Scaliano), I would probably be here on a weekly basis. Keep up the good work Za!
author: Andy S.

description:
The best Cheese Pizza I've ever had...but their combo meat pizza was okay.

Small little spot that's easily overlooked.  Great place for a group of friends. 

Staff is very friendly (all men).  No girls allowed in the kitchen. 

All in all....two thumbs up for their Classic Cheese Pizza!
author: Kristen H.

description:
The pizza is good, with nice big slices, and they make some more non-traditional pizzas if you want them (last night the special was something with spinach, and feta cheese I think). It also has a nice little bar area with pyramid hefeweizen and sierra nevada pale ale on tap (or wine if you want it). I don't think there's much better than sitting outside here with a hot slice and a glass of sierra nevada watching the people on hyde.

The one drawback is that it's really small. Only 4 tables inside and 2 outside (plus some seats at the bar), so if you have a few people with you and you want to eat there you might have to wait a while. Also, the service is a tad slow, but not terrible.
author: Chris B.

description:
Yummy!!
So love the name to start with!
and the pizza mmm mmm mm.. 
Have to agree with others that Potesto is my fav of all the pizzas. 

Yes they are a bit $$ for pizza, but so good...much rather pay the higher price and always be happy then get some over cheesed baked bread thing. 

Have to admit never been there only have ordered delivery, and always happy with service they say they will be there 45 min and they are sometimes even faster!!

three cheers for ZA!!
author: Danny B.

description:
This is by far my favorite slice in SF... I'm not a big fan of Chicago style, and it seems that most pizza places here are deep dish... or at least the ones that I hear are good specalize in deep dish...

The best bet here is to get by the slice... one slice is almost equal to 3 normal size slices... I think that 1 slice is a good value for a dinner... getting an entire pizza is a little pricey, but equally tatstey
author: Andrew K.

description:
Best thin crust pizza in the country!  I have eaten my fair share of pizza. Corn meal crust makes this pizza unique. Crumbled sausage topping is what I love.

4 daily specials of pizza slices for $4 and under.
author: Richard T.

description: Great place! Za is a great part of the neighborhood. Friendly service, great pizza, huge, fresh salads and beer on tap. Za is not a big restaurant and can get busy on the weekends but usually you can get a table if you are willing to wait a few minutes. If it's nice out get a table outside and watch the cable cars go by. The pizza is thin crust style and most people eat it with a fork and knife, although some people fold it. The specialty pies are very good, and they will have cheese, pepperoni and one meat and one veggie specialty pie available for slices each day. If you are new to the neighborhood stop by and introduce yourself to Brooks. Za is as much a part of Russian Hill as cable cars and views of Alcatraz.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Best damn pizza ive had this side of new jersey, plus they serve beer, always have a sports page available and the game is on. 

Ok for whoever is giving these guys shit about the service - cmon its a friggin pizza place. can you blame em.
author: Honest A.

description: Well I've got Za on top of my list because they are consistently excellent.  I've had many of the slices there.  My baseline for comparison is cheese and theirs is crispy, fresh and full of flavor.  Great crust and generous portions.  Beer available, the bar is a nice place to enjoy a slice.  $3.60 for cheese.
author: Jeff J.

description: Ok..first of all, the guy was pretty rude at the beginning with us, some of my friends came from Spain and he treated us like "tourist"...we were waiting for a table and when a table was free, he seated a "locals" instead of us..I wanted to leave but my friends were so starving, so we stayed, when we finally ordered and we got our pizzas, i can say that the pizza is an decent..less greasy than the pizza from escape Ny but less tasty as well...i'm more on the side of authentic pizza napoletana,,so really, this place didnt convice me..
author: Aneli C.

description:
I'm trying VERY hard to judge this unbiased by my East Coast standards-- especially New York pizza which is still the best that I've ever tasted.  

So for other than NY pizza: it rocks! In terms of slices, they had cheese, pepperoni, and I assume two specials- one was pesto base with fresh garlic and sliced potatoes and the other was sausage, fresh garlic, roma tomatoes and something else delicious! The pieces were pretty big! I had a slice and a "small" garden salad. The salad was also monstrous and had artichokes, bell peppers, tomatoes, mushrooms and croutons with basil vinaigrette.  It was actually very tasty for something I had thought would be a side salad (they even have a bigger size!). My constantly hungry boyfriend had two slices and was full. He also had a beer though which may have helped! The slices are a little expensive, but it is Russian Hill!

It was a good environment. The people were really nice and obviously had some regulars that were coming in. It also looked like they have delivery because some kid kept leaving with a bunch of pizzas!  It was a little small but we went early enough to catch the window seat.
author: Jess K.

description:
I recently had delivery from Za and am mildly interested in going back.  Delivery took about an hour, which I'm told is pretty normal for the place.  When my pizza did arrive, it wasn't very warm but that didn't stop me from digging in.  

I ordered a medium mushroom and olive pizza.  It did have alot of topping which was great and I loved the cornmeal crust.  It was even better the next day when it was reheated in the oven!  Yum!
author: Kim D.

description: The pizza is GREAT. The customer service SUCKS. Do yourself (and the guy waiting on you) a favor and order to go, don't take too much time deciding, and definitely do not ask any questions about their pizza toppings. This will result in an eye roll and "oh-my-God-I-actually-have-to-do-my-job???" look from the waiter. To quote the other Yelper who gave them 2 stars here, "you make pizza in SF. get over yourself".
author: Laura D.

description: 5 million stars. I've loved pizza since I was like 5 and I never imagined it could be this good. amazing. great people too.
author: Donovan B.

description:
After two good experiences with this place, I'm shocked at how poorly constructed my delivery order was today. Promised 'art,' I expected nothing less. I payed the premium and tipped well, I politely thanked the guy on the phone, and quickly attended to the delivery boy when he showed up at my place. Where did I go wrong? Why did I end up with nothing more than lumps of slop on top of a pizza crust when last time everything was amazing?

The layer between the cheese and crust had been drenched in olive oil, so much so that the toppings slid off the pizza each time I lifted up a slice; it was so bad that I ended up throwing it out. Considering the fact that I live 2 blocks away and had ordered this exact pizza before, there is absolutely no reason for such an atrocity.

If I ever do order from this place again, and receive anything close to something similar to what I had today, I'm going to have to take back the pizza and demand a refund in front of their customers.
author: Oliver D.

description:
Never actually gone to the restaurant--so this is for their delivery only.
Ordered pizza a few times from these guys and it's pretty darn good. The crust is nice and thin and the pizza (for a large) is huge. 

Deliver can take longer than an hour, but at a little more than the price of delivery pizza, it's so worth it. Just wish they were open later. :(
author: Jamila C.

description:
Pretty much my favorite pizza place, at least out of those who deliver in my neighborhood. I take only thin crust and this place does it okay, not like in Europe though. My new favorite is Popeye The Greek: basil and feta cheese. 
One star off for long holds on the phone.
author: Al K.

description: My friend and I stumbled across Za Pizza and ordered a slice of their spinach, feta, italian sausage pizza.  We also ordered some local Anchor SF beers.  Za Pizza has great thin crust pizza with great flavor at a reasonable price!  It is a hole in the wall place, which is usually my kinda spot!
author: Laura P.

description:
This is not the best pizza in town. This is not the second or third best pizza in town. This is pizza though. So if you like thin crust pizza, and happen to be in Russian Hill, there you go.

I think many of the people who love Za's are those trying to relive their college days (or maybe just finished with their college days). There certainly seemed to be a lot of people who looked like they just discovered how totally awesome pizza and beer are the last time I was there.
author: Timothy O.

description: decent pizza, friendly service.  very sweet neighborhood feel with an outside table for those in the mood to sit outside with drinks.
author: Di Yin L.

description:
This place has got a little slice of East Coast hospitality attached to it.  Hell if I know if they are from there, but they are as friendly as any pizzeria I've been to back east and their pizza kicks just as much booty!!

I've been a few times for lunch and a quick stah-p for Dinn-ah before goin' t-ah wiurk before the 5 o'clock b-ah shift.  If ya ord-ah take-out and stick-ah round, they'll serve ya a budweise-ah and ya might get a glimpse of the Sox on the wicked TV bro!
 
I am glad to be back home from the T-Day in B-town, and hats off to one of Za's delivery guys.  I think he's one of the owners- The man commutes from Petaluma everyday to deliver the biggest pie in the city!  God bless him and his mechanic!
author: jonathan b.

description:
"Hello nice Za man. Please deliver a delicious roasted garlic/pepperoni pizza to my house so that I can continue to sit on my couch, watch Arrested Development on DVD, and be fat."

"Right away, Kristen."

Right away turned into 1 hour but man, was that good pizza.
author: Kristen D.

description:
Oh my god.  Za's pizza is the best frickin pizza I have had in a LONG time.  It's definitely not late night pizza, that would be a waste of Za.
and we don't waste the Za.

The Salvador Dali is the way to go.
author: Alison R.

description:
My new favorite pizza place. The old adage about pizza always being good is sort of only true when you're drunk. But because I am rarely drunk anymore because I'm a big puss with a penchant for hangovers large and small, my pizza tastes have become pickier. And by pickier I mean the pie must be hot, and must have normal proportions of sauce and cheese. You'd think everyone would have 5 stars by those easy-as-your-sister requirements, but, sigh, it is not so. 

Except for Za. It's a really real pizza parlor, all neighborhood-feely with dancing children and a little bar and excellllllllent pizza. I like it. It's good.
author: Shannon V.

description:
I LOVE POTESTO! 

What is it? Potatoes and pesto pizza. Sounds kind of weird, huh? But lemme tell you, it's the best!
author: Lester L.

description:
Za Pizza just made me the best pepperoni and sweet Sicilian sausage pizza I have had in a long time. 

Since I had the pizza to-go, I can't comment on dine-in service, but they had my pizza waiting for me just 15 minutes after I called. 

What really sets this pizza apart is the amazing crust. I read on other reviews that the crust was good - boy were they right. The pizza was fabulously wafer-like, but filling. I am looking forward to the left overs!

Give it a shot - they deliver (just not to me...-1 star for that). And even if they don't deliver to you, its worth the drive.
author: Rondeep C.

description:
This place is a great little neighborhood spot. The pizza is delish and the vibe is very laid back. 
I have to give it five stars not only for taste, but mostly for service. When i moved to the area i strolled in there and the staff was very friendly and took the time to chat with me and other customers. Upon hearing that i was new to the area, they gave me a complimentary slice and pint. Other then that perk, it was refreshing to go to a place where the staff genuinely engages with each customer and there was no pretenciousness in the air, like many spots in this city. Each visit since has been just as good!
author: charlie A.

description:
I like this place - and I know that their service can often be sub-par, but there's no way you could break me of this late night pizza habit!
..... the pizza is just DAMN DELISH. 

Honestly - huge slices, piled perfectly with great toppings and a great red sauce with a nice subtle bite. I love the sausage and mushroom, but give me a slice of the potesto (potato, roasted garlic, and pesto) and watch me melt in my seat. 

So, suck it up, go in, pick up a slice to go, and leave...no more dick-service...you can eat your perfect pie in peace.

AMEN.
author: Erin M.

description:
If you live on Russian Hill you will be forever grateful to Za's Pizza. 

They have ultra fresh and yummie toppings, great combos and they sell by the slice. What? Is this sixth street? NO. it's Hyde St sucka. 

I think the kids who work here have a surf nazi gang and the restaurant is their laundering operation. Whatever they make an great pie. 

Delivery: Yes
Sell by the slice: Yes
Beer on draft: Yes
Sports in HD: Yep
author: Johnny H.

description: So far the best delivery pizza I've tried in SF. I like the specials, the service is fast, it's tasty, and not TOO overpriced. Will probably be my go to place when I can't make up my mind on anything else. Definitely worth it if you live in the Nob Hill / Russian Hill area.
author: Katie V.

description:
Potesto, potesto, potesto.

Tip: Go with a bunch of people, drink many beers and hope the Za guys have had a few puffs of their stash. If that's the case you'll have 3-4 slices of pizza and 3 beers for no more than $10.
author: Vivek S.

description:
One of my favorite pizza joints in the city.  This place is typical for Russian Hill in that it seats no more than 15, and is extremely compact.  The crust is really unique, and the topping combinations are great.  Despite being such a small place they have 4-5 beers on tap (Sierra, Anchor, Trumer, Pyramid, and Fat Tire).  These beers must see decent rotation because I have never encountered a skunky brew.  They have a small bar where you can eat if you're flying solo.

Great place.
author: T D.

description: I grew up in NJ and have had a lot of NY style pizza. Za Pizza is definitely the best NY style pizza I've had since moving to the Bay. The slices are appropriately huge and the toppings are delicious (I highly recommend the Meat Lovers slice - especially the sausage).
author: Josh K.

description: I was in San Fran for the first time visiting a friend for Bay to Breakers. I really wanted good pizza.  I picked this place by going to Yelp.  BOO!  Not only did they take THREE hours to get the pizza to us, but they brought us a completely different order.  I called and the gentlemen I spoke with said he would comp the meal. I am hoping he keeps his word, because it is still on my bank statement.  Not all that good, but I am used to Chicago Style..now I know why.
author: Janelle N.

description:
The server was incredibly rude and offensive.  I was totally discriminated against and was humiliated but the way I was treated here.  

Never again.
author: Maggie Z.

description:
My wife has two pet peeves that I like to irritate her with

1.  People who say "Bra," as in Wisconsin surferese for "Brother."
2.  "Za" used as a abbreviation for pizza. 

But because we love Za so much, she lets me get away with saying "Let's get some Za, bra!" on a regular basis, as long as she gets her Scaliano (which, you can order even if it's not on special, btw.)

After moving from NYC, we thought we'd just have to give up on pizza, but Za makes it all worthwhile.  It's as good as - nay, probably better - than many pizza temples in the tri-state area.  

As far as people complaining about the service - you're probably being much to sensitive.  One night, after too many beers, we needed food desperately, but we had no cash, and Searchlight's ATM had already shut down.  These guys actually gave us free pizza because we couldn't pay.  That would never happen at Acquarello.
author: matt h.

description: ZaZaZa!  We phoned in our delivery.  Our choice was unanimous for the "Vincent Van Dough" speciality pizza = roma tomatoes, fresh basil, and cheese.  The red sauce was tasty and the crust was perfectly cooked - slightly crispy but not burnt.  The delivery was quick!  Price is slightly higher compared to the other cheaper pizza places but great flavor.
author: Dayna C.

description: We Like this pizza place! Cozy and family friendly. Walked in HUNGRY and left HAPPY after a single slice each. The owner is super nice and good with kids.
author: Susangela M.

description:
I only come on Friday when I know they are serving Potesto slices.  I am a huge fan of their potato pizza and have no problem eating my slice at the bar. 
Oddly I have seen alot of reviews about the employees and I have to disagree.  They've always been friendly to me and I would say its a very welcoming environment.  :)
author: Sarah C.

description:
This is a great place for a single person to go. Or maybe a couple. Squeezing in a family during their busy time is masochistic.  This place is swamped and people work at a frenzied pace. I wonder how people don't get burned on the oven that opens and closes constantly in the midst of their employee foot traffic. 

Okay, the guys are total guys. Surly, a tad eccentric, and addicted to sports. I've always gotten good service there, but I like to sit at the bar, have a beer, watch sports, and eat a slice and a salad. It's the PERFECT place to go for this type of activity. Place is too packed to try to bring in a group or have a casual meal at the table. TAKE OUT is the solution if you'd like a relaxed, pleasant dinner. 

Their food is excellent. I think they have the best crust in town. Their podesta pizza is excellent. It's fun taking turns between the regular and special slices. HUGE slices. I love their caesar. Wonderful selection of beer on tap. And as long as it's a local sports team they're willing to switch the channels for another game.  

I also like Little Star. And the first time I went there I was bowled over.  Since that initial experience I've enjoyed their pizzas but not to the same extent. But Little Star is pretty darn precious. And they don't have sports on TV.
author: Bubbles L.

description:
CONSISTENTLY RUDE SERVICE.
Tried once. Rude guy on the phone.
Tried twice. Soggy and late pizza on a Friday night.
Tried thrice. Rude guy on the phone. No manners. He sounds like he's got a weight of the world on his shoulders and wants to spread his ill will to all.
Consistently bad service everytime.
The good pizza is not worth it anymore.
I am going to support a pizza place that is worth supporting for its great pizza and great service.
The very first review on this place read: "The staff is made up of aging skater boys."
That pretty much says it all.
author: Grace P.

description:
My friends and I were into somewhere where we could get a few pints and some decent food before beginning the nights journey. Za was just the place. 

Understandably, it was busy for a Saturday night, but that's to be expected. After about a 10 minute wait, one of the patrons was nice enough to give us his table since he was solo and could sit a the bar instead. 

This place was pretty solid. The service was pretty good albeit a bit slow, but that was because someone puked and they addressed that mess very quickly. The staff had the upchuck cleaned up before the aroma got to our table. That was nice of them. According to our waiter, it happens a fairly decent amount of times. People just don't know how to hold their booze!

Anyway, the pizza was good and so was the caesar salad with chicken. If you have a party of four, just order one large salad cause they are huge and more than enough for the group!
author: Chris R.

description: These guys make awesome pizza and set up a real cool environment to hang out in.  Friendly group that provides outstanding service.  Probably eat there about once a week...pretty addicted.
author: Pat S.

description: I went there for a slice of their meat combo and almost slid off of my chair (it didn't help that our sidewalk table and chairs were on a 45 degree incline). So. Good. Not the BEST pizza I've ever had, but definitely up there. It's all about that delicious crunchy crust. If I didn't care about my waistline, I'd be up in this joint everyday, especially since I live like 10 feet away.
author: Amy D.

description:
Russian Hill is a far better place because of Za's mere existence. I love coming here on a Thursday evening, grabbing beers (they always have the Anchor Steam Liberty on tap) and enjoying a few slices of pizza. I think the service is hilarious (if you try and cut in line and sneak a table, you get called out publicly; if its busy expect a wait) and love that there is always a tasty veggie option on the menu.

Best Za moment of late: on a busy night, a girl at the table next to us called Za from her cell phone (inside the resturant) to order a beer to her table after waiting for a while. It was awesome.
author: Heather C.

description:
Craving a slice of pizza and a beer.  Stop over at Za's.  It is totally casual and you can order a slice heaping with fresh vegetables and light on the heavy cheese that is standard fare at most pizza places.  A slice, a huge salad, and a soda will cost you a bit over ten bucks.  You will leave feeling extremely full, so you could maybe divide that into two meals.  I can rarely finish both salad and pizza, but they are nice compliments.

The restaurant has counter and table service as well as coveted outdoor seating on a warm night.  Go here with friends for some chill food or order in for a pizza and movie night.

I would suggest coming in to get your order as phone service is terrible and delivery times are off the charts.
author: apple r.

description:
How can you not love this place.  during the day its a great spot to grab a fresh slice from the two greatest pizza shop owners.  make sure if you see buzz in there (the one with the glasses you say hi)

They have a great selection of beers on tap which always turns to be a great party in the evening when it gets lively and the beer runs like water!  the pizza are hot and always a treat.  they have fantastic names that always make you chuckle when you walk in....

the best pizza period!
author: Harry H.

description:
Honestly I would've given them 5 stars but 45 minute-hour delivery time on a Monday at 6pm? REALLY? 

Thin crust, corn meal pizza was the best part! My roomies and I got the large Moma pizza. It came with 8 huge slices. Loved everything about it!

I would order from them again, but I think I'd just walk the 5 blocks to get my pie then wait 45 minutes to have it come to me.
author: Rana A.

description:
I've had Za many many times. No need to rehash what everyone else has said. Good, solid pie, no doubt. "Potesto" is fantastic - thin crust, pesto with roasted garlic and potato slices. Only problem with this place is delivery. We have more or less given up on this place because delivery times are so ridiculous. Mind you, we live less than 10 blocks away from the restaurant. 
Tonight, on Super Tuesday, we thought we'd try for the "ultimate pie." To be fair, when we called they did warn us that they were busy because it was Election night. But 2 hours? Come on. We waited almost 2 hours exactly for our pizza. I don't care where it comes from, that's beyond ridiculous and once again the last time we'll order from this place for a long long time.
author: Matt H.

description: I wish they had whole wheat crust.  They seem to have terrible attitudes but the pizza is good.
author: Frank M.

description:
Try the Potesto - potato and pesto pizza!  And the aging skater-boy staff the T-Bone mentioned? They often seem stoned, if still lucid. You might be able to get something other than pepperoni with your pizza if you know what I mean which I am sure that I do not.

Update:
I still love the pizza but the service? Get off the grumpy pills.
author: patrick g.

description:
mmmmm - I used to live in this neighborhood, and ZA was a 2-3 time a month dinner and leftover breakfast.  I love the Van Dough, the Potesto, and the cornmeal crust. I now live in the Inner Richmond and miss this little gem... so much, that I actually drive across town for some take out. Lame, I know.

This is a great place to eat in as well. And on those great sunny San Francisco days, they have a few tables outside as well. That is, if you don't mind eating on the side of a hill!
author: Kate Y.

description:
Great little neighborhood spot to grab a slice of pizza and fill up on a salad. Service ain't bad- especially last night w/ our sassy server who kept the sarcastic comments coming!

They've usually got about 3 pizza-by-the-slices available: 2 special creations, and 1 pepperoni, while they also have yummy looking options for their pies. Salad portions are plentiful w/ "Caezar" Salad and Monet's Garden Salad selections and wine, beer, & soda available to wash everything down with.

Their artwork is interesting, especially their victorian house skateboard decks and the scene is super 'lax with a few simple chairs & tables inside and 1 or 2 outside. +1 star for being off the cable car line for easy access & a touch of SF!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
This is a great, neighborhood pizza joint. The day I went, the waiter/pizza cook was very attentive, suggesting which dressing we may like for the salad (and for dipping our crusts). Go with the honey mustard, it is awesome. 

I loved the thin crust, but it didn't hold too well as leftovers. Also, the sauce could use a little more zing. Or something.

Overall, a great place for a salad and pizza. The small garden salad was enough to feed two of us, and had lots of fresh ingredients (lettuce, lots of tomatoes, bell pepper, croutons). Good stuff.
author: Annie F.

description:
Ok, so I frequent Za since one of my dears friends works here. However, the pizza is damn good. There's not much for ambiance here, but that's not really what it's about. There are about three tables, basic pizzeria with no frills. Beer on tap and good salads and there is always sports on the tube so I imagine guys love this place.

I usually request my favorite; spinach, sundried tomato and feta cheese which is delish but I have also tried the specials. I particularly like the potato and pesto special, though the specials change daily and they have some pretty good concoctions at this joint.
author: alexa c.

description:
This is a cute little neighborhood pizza joint.  I'm not to big on the pizza though, seemed pretty average.  Everyone rants and raves about, so I might have to give it another shot.

P.S.  It's usually packed though, so be prepared for a short wait.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Za rocks.  It's probably the best NY-style slice in San Francisco.  They've got a great, crispy, cornmeal-laced crust; a huge, triangular, nicely foldable thin slice; great specials; and good beers on tap.  They spread the toppings around very nicely, and the sauce is good and rich.  Even their salads are reasonably priced, large, and nicely outfitted (but who in their right mind goes to Za to get a salad?).

Seriously, what's not to like?  It's about time I can give 5 stars to a pizza place in San Francisco, because for the most part, the San Francisco slice scene is pretty sad.

If the special slice of the day is a Bluto, get one.  Actually, get two.  Trust me, you'll love it.
author: Marco C.

description:
California pizza. Why do people say it's so bad? Because most of it is. Za Gourmet Pizza, however, is not bad pizza. In fact, it's the best pizza I've had in San Francisco. The dough is just right and the sauce is tasty.

Prices may be a bit high, but it's worth it occasionally.
author: Brooks S.

description:
Amazing pizza. I am a huge fan of thin crust and multi-toppings; and Za delivers every time. From plain mushroom to Da Vinci's Palette (my favorite), every slice is juicy, flavorful with amazingly crisp crust. The Caesar salad is wonderful as well, which is tremendous since I am very picky with dressing - Escape from New York has horrible Caesar in my opinion. 

Just a little too pricey, but possibly worth it.
author: Fiona S.

description:
Delfina is still my favorite pizza place in SF, but this place is very tasty.   Kinda hard to compare the two because Za is clearly NY style versus Delfina's Italian style. 

In any case, last night's pizza had a crunchy crust and exactly the right amount of sauce and cheese.  The toppings (we chose pepperoni, artichoke hearts and bell peppers) were fresh and full of flavor.  

My only gripe is that the pizza is overly salty.  I was dying of thirst all night, so be prepared to down some water.
author: Graham M.

description: Pizza was good, i like the tomato sauce and toppings for sure. The service was good too, they said 40 minutes but it came in 25. I wasn't even home cuz I went up the street to get beer, the delivery guy was patient and waited for me to get back there. The only knock on the place is that they don't make a size small pizza. So it can get kinda pricey, $23 for an average medium pizza with toppings.
author: Steve S.

description: Had my first Za experience last weekend. Called in a delivery order and was pleased that the person on the phone gave me a discount since it was my first order with them (good start). Delivery arrived slightly ahead of the estimate that I got on the phone which was great since I was starving. I couldn't decide on the pizza so I went half moma and half scaliano. The crust was perfectly crispy and thin and the proportions of sauce/cheese were right on - they have been around the block a few times. My favorite was the moma - a great combo of ingredients. Scaliano was not what I was expecting, especially because the spicy sausage is unlike others I have had (think more like a ground beef consistency than heartier sausage balls). Regardless, it tasted great and I would order again. They have made a fan out of me through good service and tasty food... I'll be back!
author: Ben S.

description: THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED.  I ordered delivery and after an hour and a half of waiting I called to see where they were. The man on the phone said the driver called me four times and after no answer he left.  I had never received any calls and when I asked what number they had on file he read me me back my number that was incorrect.  Not a big deal, I understand that mistakes happen.  He apologized and said he would fix it and that the driver was on his way back and would arrive in 10 minutes.  After another 20 minutes the driver never showed so I called back again.  This time the man that answered told me that the driver never went back out to re-deliver, and that they never got my number wrong, that I was wrong and that he doesn't "need to waste his time on me".  I was honestly stunned.  Told them to cancel and refund, hasn't come off my statement yet.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THIS PLACE, THEY HAVE NO IDEA HOW TO TREAT A CUSTOMER
author: Greg S.

description: I randomly stumbled in here and was really pleased with the entire experience.  Relaxed, friendly, fast service.  And a generously sized slice for just $4.60 a pop.  I had the meat special (italian sausage), and the crust was delicious.  Well flavored in itself and the right mix of chewy and crusty.
author: Melinda C.

description:
My wife, her sister, and I drove up to SF today to visit the original Swensen's, expecting to get food there, too. Nope!

The guy running Swensen's recommended we check out the pizza place down the street. So glad we did! Za's is awesome! The guys there are super-friendly, timely, informative, entertaining!

We ordered a medium pepperoni and when they brought it to the table, they were actually concerned that they'd burned it and said they could whip out another one in 4 minutes. 

Honestly, the pizza was fine! We gobbled it up happily. But that totally speaks to how seriously they take their pizza making. And that's officially made it four places in San Francisco I'm willing to deal with driving to just for the food!
author: Taylor N.

description:
Good place for what it is.  There are other places such as Little Star or Victors I would rather go to, but for a place a few blocks away this place does the job. Good pizza by the slice.  We normally come here, split a salad and a few slices and a couple of beers.  Very large slices. 

Just a FYI, parking in the neighborhood is about as bad as it gets.  Take the Cable Car, bus or cab.
author: John C.

description:
If you go with a friend, you can each get a slice and split the salad.  The pizza is good, but I love the fresh ingredients in their house salad - artichokes, olives, tomatotes, a little red onion - excellent.

The pizza salad split is a nice compromise between greasy and fresh...
author: Andrew C.

description:
Unbelievably good pizza! I went last weekend with my mother and a friend for a quick dinner on a freezing cold night. We were there kinda early and the kitchen staff was having a good time laughing and singing along to the music...which was fun. The space was a little cramped for dining in, but since it was early it wasn't horrible. 

The pizza was fantastic! I loved the crust and the topping to cheese ratio was perfect.
author: Jenn G.

description:
Let me tell you why I love Za's pizza.  
   +The sauce is the perfect flavor, just the right amount of spices
   +There is always the right amount cheese atop the pie.  Not too much so it starts some 'cheese-choking' when enjoying your slice.
   +The CRUST.  OK, the crust is the best--- it is thin, so you can kind of fold your slice if you so desire, and it has the perfect amount of sprinkling of cornmeal on the bottom.  The flavor is perfect;  I would describe it almost a sourdough.     It's Zee-best.
author: Karen W.

description:
Definitely a solid pizza place. I think the location is one of the things that makes me love this place more however. It's in the cute part of Russian Hill and it's nice little place. The bad part about this place for many would be the lack of parking so you'd be smart to listen to me when I say that you should take a bus or cable car depending on where you're coming from! 

I have found that the service can be pretty hit or miss depending on the server and the night, but it's still very soild pizza. I'd lean more towards 3.5 stars due to the inconsistant service, but all in all, I still recommend it.
author: Anita B.

description:
Now I may be a  bit biased because I live around the corner from this place but the pizza is good.  However, what do I really crave on a regular basis from here? The Caesar Salad.  It is out of this world.  Seriously!  You have to try it.  It has fresh basil in the dressing or something that seriously makes it to die for.  

The pizza is also just great.  It took awhile for it to grow on me but now I also crave this pizza regularly.  It's just so good and the slices on huge!

Now I do agree with some of these yelpers that sometimes the younger guys in there (usually the ones on weeknights) can be jerks.  But lately the service I've received has been great.  So in conclusion it's definitely worth a trip here for the pizza BUT especially that salad!
author: Rachel S.

description: Great Pizza but the delivery takes forever...try the Scaliano...
author: Pooneet G.

description: So I  took a road trip up to SF and as i was done from taking pictures from  Lombard St  i ended up walking when i saw this little pizza restaurant. I looked it up on yelp of course and when i saw it had 4 stars i had to give it a try, and let me say this place did not disappoint me at all. Im a pizza lover so Im always on the hunt for the best pies around. This pizza was thin crusted, with delicious sauce,and HUGE slices!Mannnnn was it good! Not to mention that the price is reasonably for what you get! The only down side was the space inside the restaurant, its was small, but it did give me that mama pap shop feel!! Plus my gf and I were the only ones who didn't know everyones name haha literally!! Overall if you got time to eat and park your car 3 blocks from Lombard St. give this place a shot you wont be disappointed!
author: Erick E.

description: My favorite casual pizza spot. I live within walking distance so I've been there quite a bit over the years. In addition to their specialty pizzas, the owner (Brooks) offers four slices daily: pepperoni, cheese, one veggie, one meat. I always get the meat option and it's always good. Brooks is nice and there's always a game on. Couple of beers on tap, local art on the walls. I'll be coming here for years to come.
author: Diana O.

description:
The difference between Boston, New York and San Francisco....

The people in New York are actually the friendliest.  Who knew.  

This place is as Boston as it gets.  Mix it with San Francisco attitude, & it's straight out of that scene from Pretty Woman.  Remember when Julia Roberts walks into that snooty store and they refuse to serve her...  it's like that, except on a reverse planet.  

The pizza here is insanely great, and worth any type of misery in order to attain it!  Slices are huge and big enough to be shared and great paired with the Mona Lisa salad... or was it the Monet...  

It's basically a medium sized pizza joint with a bar.  The attitude I can take because it is a pizza place... but if it were a Mexican restaurant...  I might get a little more riled up...
author: L. K.

description: Za Pizza is delicious.  Yes, they make you go downstairs to get the pizza, but it's definitely worth it.  They make huge pizzas with large slices, and their salads are great too.  This place is definitely worth a try if you're looking for a pizza place that delivers.
author: Andrea G.

description:
This is my favorite pizza, hands down.  Not just in San Francisco, not just in California - it's my favorite pizza period.

Ingredients are always fresh, the crust is delicious.  I recommend the MOMA.

There are a couple nice tables outside where you can watch the cable car go by.  

My only complaint is that if you're calling in for delivery, some nights they just stop picking up the phone...
author: Joseph A.

description: This is my wife's favorite pizza joint.  It has a cozy feel to it and the super friendly owner is usually there making your pizza.  The pizza by the slice is large enough to suffice any craving.  Our favorite combo is the Da Vinci's Palette.  After pizza, we usually finish off at Swensen's Ice Cream up the street on Hyde.
author: Chris F.

description: Pretty solid pizza.  I got a large pie, half Moma and half Da Vinci.  I ordered it over the phone and it took an hour to get here.  When he delivered, he didn't bring the side of anchovies that I ordered.  I had to run after him into the street in my sheepskin moccassins and light blue PJ set to get my anchovies.  Overall, some good pizza, I'll definitely become a repeat customer, but I doubt I will ever have them deliver again.
author: Nick W.

description:
I had heard great things about this pizzeria, and finally got some delivered.  While I wouldn't say it was ny-style, it was delicious nonetheless.  In fact, it was pretty close to the tastiest slice I've had in sf.  The toppings were fantastic, and the crust was pretty good.

Not bad Za, not bad.
author: james s.

description:
The pizza at Za is good----fresh cheese and thin crust with a cornmeal dust .  I recommend the Popeye (feta & spinach) with sun dried tomatoes.

Not greasy!
author: Lala B.

description:
I think this is one of the best pizzas in SF, on one of my favorite streets in the City. Tree-lined with the cable cars passing by.

Friendly staff and they deliver!
author: Brad C.

description:
Probably one of my most favorite places in the city. Okay, well I live next door so that helps. In a lot of areas!

I lurrrrvvveee their pizza because I love me some thin crust. And I like the fact that they put potatoes on their pizza. Combined with pesto, you just can't beat it! Try this with a Fat Tire. Sure to please. But please, don't ever ask for a custom slice cuz your arse is sure to hit the floor!

The staff is probably better than the pizza, which is saying a lot. Good luck getting a spot to sit after 7pm, on all nights. Unless you live next door and bring in your best friend who is tall and blond. Then you're set. 

Back to the staff, a group of that consists of skaters, the Angry Hippie, Josie, Jonesie, and Weber, not to mention a few hottie Brazilians and you've got a mix that would lure most to this hidden gem (with not a chance in h*ll of finding parking). Stay late and you'll hear some Public Enemy that I swear brings you back to 9th grade. 

I can't rave enough about this place!
author: Christina R.

description:
Pizza- fresh and delicious.  Always HOT :)

Menu- simple, no fuss no muss.  Even tourists can order quickly.... (yay! now go home.)

House Salad - fresh and loaded with veggies (no bitter greens) and homemade dressing (YUM!)

Wine - standard red or white in cute little water classes.

Beer - good variety on tap

Service - Fantastic!  very personable staff and an owner who takes pride in his restaurant

Decor - Art hanging and for sale, cool paint on the walls, good use of a small space, sturdy but not fancy tables and chairs

Overall feel - VERY inviting, very laid back.

A must-try if you haven't yet  :)
author: Carrie B.

description:
Ugh. I hate this place.

I used to live right across the street from them. I literally could see them from my living room window. Ordered delievery, and it took them over 2 hours to give me my order. I LIVE ACROSS THE STREET DAMNIT. That is just unacceptable ANYWHERE. 

I've seen them start up from the early 90's with every intention to capitalize on the gourmet boom from affluent yuppies that moved into the area. I've seen as their prices go up and up with every year. I've seen as their staff go from worst to terrible.

The slices are small, and the prices are way too big for their britches, just like their egos. 

Avoid this place. All you get is the Marina crowd anyway.
author: Clinton L.

description:
ok, i grew up in NY so i am a pizza snob and I have been searching for great pizza here, though i know not to expect NY pizza. 
I have passed Za many times on the trolley and finally made my way there. this place is a great neighborhood pizza joint. the pizza is quite good, the crust thin and crisp, the toppings very good. did it remind me on NY, no, but will I go back because it is good pizza, definitely
author: Rich B.

description:
I'm just not convinced. Definitely not NY slice, no? 

Too much sauce, too thick blah blah blah. Cornmeal crust. Its ok, the fact I can go in here, order a pie or a slice and then get a beer is a plus, and its nearby, which works. But I think that just demonstrates that it isnt the pizza. 

Judging by the reviews people disagree, and that happens. Only thing more controversial than where to get the pest slice is where to get the best burrito.
author: Jeff G.

description:
My work just had a few pizzas from Za Pizza today, and it was quite good!  Better than what we've tried from Goat Hill and the oft-overrated Amici's.

The ingredients tasted fresh, and the guy that delivered our pizzas was very courteous and friendly.  Their pieces for the large pizzas were big, too.

The only thing that's stopping me from giving this a 5 is that their crust is  bit soft, but it's definitely not soggy like at the other places.
author: Marlon E.

description:
Great pizza at a cozy little place on Hyde! I forgot the name of the pizza we had, but it was piled high with pepperoni, sausage, red onions and green peppers. Yum! The pizza was just the right amount of thickness and was ready very quickly. A large fed me and three very hungry boys, so you know that it is filling. They had a great selection of beers on tap as well! 

Minus one star for our waitress. She was sarcastic to the point where she was hipster-size pain in the butt.
author: Kelly C.

description: Za is my go to neighborhood pizza place.  it's still not as good as East Coast NYC pizza (which I have yet to find a comparable slice in SF), but hits the spot when i'm craving some thin crust pizza.  my go to is usually the da vinci.
author: Helen T.

description: Fast, friendly, and reasonable. Came in for the first time and they ripped a coupon off the menu to save me a couple bucks. Crust was perfect and sauce was rich. Very good cheese pizza.
author: Steven C.

description:
We've been coming to Za's for years, but sad to say, the pizza is not what
it used to be. Mainly, the crust has changed and we find it very dry and
bland tasting.  Even when asking for it to be slightly underdone, it still
comes out dry.  Why did they ever change the crust recipe when they
merged with NY Pizza on Polk. We just tried it again tonight.....to see
if might of improved. but it has not.  Too bad!
RETURNED TO TRY THE POTESTO PIZZA AGAIN.  THE CRUST WAS
MUCH BETTER AND THE PIZZA WAS VERY GOOD.  NOT QUITE 5 STARS,
BUT I'M NOW UPGRADING IT TO 4 STARS.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description:
Ok, I was trying to think of some cute ways to work Za into my review


 Yow Za!
Za Right Stuff!
Who Loves Za, Baby?! (ok that was a stretch)


 But you know what? With pizza this good Za doesn't need any gimmicks or catch phrases. The caesar salad was nice and garlicky with homemade croutons and the pizza arrived hot and in well under the 45 minutes promised (more like 25 or so)
Za is now firmly entrenched in my holy trinity of pizza delivery along side Uncle Vito's and Victor's.
author: tvham

description: yum! we were getting ready at a friends house up in this area. she was on hold for a bit, ordered, and then the wait. my bf made the trip over to pick it up. he said he was on time, but they told him about 10 more minutes and gave him a beer. he said it's small, but pretty cool place. friends bf said a good spot to grab a beer. got a large, half pepperoni, half mushroom. huge slices, thin crust, hot and delicious. she did say it was pricey, but worth it :)
author: Abigail W.

description: I've only used their delivery, and I only get pizza delivered from here. Thin crust, with cornmeal on the bottom for a nice crunch. They also have fresh ingredients, including 2 types of sausage. Great pizzas.
author: Dave S.

description: Such terrible customer service! Haha! Which wouldn't matter at all if this was just another pizza place but these guys take themselves SO seriously! The waiter was a big dick. He gave us crazy lip about being a "restaurant" and not 'just' a pizza joint, then scoffed at us for not getting what the hell he was talking about, mumbled something about going to Escape from New York for that kind of thing. I'm sorry, "Za" dudes, but if you're a restaurant then where is your host/hostess, why don't you have more tables, why aren't you friendlier and why did it take you ten minutes to recognize the fact that we were standing in line, waiting to order our pizza to go?? :-) The pizza was pretty good, incidentally-- too bad these guys are such dicks. Bad customer service cancels out tasty pizza any day in my book. Plus, there are plenty of other great places to go in the Bay! Zachary's, Little Star and Arinell, just to name a few. Try those for pizza without the snooty "Lord Za" attitude.
author: Finley W.

description:
I've been going to Za's for about a year now and I just can't get enough of it. Our refrigerator was broken for about a month and I honestly went here about 3 times a week because it was close and so good. It is a great place to grab a slice or two even though they are a bit pricey they are worth it. $10 for dinner is a good price for most. 

If you don't get a slice I would recommend any of their specialty pizza's but my favorite is the Salvador Dali. Their chicken Cesar salad is not bad either but most people don't go here for the salad. 

The atmosphere in this place is one of the best. It is very small with only four tables and seats available at the bar and outside seating as well. The artwork on the walls is pretty cool and some are for sale. It is usually always packed inside and a line for a table so if you are coming from another neighborhood you might want to get their early. 

All in all, Za's is a great little pizza joint in a great neighborhood.
author: Bryan K.

description:
Za is just around the corner from my place, so I end up coming here a lot despite not being the biggest fan of Pizza. What I love about Za are their inventive slices. It seems like I get a differnet creation every time I go in. The slices are BIG and good value. 

Altough the restaurant itself is small - the staff does a good job getting people seated, and keeping them happy. The TV at the bar is a great relief for solo diners like myself.
author: Asheem M.

description:
I hated honey mustard dressing until i discovered Za's about 7 years ago.  I cant leave there without getting a side for my slice and having it tossed in my money salad.  i would and do) eat here multiple times a week.  Their Cesar is amazing as well.

To top it off the boys that work here are fun to look at when you wait for them to heat up your slice to go, and there is often a good playlist from one of thier iPods.  

Try the Monet Salad with mozarella and chicken!!
author: B H.

description:
Pizza slices were good size and the salad was massive. The waiter was very laid back... didn't really care about anything. He was helpful though. 

I like the relaxed feel of this small place.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Warm nights outside Za, 
Or try your luck at the bar, 
You'll be glad you came.
author: Brian J.

description:
Why this place is great:

1) Excellent Pizza. Wonderful crust. Big chunks of vegetables floating in lucious cheese.

2) Big portions. One slice is plenty for me....

3) Great staff. Friendly and fun to hang.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Za is my favorite pizza in all of SF!  The Da Vinci's Palate and the Salvador Dali are my personal favs. They will deliver, but the bonus of going there to eat is stopping by Swensen's next door on your way home!
author: Genie M.

description: Simple. The way za should be. My favorite in the city, though I do miss Mozzarella di Buffala in the Sunset. To be fair I haven't had Marcello's or some of the other talked about places in the Mission. But for my delivery radius, i.e. the Hill, its the way to go.
author: Josh A.

description: We just moved to Russian Hill and in our obvious search for a great local pizza joint, we found Za Pizza.  Cute, small restaurant with 5 or 6 tables and a bar.  Very attentive service.  The pizza was awesome.  Thin crust and interesting topping combos.  We ordered half "Potesto" (red potatoes and pesto) and half "Van Dough" (spicy sausage, fresh tomatoes and fresh basil).  We wanted to eat the whole thing, but reluctantly brought two slices home.   We will definitely be back and hopefully Za will become our neighborhood pizza haunt.
author: Karli S.

description:
Mmmm.  The best pizza in the city by far...  delicious combinations -- fun names....  I like the Salvador Dali with some calabrese sausage added to it... Perfect!

A bit pricey but worth it if you're in the neighborhood.
author: H.A. ..

description:
Excellent pizza and some of the best Caesar salad you can get anywhere... Seriously... The crew that works here is very laid-back and helpful and the owners are solid... 
Disclaimer: I get pimped out all the time so I might be biased.
author: Raul L.

description:
Oh how I have searched for good pizza in this city. There are lots of place that are good and there are lots of places that are OK, but I have really only found one place that I would take a cab from the Mission to hit up on the late night and that place is Za.
