description: My boyfriend and I have tried 3 pizza delivery places before deciding Za can't be beat. Pizza Orgasmica is OK, but not worth the cost and the wait for delivery. Amici's is good, but standard. Za is AMAZING. I'm in love with the Popeye. I didn't know a feta and spinach pizza could be so good. They must lace it with crack. We're also a fan of the salad with honey mustard dressing. It's a little on the expensive side for pizza but it is so worth it. The day we figured out the delivered to the Marina was a great day indeed.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Was really excited to try Za. It's right in my 'hood and always pass by it.

So we call em up one Friday. We create our own large pie...delivery takes 1 1/2 hrs!!!  Course we are starving by the arrival. Pie was pretty tasty but nothing spectacular. Cornmeal crust was good. Slices were enormous. 

Am willing to give Za another shot. But still think Pauline's and Little Star win for me though.
author: Jennie W.

description: I'm a big fan of their pizza and wouldn't be going out on a limb by saying it's the best. They use a corn meal-based crust that gives it a great taste and texture. I don't think I've ever had anything quite like it. And, you can't beat their portions. The slices are enormous and the gang that works there are cool cats.
author: Jason A.

description:
i eat there every day...just hoping, hoping beyond hope, that erin will turn my way and give me a big ole smile :)

oh yeah, and the foods good too.
author: spiffy b.

description: this evening at 8pm we ordered one large za pizza and large caesar salad.  at 9pm i called to see if they'd lost our order.  i was told they are very sorry but they are busy (an excuse i never, ever hear from any other restaurant delivery), and that even as we were speaking, the pizza was on its way.   at 9:30pm i called to tell them to keep their damn pizza.  the line was perpetually busy.  after finally getting a ring, someone at za picked up the phone and hung up.  at 9:45pm i called a thai restaurant for delivery because most delivery around here ends at 10pm.   our thai order arrived hot and delicious in about 20 minutes.  THE PIZZA NEVER SHOWED UP and now i have to anticipate tomorrow convincing some imbecile to reverse a za pizza credit card charge.  UGH!  rude liars.
author: Ellen A.

description: great vibe, very chill and cool employees. how can u go wrong when they have Thrasher to read while you drink a kind beer and eat a slice?
author: Bryan M.

description: Delish! Grab a slice and don't forget to add one of their yummy chopped salads to split with some friends.
author: Michelle O.

description: Great locals spot. A bit nostalgic with the cable car tourists oohing and aahhing but great pizza all around. Don't call it in cause they are all about the right here, right now service. And yes...it's all about the Potesto!
author: JA R.

description: Great Pizza.  It's light and it's sits well.  I probably house about two giant slices for their actual pies and mentally, I feel gross but physically I'm alright-like I said it sits well.  Their salads are huge so unless you're in for honking out, I would say split it with somebody!
author: Danielle V.

description: Probably the best pizza west of the Atlantic!  I am fortunate to live only one block away, which is also a curse, considering I eat there way to often.  One slice is bigger then the average human head, and their toppings are amazing.  You can get a slice of pizza, a small salad and a pint for under $12.... can't beat it!
author: Lynne G.

description: ZA is a long time favorite of mine. Just ordered a large for delivery last night. Good to the last bite. We got a half pepperoni and olive, half Canadian bacon and pineapple. The salads are also yum to the tum. Slice it.
author: carina b.

description: This is my favorite pizza in the city!  No, it is not an 'eat in with your family' type of place.  It is mostly take out, but I also rather like eating at the bar- alone or with a friend- and having a tasty pint with my slice.  I think the pizza is delicious.  The spicy sausage is amazing...  I definitely recommend it- but no, not for dinner with your family.  Take them to Allegro for a proper Italian meal.  Za is great for what it is, but come on,  it's pizza.
author: J O.

description: Za or Tomassos? Za or Tomassos? Okay, Tomassos, you win in theory, but since Za delivers and its closer it usually wins in practice.  Tasty tasty tasty.  Love the Moma pie with added feta.  Ding for the inconsistency - when it is good it is the best best best, and other times it can be too soggy.  Plus the boys who work there are cute but pretty moronic and slow to give service.
author: Ashley S.

description: I really can't speak to the actual pizza because I didn't even sit down after being yelled at by the waiter. My friend and I had been looking forward to going all week.  As we walked in and tried to sit down, the watier approached us and yelled "Can't you wait until I wipe the table to sit down?"  Needless to say, my friend and I told him that we no longer had an appetite for pizza. I don't care how good the pizza is - it's no excuse for rude service. I won't be going back.
author: Melinda H.

description: Za is the best place to get a slice of pizza in the city.
author: Chris P.

description: Fantastic Pizza place, fun atmosphere with good beer and great pies. If I get blitzed within a 4 mile radius of this place I am suddenly overwhelmed by a blind, raging animal instinct to find this place. Its majestic ritual of nature.
author: Mark B.

description: I used to live a hop skip and a jump from Za....oh how I miss the smell of garlic and cheese-yummy!  Pull up a seat and grab a slice at the bar and you're sure to spend the majority of your meal flirting with the staff!  The pepperoni is my fav-i think the cornmeal on the bottom of the crust is their hidden secret, i love it!
author: Sue K.

description: This is a best pizza and salad in Russian Hill.  Ingredients are very fresh.  If only parking were a little easier.
author: Jeanne W.

description: Excellent NY pizza.  Fantastic caesar salad.  Friendly staff.  Our entire family loved ZA Pizza.  The only bummer is the lack of parking, but there is a great garage next door for $10.  Worth it for good pizza!
author: Amy G.

description: Awesome pizza with really cool toppings!  Has a fun neighborhood scene that is lively almost all the time.  It is a block from my apartment so my roommates and I are there numerous times every week.  Good beer on tap as well.
author: Cameron M.

description: It's decent pizza, but (as is so common for some bizarre reason at decent pizza places in SF) this place has some annoying attitude.
author: jeff k.

description: Best pizza I've had in San Francisco.   Usually about 4 beers on draught.  Huge slices.  A little on the expensive side for pizza pie, but that's life in the city.  This place is good and you should go eat here (but not at the same time that I am trying to eat here if there is a wait.)
author: Marc C.

description: 5 Stars for sure for this amazing pizza.  I was sitting there last night enjoying my salad and slice while my second slice was staring me in the face saying eat me.  I walked out of there so stuffed because I couldn't say no to that damn second slice.  The food is great and the people that work there are awesome.
author: Brian G.

description: Acceptable pizza, but they've gone down hill over the past few years. I think they started buying cheaper ingredients... specifically the cheese.  That's my guess.
author: Matt W.

description:
Amazing pizza, but I'd never, ever order delivery. Its hard enough to get them to pick up the phone during peak hours, I don't think I'd risk having them bring it to my house. 

If you can go there, definitely do it. Its good stuff.
author: Cam D.

description:
pizza is good but not worth dealing with obnoxiousness or dumbness. they can't get themselves together or on the same page...they deliver to us once and we go to order pizza again one night (because i friend insisted on trying this place despite our non-impressed-ness) + all of a sudden they don't deliver to us + go on to tell me that they never have...funny considering they just did a couple of weeks ago. the conversation went on in the tone with a sense that was annoying + obnoxious. come on guys...you're a small business, get it straight and get on the same page so you don't piss people off. 

don't waste your time.
author: alisa m.

description:
Great Pizza, cold but efficient service.

We were here on a Sunday evening.  Nice location, likable decor.  They have a bar in their shop, which accommodated many patrons eating pizza.  The slices were generous, and the pie was tasty.  

I was a little disappointed by the service.  It was efficient, but I felt it was a bit cold.

Overall, I'd probably visit this place quite often if I lived nearby.
author: Jeff K.

description: I am actually eating a slice of pepperoni from Za as I write this. This place is my favorite local pizza spot - I don't think there will be any reason to look for a different place. The employees are friendly and commonly engage in interesting conversations with people at the bar. I don't think they deliver though, but I might be mistaken (ie, I haven't tried their delivery yet). Good stuff!
author: Tre S.

description: Very good pizza, fun place to chill. I love going here... I wish there were more salad options but the pizza is great!
author: Jessica H.

description: I love love love this place, POSSIBLY the best pizza I've ever tasted.  I go there once a week at least.  It takes a while to get a table but the wait is worth it - be sure to let the staff know you're waiting for a table and watch out for swoopers (clueless people) coming in and stealing it since it's a small place and kinda crazy in there.  Get a glass of wine or beer, take it outside and be patient.  Be sure to precede the pizza with their ceasar salad, not to be missed.
author: Erin F.

description: Great pizza + $4 pints of Anchor Steam.
author: Three B.

description:
Good pizza but watch out...if you order delivery, sometimes the delivery guy walks.  I live 10+ blocks away so....mine was cold, not lukewarm, but cold by the time he arrived.

Also, I called to order, placed my PICK UP order and was told it would not be ready for an hour an a half, maybe longer.  So I said, well, I might cancel then because that is long...and he HUNG UP on me.  I had not even firmly stated!  But he hung up.  The pizza is good, but not worth bad service.
author: Coco L.

description:
best place in sf to meet a friend and grab a pizza and beer. slices are huge, creative, and deliciously made with quality ingredients. they offer one special meat pizza (i.e. scaliano) and one veggie pizza (i.e. potesto) by the slice each night. cheese and pepperoni are always available by the slice.

their caesar salads are great (and big) too!

the service definitely comes with a heavy west coast flare - very laid back, not rushed.

neighbors - don't bother calling to order a slice or two for takeout bc they only take orders over the phone for whole pies.
author: Brian W.

description: Amicis eat your heart out...if you are tired of the same old pizza from the chain...Za's is the place...great food, descent times and prices!
author: Morty N.

description:
I recently ordered pizza for my staff from here for a casual team lunch.
They were delivered to the office and were nice and hot.
All four pizzas were fabulous! I highly recommend this place.
A small piece of advice, just order early as it took 45 minutes to get the order.
author: Jenny J.

description: This place used to be a great place to meet neighbors &/or take the kids out, but no more.  Need to hear your companions?  Forget it.  The rude, sullen staff can't possibly turn down the stereo. Customer service?  These guys think it means the customers serve the staff.  Too bad.
author: Kennedy G.

description: When we arrived in town I asked my cousin for some food recommendations that my sons and I could try.  Nothing fancy or over the top, just real food, real GOOD food. He gave us a few names and then as we were driving around he goes "ZA'S... ZA'S". Thinking he half lost his mind, he finally says ZA'S pizza is THE BEST in SF and very possibly the BEST he has EVER had. Now this is a real bold statement to make considering we are both from New York so I knew we had to try it out.  Well he was RIGHT.  ZA's pizza is incredible!! The crust is perfect, slightly crisp with an outrageous texture and taste.  The place isn't fancy and with four or five tables plus counter service it is down right tiny. They have specialty pies but we opted for plain just to start off with the basics. Soda for the boys, beer for me and we were on our way. It didn't take us long to devour the large pie, and this was also one of the largest large pies I have ever seen. For a nice SF touch you can grab the table closest to the window and watch the cable cars go by. The walk back across Hyde was a bit slower but definitely worth it. If you don't over do it Swensen's ice cream a few blocks up is also worth a visit, more on that in another review.  Good call cuz, you're a foodie and didn't even know it!  MM
author: George D.

description: I love Za pizza! It is my favorite pizza place in SF.  I normally rave about the crust of pizza, but the pizza sauce at Za is amazing. At normal pizza places I normally get pepperoni and something else, but at Za I always get the special (even if may be vegetarian). The special might sound weird, but it is always surprislingly tasty. I prefer to eat there because the people working there are so friendly, and occasionally the owners are there too. Beer always compliments the pizza nicely, especially a nice local anchor. I throw my vote in as the best NY style pizza place in SF!
author: David M.

description:
za is the best pizza in SF

one morning i wanted to order a za pizza, but they were not open yet, so i considered ordering from somewhere else, but my stomach said, "no! gimme za!"

so, i called them before they opened. this guy answered, took my order and i got a pizza delivered. SWEET

i like going there too, staff is super nice, funny over the phone, specials are always good, pizza is just better than any other pizza, nothing more to say
author: Ashley H.

description: Fantastic gigantic thin crust pizza slices, awesome beer selection, good prices, very friendly owner/staff. Plus you get lots of exercise climbing mighty Russian Hill. Some of the best pizza in the city. The crust is really wonderful if you like moderately thin crust and the topping creations are really unique!  This is a nice chill place to eat a slice or 2 and drink some beer with friends. What more can you ask for?
author: C S.

description: I ate here on a Saturday night, and the place was packed.  We waited about 30 minutes for a table, and there was no room at the bar to pull up a chair, and you just felt like you were standing in the way the entire time (it was raining outside, so we couldn't wait there).  I dined with three others, so we ate family style.  We started with the ceasar salad, and it was pretty good, and rather unexpected for a salad, definitely not on the healthy side!  We got the salvador dali, too, but I didn't think there was anything special about that.  Just a bunch of seasoned tomato sauce covered with cheese.  We ordered two pizzas, but I could only finish one slice.  The Hawaiian pizza was fantastic.  I usually don't go for pineapple on my pizza, but this was really tasty, with a hint of caramelizing.  The crust is so thin and crispy, I loved it!  Not too much sauce, and not too much cheese.  Yum! I'll be back for that.
author: Michelle R.

description: Yum! Visited here with friends. Pizza and salad was great. We all got individual slices. Delish! Would definitely go back.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
i only come here when we're visiting the bf's cousin a block away. 
and we only order the potesto pizza (pesto/red potatoes/garlic). it's pretty much crack for me - i love it. 

i wish we lived closer so that we could go there more - at least you are no longer my unicorn, ZA.
author: L B.

description: This is another really good pizza joint and I am hungry and really craving it right now but alas it it not close enough so i will settle for warm thai soup.  i had plain cheese and i liked the cornmeal thin crust and chewy cheese, but i think it's the flavor of the sauce that really gives it that extra kick because it adds a nice complexity to the perfectly salty and chewy and thin goodness.  the chef salad is huge and really good, too.  if you don't like chewy cheese you might not care for the pizza until you scrape off the cheese and just eat the crust and sauce with parmesan shaken all over it like my friend did.  but then you can share the cheese if you take a friend, so it might work out fine.  i gobbled down my pizza slice (and it is a big one too) as quickly and runonlike as this review, just chewing chewing lip smacking and chewing all the same like typing words after words finger tapping and all.  but now i need thai soup so this yummy pizza will have to be fed to some lucky other persons tonight and i hope they enjoy it as much and how can they not, i could not imagine.
author: Today Y.

description: Great pizza!  We ordered a pepperoni and garlic pizza for delivery.....I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because I only live a few blocks away but it took almost an hour to get our pizza (the guy on the phone said 45min).  Also, a large pizza was $23....a little pricey I suppose.  Other than that, the pizza was delicious so I would definitely recommend it!
author: Amanda M.

description: I feel like I went to a completely different place from those that talk about the horrible service.  But I actually never went inside but when the pizza came out to our table outside, the guy was totally nice and very service oriented.  And if you want close to NY style pizza than this is the place.  My hubby and I moved here from NYC almost a year ago and finally - FINALLY - found a place that can come so close to our neighborhood pizza place in Park Slope where the sauce is tangy and well seasoned, the slices are thin and big enough to fold (which my husband always does) and it wasn't really much more than what we used to pay in NY.  We only had slices of the cheese so I can't say anything about the other toppings but for a true NY cheese slice - this one is a winner and we're definitely coming back.  FYI - we're not into California style pizza AT ALL so for those of you wanting that - can't say anything about how good their other pizzas are.
author: lucy j.

description: The Pizza is above average and the atmosphere is pretty cool, but the staff is borderline retarded. They're also not into customer service and have no problem being rude. You're better supporting a place that cares.
author: jacob w.

description: i got an extra-large pizza with 6 toppings for $29 and it fed 6 people, not to mention it was hella tasty. i'm not a pizza connoisseur by any means but i can say one thing for certain, za's has got domino's beat by a long shot.
author: Kevin C.

description:
this is probably as close as you're going to get for a ny slice. not that close but close enough being on the west coast. 

this is a great place to grab and slice and a beer on a nice day.
author: Miss O.

description: Overrated!  Very ordinary tasting and not that cheap.  I always start out with a slice of cheese to see if they know what they are doing.  If the sauce, crust, and cheese isn't that good to begin with, then piling on a bunch of toppings doesn't really help.  Not so good.  Comparable to Extreme Pizza.
author: Tom Z.

description: This place is great. We had a potato, pesto, garlic and cheese pizza, it was amazing and very unique. We also ordered a salad to share with the pizza but I would opt out of the salad next time. Just go and get the pizza and I guarantee you will be satisfied.
author: Lauren S.

description: Horrible customer service coming from the guy who answered the phone. I was gonna order some pizza. The first thing he asked, how big is the order? Ok, that's kinda lazy, due to the fact, I KNOW this is not Dominos pricing. I know how much is one order cost. I wouldn't call for delivery if it's $5.99 pizza or even $10.99. Their pizza is kinda expensive. He's so dumb, doesn't have any idea what margerita pizza is. Mozzarella, basil and tomato!!!!!! He raised his tone at me, cos he has no clue of what margerita pizza is. Go to school or something, don't sell pizza dude!!! He turned me off in seconds!!!! Wouldn't bother to order or come here!!!
author: Clemencia S.

description: just perfect really. pick or delivery. they'll even "thank you for the business - much appreciated!" ain't that nice.
author: F E.

description: i really like the thin, foldable crusts on their pizzas...makes me feel like a new yorker when i eat them.  their pesto sauce was good but a tad oily.  i like the dressing on the caesar salads, b/c it's not creamy but almost like a vinagrette.
author: Helen T.

description: i love this pizza place and i might have to agree that it is my favorite in the city. the specials are great, they have a yummy salad and everyone who works there are super nice. it's a definite must.
author: Jenifer B.

description: the slices are ginormous and the guys that work there are chatty and seems like someone's always popping in the door to say hi to them.  in other words, lots of neighborhood action, which i like.  their by the slice options are more complex than the usual cheese & pepperoni (which they also have), which is nice.  the day i was there they had italian sausage + feta and spinach+garlic+something else.  oh, and they have a nice tv to watch football games on.
author: Zoe L.

description: Outstanding thin crust pizza.  Sauce has great flavor.   Pair it with their garden salad, they have a nice vinaigrette.  Friendly owners.   It's a cozy spot to sit and have a beer and a slice, or you can order it for delivery.  Don't expect fast delivery, though.
author: Grace R.

description: my pizza lovin lover turned me on to this jizoint and the piz-za is absolutely dee-lish.  the dali is our fave.  yummy. they deliver too and makes for a great stay at home watch entourage/niptuck/project runway/greys anatomy/whatever your obession wine and beer date night.
author: Caroline S.

description: Never been in the store but the delivery guys are always sweet, if not entirely prompt.  They do pizza right -- thin but not too thin flavorful crust, saucy, healthy amount of quality cheese and toppings but youc an still see the pizza. I order it for our office of 60 people and they are always happy, although everyone was scared of the potesto. (fine, more for me!) The one with spinach and feta is my favorite.
author: QItty B.

description: I live across the street so this place is super convenient to my house. The only reason ive been there. Personally, not a fan. Id much rather walk down the hill to Escape from NY if I am in the mood for pizza. For some reason i have a problem with a place taking so long to give you your already made pizza by the slice. It's nonsense. One cool thing, and better thing about ZA pizza (that Escape doesn't have) is the dine-in option. They have actually tables and such rather than the counter at Escape from NY. But then again, when you are looking to grab a slice of pizza, who needs the comforts of a dine-in table? i dunno, ZA is just not my thing.
author: Sarah I.

description:
za is the nicest neighbor i've ever had. granted, they don't have a cup of flour to lend me, but whenever i go in they welcome me with open arms (and not in a creepy way). the management is more than nice, even though some take a few to warm up to -- then again, aren't the most valuable relationships the ones that take the most work?

a few perks: 
the lemon flavored water, simply to die for (seriously).

the potesto, though mostly on fridays - i once heard a customer request to rename the day 'friday', 'potestday'. i haven't heard anything so true, or genius, since eli whitney named the cotton gin.

the salads are always fresh and can be altered to your liking, though it may take a few extra winks.

the local artwork and t-shirts for sale really add to the overall charm.

i would write more, but i'm off to see za -- i mean, my neighbor.
author: Julia D.

description: Mmmm, the thinnest crust ever, with cornmeal - even their plain cheese is better than lots of other places pizza with toppings.  Also, they will double cut their pizza for kids!
author: Dawn N.

description: I do not like corn meal on the bottom of my pizza crust, so I wasn't a big fan. Their salads are pretty good.
author: Molly B.

description: potesto, potesto, potesto.  it's well on its way to beatification, right behind the most killer caesar salad that can be purchased legally in the states.
author: Kosuke I.

description: The pizza may be great but the customer service sucks. After 45 minutes on hold we went up there and by the time we got there we were over it. The place was empty.
author: Steve B.

description: the pizza is so delicious, but do you want to know what's even better?   when you go sit in your car to wait for your slice, they bring it out to you.  and do you know what's even better than that?  when you sit in your car devouring your slice of pizza and they come back out AGAIN to bring your credit card that you left with them.  this pizza is so good it makes you lose your mind.  and your credit cards.
author: Kelsey C.

description: I really love the pizza, but man could the staff be more rude and high?  Not so bad that I won't be back but seriously...
author: M P.

description: This is my favorite pizza in the entire world... and I'm not exaggerating!  I told the owner that this was the pizza that I have been searching for for 36 years!  It's a chill place where you can get a slice and a pint of good brew.
author: L G.

description: The pizza is great.  The owner, Buzz is a really nice guy.  Other than that, the guys working there are completely ambivalent to your presence.  Take the pizza to go.  My suggestion: Bluto.
author: Brooks O.

description: Very good Pizza.  We ordered for delivery a large pizza with half being the Potesto which is Red Potatoes and Pesto (different and very good) and half Salvador Dali which was Chicken, Roasted Red Peppers also very good.  Delivery time was quick, Pizza was hot and fresh and very good.
author: Wayne E.

description: Yum!  Great thin crust tasty pizza and great service!
author: Kristi S.

description: one of the best 'good tasted' pizza in SF. great neighborhood, friendly people around.. great services. good place to hang-out...
author: Thomas K.

description: Great neighborhood joint.  For garlic fans the Potesto is tasty and there is a nice selection of other pizzas, salad etc.  Can get packed during prime time.  Good spot for pulling up a bar stool, having a couple of slices and throwing back a coldie or two.
author: K W.

description: Delicious pizza and great chicken ceasar salad.  Special slices are offered each day and the combinations are tasty.  Low key neighborhood spot for when you feel like pizza and beer.  If you're looking for great service, this is not your place.
author: Katherine D.

description: Solid pizza place that right near my place.  Has a great neighborhood feel to it....ill be in a lot.
author: Richard C.

description: The pizza is pretty good.  That said, the service sucks.  I would hate to ruin the employees day by asking them to make pizza or worse, deliver it.
author: Noname N.

description: Seems like most of the younger staff should be working at a skateshop not a pizza place.  If there was a Supreme in SF you'd probably find most of them hanging out there giving you attitude, forcing you to think they are too kewl for skool.  But here we are in SF and they are busy serving up cornmeal crust pizza that, btw, is actually pretty darn tasty.  Is it NYC style?  Hell no.  Is it gourmet?  Not really.  It's some sort of hybrid that can't decide where its loyalty lies.  Too thick for NYC.  Too sloppy and substantial for gourmet.  At the end of the day I generally don't crave this place but when I eat there I tend to enjoy my slices.  A bit pricey for a slice but the ingredients are good and the slices are huge.  It can be annoying at night when the place is all rammed up and the music is blasting.  But, if you're in that neck of the woods it's a great option.  I would suggest if you're a regular in the neighborhood to head over to Slice of NY on Polk & Broadway (which they co-own btw).  Less money, less attitude, less busy, and generally, a tastier slice.
author: Daniel R.

description: Thin-slized, unremarkable pizza served in a cozy coffee-shop-type joint.  Cute location and decor, but the pizza was just ehh...
author: P L.

description: Decent pizza and beer selection. Gets busy in here sometimes and you may have to wait for a table. But, it's walking distance!
author: Paul R.

description: All i'm going to say is this place is the shit, i have to eat at Za at least once a week, nobody in the ctiy is better.
author: Ryan S.

description: What a sweet place. Really good pizza with a lot of beer and nice wine. Get the Da Vinci pizza. I go there once in a while and get a great salad and slice. My roommate always eats there to check out the tall bartender with the long blonde hair. I guess he is  the dj there or something. A place to check out if you in the hood. Good Pizza and drinks.....
author: jon w.

description: Stopped by during a noisy lunch hour for a cheese slice. Though pre-made and re-heated in the oven when I ordered it was quite tasty. Good, thin and crisp crust with tight, compact and spongy bubbles at the very edge. Cheese and sauce weren't over the moon but definetely a step above any national chains. Friendly waiter and free refills on my diet coke, a tad pricy ($3.50) but the size, about 9 inches from edge to edge more than made up for it. Looking forward to trying some of their more adventurous pies.
author: Jeff H.

description: Great pizza, large slices, fun toppings. Definitely not a fancy place by all means, but definitely a fun place for you and a few (no more than four of you) friends to grab a quick, satisfying slice of pizza. Although it's small, it definitely does the trick! Definitely worth checking out!
author: Laura S.

description: yes, yes, YES!! BEST spot in the neighborhood! i live on the other side of the hill & i walk over it just to eat here!
author: O B.

description: What is the deal with the guys that work here? Pizza is pretty good, but I've decided it's no longer worth the abuse you get on the phone. My wife and I frequently flip a coin to decide who gets to be the unlucky sap who has to call them; it's always a wholly unpleasant experience. The last straw came this evening, when we tried to order and the guy told me they don't deliver to our address (which, by the way, is about ten blocks away -- it's not like I'm asking them to drive across the city!) Told him that they actually delivered to us all the time -- I've got eight of their menus in front of me to prove it, since they give us one every time they drop off a pizza -- and he gave me some attitude about how they've never delivered to this area, then hung up on me. Awesome customer service, dude! Looks like I'm off to Victor's. Might not be quite as "gourmet," but it's definitely cheaper and at least they're not total dicks.
author: Sean S.
